Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Data Analyst - Sales Operations Team Lead manages workstreams, strategic projects, and technical tools in the areas of pricing, rebates, the distribution sell-through program, sales contract administration, and account master data management, while providing reporting, analytical, and administrative support to the sales organization in these areas. While the incumbent primarily leads a team of analysts in these workstreams, they also show a capacity to roll up their sleeves and perform the tasks at hand when called for. This role collaborates extensively with internal stakeholders in Sales, Finance, BI, Customer Care, Marketing, and IT, as well as with Össur‘s distribution partners and Independent Sales Representatives ("IRs").




Responsibilities:

Provides effective leadership, direction, and training to a team of Sales Operations analysts; aligns work processes, tasks, and projects cross-functionally
Is adept to step in and perform tasks in each of their domains as needed
Implements process improvements to gain efficiencies, and adjusts processes to meet changing needs of the organization
Oversees pricing processes and rebate programs for both business units, including rebate calculation and resolution of claim disputes
Leads and carries out price increases
Oversees the maintenance and use of sales pricing tools
Manages the distributor sell-through (tracings) program:
Oversees the monthly collection, cleansing, validation, processing, analysis, and dissemination of traced sales data with related rebate claims from national distribution partners
Communicates and resolves related issues with distribution partners; ensures compliance with third-party data providers
Directs maintenance of associated data resources; enhances accuracy and efficiency of processing tracings sales data; develops streamlined process workflows
Oversees Group Purchasing Organizations (GPO) contract administration, including processing of price activation requests, cross-referencing of member rosters to the internal Customer Master, notifications to the sales organization and distribution partners, and record keeping / data management
Oversees distributor contract administration, including local pricing agreements with the validation, calculation, and processing of rebate claims
Enhances and develops internal processes and systems to comply with agreements
Oversees data stewardship in the Americas Account Master domain; provides training and support for Americas data stewards
Leads the resolution of data quality issues and exceptions; ensures data quality metrics are met, applying advanced data manipulation, cleansing, and enrichment techniques
Serves as an Americas liaison to global Business Intelligence and Master Data Management teams, supporting data governance processes for customer and product attributes
Collaborates with regional CRM personnel to lead and perform the resolution of CRM-related data exceptions and tickets
Stays current with structures, principles, and internal methodologies related to Össur’s CRM and account master data.




General:

All employees must be aware, have knowledge and shall have received general training in Quality requirements of Össur. Training takes place in the Onboarding process and in New Employee Orientation. More specific Quality training is job specific.
All training related to the quality management system is done in accordance to the Training Management Process (QM1681).
Exercises good use of company funds and property within the set guidelines. Maintains an honest and professional attitude as the company’s representative at all times.
Contributes to a safe working environment by maintaining own workspace and reporting any potential hazards.




Qualifications:

Significant (6+ years) of Sales Operations experience, preferably in the Medical Devices industry
1+ year(s) of prior supervisory experience
Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of GPOs, distribution agreements, and local agreements
Intermediate (or 2+ years) of experience in SQL; writes queries, builds tables, and demonstrates significant familiarity with database structure principles
Advanced knowledge (or 4+ years) of Excel, including writing and deciphering complex formulas (e.g. multi-criteria INDEX/MATCH), Power Query, Power Pivot, pivot tables; knowledge of SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) and MDX query-building a plus
Intermediate to advanced (or 3+ years) working knowledge of report and dashboard development in Power BI or similar program (e.g. Tableau).
Intermediate to advanced (or 3+ years) working experience with CRM and related projects or development (Salesforce highly preferred).
Demonstrated experience in the use of ERP systems
Demonstrated experience in Master Data Management; experience with Profisee or Maestro is a plus
Demonstrated experience with JIRA or other issue-tracking product
Attained a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
Is highly organized and detail-oriented, a self starter, and a quick learner
Demonstrates effective communication and follow-up
Demonstrates an analytical, problem-solving mindset geared towards process improvement
Demonstrates the ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities
Self-driven and excellent team player
Ability to perform duties with minimal direction and/or supervision.
Commitment to learning and personal development
Willingness to challenge the status quo and strive for process improvement
Ability to identify and implement best practices including new technologies
Energetic and results driven




The US base salary range for this full-time position is $81,356 - $116,270 + bonus + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.




Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus or benefits.

Benefits we offer:

Referral Bonuses
Paid Sick and Vacation Time
401(k) plan with Company Match
Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance
Wellness Program - Save Up To 30% In Your Medical Premiums
Company Paid Life Insurance
Affordable Short- & Long-Term Disability Insurance
Affordable Accidental and Critical Illness Insurance
10 Paid Holidays
Give Back Program – Paid Time Off To Volunteer
Tuition Reimbursement
Annual Performance Reviews
We Provide A Flexible Work Environment To Offer Work/Life Balance
And Much More…
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




Sr. Data Analyst




Burbank, CA




Direct Hire




$110k-$130k




Our beloved client is looking for a new voice within their team. A Sr. Data Analyst to engage business teams to understand business challenges, define analytics questions and apply analysis techniques to generate data deliverables including interactive reports and dashboards. The ideal candidate can work closely with Data Engineering and Analytics Teams to deliver on key analytics projects. This will include data provisioning, exploratory data analysis, data visualization, and in some instances, machine learning and statistical modeling.




Required Skills




Champion the analytics process from business understanding, data understanding, data preparation, data modeling, evaluation, and deployment; lead by example and by training business stakeholders with varying technical and non-technical backgrounds.
Design, enable and maintain trustee reporting, executive scorecards and cross-functional tactical reports on the Plans enterprise analytics platform.
Drive the adoption self-service analytics through the analytics platform for operational reporting across multiple departments including Finance Accounting, Participant Services, Eligibility, Claims and Pension departments.
Explore external industry data to source pertinent data required for modeling purposes.
Continuously advance your skills in par with the industry and those of others on the team through discussions, work assignments, training and mentoring.
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Economics, Advanced Analytics or other related fields as well as equivalent work experience.
Minimum 5 years in a quantitative data analytics role with emphasis on data preparation, analysis and presentation
Experience working with databases, SQL and at least one programming language such as Python, along with statistical and mathematical algorithms to help build models.




Bonus/Soft Skills




Previous work experience in the Healthcare industry preferred. Competencies
Customer focus - Gains insight into customer needs; identifies opportunities that benefit the customer; builds and delivers solutions that meet customer expectations; establishes and maintains effective customer relationships.
Decision quality Makes sound decisions, even in the absence of complete information; relies on a mixture of analysis, wisdom, experience, and judgment when making decisions; considers all relevant factors and uses appropriate decision-making criteria and principles; recognizes when a quick 80% solution will suffice.
Communicates effectively Is effective in a variety of communication settings: one-on-one, small and large groups, or among diverse styles and position levels; attentively listens to others; adjusts to fit the audience and the message; provides timely and helpful information to others across the organization; encourages the open expression of diverse ideas and opinions.
Ensures accountability follows through on commitments and makes sure others do the same; acts with a clear sense of ownership; takes personal responsibility for decisions, actions, and failures; establishes clear responsibilities and processes for monitoring work and measuring results; designs feedback loops into work.
Instills trust follows through on commitments; is seen as direct and truthful; keeps confidences; practices what he/she preaches; shows consistency between words and actions.
Strong ability to blend and wrangle data, create data sets to be used as a basis for analysis.
Proficiency in using enterprise analytics platforms, data visualization tools Tableau, Alteryx, ThoughtSpot, Business Intelligence solutions or equivalent. Experience with programming in Python is preferred.
Knowledge of relational DBMS, specifically Oracle, and ability to script and execute SQL queries.
Understanding of the principles and tools of statistical analysis and machine learning is a plus.
Ability to frame unstructured, complex analytical problems, draw answers from the data and present analyses to stakeholders in a succinct and understandable manner.




Be a part of the ConsultNet difference. As a leading national provider of IT staffing and solutions, ConsultNet delivers exceptional services to startup, midmarket and Fortune 1000 companies across North America. Since 1996, we've partnered with clients to create rewarding opportunities for our consultants, successfully building teams that have surefire results.




In the past two years alone, we have placed more than 1,500 consultants in contract, contract-to-hire, or direct placement opportunities. We understand communication is key to finding the right job that matches your skills and career goals. For us, it's not just the work that we do; it's how we do the work. Our breadth of offerings extends to multiple IT positions in major markets throughout the country, see more at - www.consultnet.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A Career with Point72’s Office of the CIO

The Office of the Chief Investment Officer, led by co-CIO Harry Schwefel, supports the success of our long/short discretionary investment professionals, through oversight and portfolio construction analysis, talent development, operations management, and the continued advancement of the tools and resources available to our teams.

We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst to join the Office of the CIO. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting the data and reporting initiatives of the Co-Chief Investment Officer and ensuring that our Long/Short Equity Platform is making informed business decisions. You will be passionate about gathering, maintaining, visualizing, and generating insights from data.

What you’ll do

Create and maintain data tables and dashboards that allow key stakeholders to view data in a quick and concise manner, effectively communicate insights through visualizations
Collaborate with other members of the team to share best practices and develop new skills in data analytics
Design metrics, derive data-driven insights, and communicate findings in a concise manner to key stakeholders to help improve business performance
Partner with stakeholders across the long/short business to identify data needs and build reporting to inform business decisions
Design data models, ensure data quality, and automate processes where possible
Collaborate with technology partners to design tools to capture and structure data


What’s Required

An undergraduate degree (or above)
2+ years of experience in Excel, SQL, R and or Python
Finance and non-finance work experience welcome, but demonstrated work experience with data is a plus
Team player with an entrepreneurial spirit and good communication skills, with team members at varying levels of technical background
Excellent data visualization skills (Tableau, PowerBI, or software libraries in R or Python)
The ability to synthesize information quickly to provide an independent and objective viewpoint, propose appropriate solutions, and drive meaningful change
The ability to multitask and prioritize assignments while producing high quality work in a demanding, fast-paced environment
Self-motivated, mature, and eager to learn
Exceptional critical and analytical thinking ability
Commitment to the highest ethical standards


We take care of our people

We invest in our people, their careers, their health, and their well-being. When you work here, we provide:

Fully-paid health care benefits
Generous parental and family leave policies
Mental and physical wellness programs
Volunteer opportunities
Non-profit matching gift program
Support for employee-led affinity groups representing women, minorities and the LGBT+ community
Tuition assistance
A 401(k) savings program with an employer match and more


About Point72

Point72 Asset Management is a global firm led by Steven Cohen that invests in multiple asset classes and strategies worldwide. Resting on more than a quarter-century of investing experience, we seek to be the industry’s premier asset manager through delivering superior risk-adjusted returns, adhering to the highest ethical standards, and offering the greatest opportunities to the industry’s brightest talent. We’re inventing the future of finance by revolutionizing how we develop our people and how we use data to shape our thinking. For more information, visit www.Point72.com/working-here

The annual base salary range is $130,000-160,000. Actual compensation offered to the successful candidate may vary from posted hiring range based upon geographic location, work experience, education, and/or skill level, among other things. Details about eligibility for bonus compensation (if applicable) will be finalized at the time of offer.
Show more Show less

  • Collaborate with technology partners to design tools to capture and structure data

What’s Required
  • An undergraduate degree (or above)
  • 2+ years of experience in Excel, SQL, R and or Python
  • Finance and non-finance work experience welcome, but demonstrated work experience with data is a plus
  • Team player with an entrepreneurial spirit and good communication skills, with team members at varying levels of technical background
  • Excellent data visualization skills (Tableau, PowerBI, or software libraries in R or Python)
  • The ability to synthesize information quickly to provide an independent and objective viewpoint, propose appropriate solutions, and drive meaningful change
  • The ability to multitask and prioritize assignments while producing high quality work in a demanding, fast-paced environment
  • Self-motivated, mature, and eager to learn
  • Exceptional critical and analytical thinking ability
  • Commitment to the highest ethical standards

We take care of our people

We invest in our people, their careers, their health, and their well-being. When you work here, we provide:
  • Fully-paid health care benefits
  • Generous parental and family leave policies
  • Mental and physical wellness programs
  • Volunteer opportunities
  • Non-profit matching gift program
  • Support for employee-led affinity groups representing women, minorities and the LGBT+ community
  • Tuition assistance
  • A 401(k) savings program with an employer match and more

About Point72

Point72 Asset Management is a global firm led by Steven Cohen that invests in multiple asset classes and strategies worldwide. Resting on more than a quarter-century of investing experience, we seek to be the industry’s premier asset manager through delivering superior risk-adjusted returns, adhering to the highest ethical standards, and offering the greatest opportunities to the industry’s brightest talent. We’re inventing the future of finance by revolutionizing how we develop our people and how we use data to shape our thinking. For more information, visit www.Point72.com/working-here

The annual base salary range is $130,000-160,000. Actual compensation offered to the successful candidate may vary from posted hiring range based upon geographic location, work experience, education, and/or skill level, among other things. Details about eligibility for bonus compensation (if applicable) will be finalized at the time of offer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Under general supervision, this role's primary responsibility is performing data research and financial analysis to answer complex business questions. Develops timely, innovative, objective analysis and reporting, which leads to fact-based solutions for strategic business issues. Responsible for the Company's reporting, metrics, and KPIs.







Essential duties and responsibilities



Manage the full life cycle of analytical projects: interview business users; capture and document requirements; analyze and validate data needs; analyze data; design and develop any reporting solution; work with business users to determine the best plan of action and make process recommendations; manage the implementation; test and train users
Using statistical tools to interpret data sets, focusing on trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts
Developing and preparing reports for various audience levels, from users to senior management, that effectively communicate trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
Defining new data collection and analysis processes as needed
Mining data from primary and secondary sources, then cleaning and reorganizing this data in a format that either human or machine within Department guidelines can easily read
Monitor for data accuracy, timeliness, and integrity in data used in analysis and reporting. Communicate to appropriate personnel if data inaccuracies exist. Responsible for testing systems enhancements and fixes
Manage individual projects as assigned to ensure adherence to schedule, quality, and accuracy of delivered results. Ensure follow-up so that analysis and reporting outcomes are reviewed and implemented
Learn and continue to gain business operations knowledge. Leverage this knowledge to recommend future projects

Secondary Functions



Perform other job-related duties and responsibilities as may be assigned

Qualifications/Requirements



Bachelor's Degree and at least 3 years of experience in a similar role OR High School Diploma/GED and at least 5 years of experience in a similar role.

Skills/Abilities



An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms
Proficiency in SQL and experience in Microsoft database technologies (SQL Server, T-SQL, SSIS, SSAS, MDX, etc.)
Experience in Power BI reporting development
Advanced skill in Excel includes macros, pivot tables, and advanced formatting
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to clearly communicate findings to all levels of the organization
Demonstrated ability to work autonomously and with a team while executing independent decision-making abilities in a fast pace environment.
Strong interpersonal skills, problem-solving skills, and the ability to handle multiple demands and competing priorities
Experience in diagnosing, isolating, and resolving complex issues and recommending and implementing problem-solving strategies
Experience with data extraction, data mining, data acquisition, data profiling, and data warehouse management
Experience in a data warehouse/business intelligence/decision support systems environment or IT experience
Knowledge of statistical concepts and data mining techniques
Any experience analyzing supply chain, production, warehouse execution, and/or financial data is a plus
Any experience with Infor M3 is a strong plus





This document does not state or imply that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position.

Title: Data Analyst (Temporary)
Description:
The New York Post delivers the best in News, Sports, Entertainment and Pop Culture with wit, irreverence and authority. Over the past 220 years, The Post has evolved into a multi-platform media company spanning print, digital, video, audio, app, television and commerce.




The New York Post is looking for a Data Analyst (Temporary) to join our team. We’re looking for a team member with experience in the analytics process: from asking the right business questions to presenting data and everything in between.




Note: This is a temporary hourly position (not benefits eligible) for a 6 month period of time.




Responsibilities:

Liaise with key stakeholders to build and maintain custom dashboards, reports, and data analysis decks and fulfill ad-hoc data requests through data visualization platforms (Looker Studio, Tableau, etc.)
Monitor and provide real-time tech and tag support of traffic fluctuations to the audience development team
Create audience identity cohorts that segment users of digital content
Merge multiple datasets, including (but not limited to) website data and social platforms
Lead management and implementation of analytics tags, ensuring quality data collection across website interactions, including across distributed content sites
Collaborate with other analysts and data scientists to develop large-scale projects and performance reporting
Lead initiatives focused on analytics implementation, customization, and automation of data collection processes. The ideal candidate will have solid analytics implementation experience across the life cycle and digital platforms (including web, responsive, and native apps) using Adobe or Google Analytics
Ensure that all analytical tracking tags are correctly configured to provide robust metrics and insights




The ideal candidate will have/be:

Minimum 3 years experience in analytics; media experience preferred
BS, MBA, or Masters in statistics, mathematics, tech, engineering, analytics, or comparable areas preferred
A solid understanding of the behavior of online visitors with experience in improving user experience and increasing page views and/or user engagement
Experience in leading projects that include data wrangling and exploration
Analytics tools: Big Query or similar SQL databases (a must), Google Analytics, Parse.ly or Chartbeat a plus, social analytics tools a plus
Portfolio of data visualization work in Excel, Tableau, Plotly, Google Data Studio, Looker, or similar
Extensive experience in Microsoft Excel (formulas, pivot tables, charts)
SQL for relational databases and Javascript tag creation. Knowledge of graph databases and identity management of anonymous datasets is a plus
Experience joining and analyzing multiple datasets
Extensive data validation experience
Great written and verbal communication skills, especially when presenting ideas to senior management
Eagerness to present findings to multiple audiences




Note: The NY Post adheres to a hybrid work model.




Salary Range: $50,000- $145,000




At The New York Post we recognize that attracting the best talent is key to our strategy and success as a company. As a result, our ranges reflect our good faith estimate to pay fairly as to what our ideal candidates are likely to expect, and we tailor our offers within the range based on the selected candidate’s experience, industry knowledge, technical and communication skills, and other factors that may prove relevant during the interview process.




As an equal opportunity employer, the New York Post does not discriminate in hiring or the terms and conditions of employment because of an individual’s race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, gender, sexual orientation, citizenship or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. The New York Post will consider the provision of reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental disabilities of otherwise qualified applicants to enable them to participate in our application process and to effectively perform the essential functions of the job, unless doing so would impose an undue financial or operational hardship. ​

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Data Analyst for a company in Suwanee, GA. The successful candidate will join a new enterprise analytics team focused on providing functional and technological capabilities to support business growth.







Responsibilities:







Collaborate with functional analysts and stakeholders to develop insight-driven analyses that add value to the business
Serve as a subject matter expert on the analytics technological ecosystem
Identify opportunities for productivity improvements through data process automation
Provide support for complex analyses and special projects as assigned
Advocate data literacy and analytics best practices
Develop dashboards and data workflows for enterprise solutions





Minimum Qualifications:







2 years of experience in an analyst role
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proficiency with SQL, data automation technology (e.g., Alteryx), and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI, ThoughtSpot or similar)
Demonstrated self-starter who proactively identifies new value-add opportunities





Preferred Qualifications:







4 to 6 years of experience in an analyst role
Experience with Data Governance practices and technology
Experience with SAP S/4 HANA and Salesforce
Experience with Distribution / Warehouse operations





The position offers a base pay between $76,800 and $105,600 per year at commencement of employment, with actual pay dependent on market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The company is an equal employment opportunity employer and adheres to federal law, verifying identity and eligibility to work in the United States.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hobbs|Madison, Inc is a Business and Technology consulting firm focused on Financial Services. We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our growing Banking segment.

Data sits at the center of all information and helps fuel insight and analytics to empower bankers and service client’s demanding needs. We’re seeking an experienced data engineer with a deep understanding of SQL and data technologies to assist in the modernization and migration of credit card systems. The role will be responsible for comparing data elements across the legacy system and the modernized system to ensure quality, completeness and consistency of data across the systems. To achieve this, the role will work with extracts from the legacy system and the modernized system and will build custom programs to compare data elements across different domains, including customer data and transactional data. The intent is to build a reusable set of tools / programs to perform data validation in an automated and repeatable way.




Our ideal team member will have experience with database technologies, file processing, data migration and building data comparison tools. They enjoy the challenge of large and complex data sources and have a solid background in transactional system data. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of building flexible, scalable & reusable tools and interacting with client counterparts to drive identified discrepancies to resolution. You will work closely with a team of technologists and business subject matter experts to help facilitate the modernization and migration of credit card systems.




Objectives of this Role




· Work with technologists and business subject matter experts to help execute the modernization and migration of credit card systems

· Facilitate the comparison of data extracts between the legacy system and the modernized system to establish quality, completeness & consistency and to identify errors

· Identify false positives and summarize discrepancies between data sets in a way that will facilitate resolution with subject matter experts

· Create flexible, reusable & scalable data comparison tools for data extracts that can be leverage multiple times over the course of the migration and can be used incrementally (e.g., data domain by data domain)




Daily and Monthly Responsibilities




· Work as the lead to identify, summarize, and manage data quality issues between the legacy system and the modernized system

· Work with stakeholders including technology and business subject matter experts to assist in resolving identified data issues

· Experience in credit card or other financial service terms and concepts

· Build flexible, reusable & scalable data comparison tools to compare data extracts from legacy and modernized systems to identify and flag discrepancies

· Track data issues to resolution and maintain log of identified issues and resolution over time, including any “known issues” that may not be resolved immediately

· Summarize and synthesize data quality insights across both systems

· Act as a subject matter expert for data comparison, data migration and data quality

· Build data expertise and identify and support data quality across selected areas




Skills and Qualifications




· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field from an accredited institution

· 3+ years of experience in a data analyst role with access experience

3+ years working in Financial Services

· 4+ years of experience with SQL and flat files to aggregate and compare data across different sources

· Highly proficient working SQL and flat file processing knowledge, combined with experience joining and summarizing data across tables and systems

· Experience manipulating, comparing and cleansing large data sets (1M+ records with multiple attributes)

· Experience in credit card or other financial service terms and concepts

· Experience in system or data migration, including quality assurance of migrated data

· Experience with data tools and formats such as MS SQL Database, Java, Python, CSV, , etc.

· Proficiency in data gathering, cleansing, and analyzing (internal and external)

· Comfort working in a dynamic, research-oriented group with several ongoing concurrent projects

· Conceptual understanding of quality assurance, error tracking and trends

· Strong organizational skills with an inquisitive analytical mindset




What Makes You Stand Out




• Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math, Data Engineering or related field

• Direct experience in comparing customer data sets and transactional data sets for equivalency

• Ability to summarize findings to socialize with subject matter experts and drive to resolution

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're working with a great client of ours based in Phoenix searching for a Data Analyst. This role involves gathering, analyzing, and interpreting large sets of data, and providing insights to help inform business decisions. They will work with a variety of data sources and tools, including SQL and Power BI, and work alongside an amazing team. If you're interested in this position, please apply now




Responsibilities

Gathering and cleaning data from various sources
Analyzing data using statistical methods and software
Developing and maintaining data models and databases using SQL
Creating visualizations and reports using Power BI or similar tools
Collaborating with stakeholders to identify and address business needs
Identifying trends and patterns in data, and providing insights to support business decisions
Building and maintaining forecasting models to project future trends
Communicating findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders




Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, Analytics or related
3+ years of experience working in a similar role
Strong Microsoft SQL and Power BI skills
Working understanding of the data flow design across the entire end-to-end Data Strategy landscape (i.e., source systems, data integration, consolidation, and reporting).

Title: DATA ANALYST JUNIOR
Description:
Aptitudes y conocimientos deseados




Se precisa incorporar a una persona de perfil analítico con ganas de aprender y desarrollarse en consultoría especializada en marketing y transformación digital.




Tareas:




Buscamos un Digital Analyst para nuestras oficinas de Barcelona, con un mínimo de 1 año de experiencia en el uso de herramientas de analítica y reporting que formará parte del equipo de Analytics y Customer Insights.




Trabajará en proyectos donde desarrollará las siguientes funciones:




Analizar grandes y complejos volúmenes de datos para generar insights sobre comportamientos de clientes.
Desarrollar marcos, modelos, herramientas y procesos para garantizar que los datos influyan en las decisiones en todos los niveles.
Análisis avanzado de los resultados de performance Marketing y atribución.
Presentación de resultados a cliente y propuesta de implementaciones para la mejora de resultados.
Configuración de reporting avanzado en herramientas de visualización unificando diferentes fuentes de datos.
Procesar datos utilizando Excel de forma rápida y generando confianza
Diseño y e implementación de Cuadros de Mando.




Requisitos:




Formación: ADE / Marketing / Marketing Digital / Tecnologías de la información / Informática o Ingeniería similar.
Experiencia: Mínimo 1 año de experiencia en proyectos similares a las funciones descritas.
Habilidades básicas en el uso de herramientas y lenguajes de análisis utilizados para manipular y exportar datos en grandes conjuntos de datos (SQL) y para analizar / automatizar (Python/ R).
Nociones básicas en herramientas BI (Qlikview, Tableau o PowerBI).
Pensamiento crítico y capacidades de resolución de problemas.
Apasionado por el mundo de los datos y de la analítica de clientes
Personas con capacidades comunicativas y de interlocución con clientes. No buscamos sólo perfiles de “back-office”.
Orientación a resultados, capacidad analítica y espíritu de equipo.
Alto nivel de inglés




Ofrecemos:




Puesto de trabajo en nuestras oficinas situadas en el centro de Barcelona.
Formar parte de un equipo multicultural con los profesionales más cualificados, que te acompañarán y guiarán en tu día a día.
Trabajar en proyectos tecnológicamente punteros y altamente desafiantes para clientes líderes en sus sectores.
Disponer de un plan formativo a tu medida que te permita seguir desarrollándote tanto personal como profesionalmente con nosotros.
Contar con un seguimiento personalizado de tu carrera, con revisiones de rendimiento periódicas acompañadas de revisiones salariales.
Trabajar en un entorno dinámico y flexible.
Modelo de trabajo híbrido (online/ presencial)
Disfrutar de 22 días de vacaciones además de 5 días en Navidad, 4 días en Semana Santa y jornada intensiva del 1 de Julio al 15 de septiembre.
Acceder a los numerosos beneficios sociales que ofrecemos, tales como seguro de vida y accidentes, subvención del seguro médico para ti y para tu familia, descuentos en gimnasios, ventajas fiscales en Ticket Restaurant, Guardería y Transporte y mucho más.
Generar impacto social y medioambiental, participando en las iniciativas organizadas por nuestra área de Responsabilidad Social Corporativa.
Participar en actividades y eventos extralaborales (campeonatos de eGames, concursos, afterworks…) que fomentan un gran ambiente de trabajo y que consideramos nuestro mayor logro.




Descripción de la Firma




Firma líder en la prestación de servicios profesionales en España y a nivel mundial. Nuestra misión es mantener el estándar de alta calidad alcanzado gracias a la labor diaria de los más de 10.000 profesionales que trabajan con nosotros en nuestras oficinas repartidas por toda España.




Esta diversidad geográfica permite ofrecer un servicio ágil y eficaz a sus clientes. La compañía ha sido valorada por universitarios, empleados y la población en general, como una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en España, gracias a sus políticas de carrera profesional, formación y entorno de trabajo.




Siempre enfocados a las necesidades específicas de cada tipo de negocio, desarrollamos soluciones personalizadas en las áreas de Auditoría, Consultoría, Gestión del Riesgo, Asesoramiento Legal y Fiscal y Asesoramiento en Transacciones.




Nuestro verdadero éxito depende de la capacidad de su equipo humano, ¿te animas a unirte a nosotros?




Descripción de la Línea de negocio de Digital




La unidad de Digital es un equipo creativo e innovador dentro de la firma.




Nuestro trabajo se basa en el conocimiento profundo de los clientes, el mercado potencial y el entorno competitivo para generar una experiencia de cliente diferencial. Nuestras soluciones se centran en las áreas de modelos de negocio de digital, gestión de campañas, analítica web, redes sociales, gestión de contenidos y optimización en medios digitales.




¿Qué nos hace diferentes?




Nuestra diferencia proviene de nuestra diversidad. Tenemos la visión de negocio de un asesor, la capacidad de diseño de una agencia creativa y el conocimiento de la ingeniería de una empresa de tecnología. Ofrecemos propuestas integradas a nuestros clientes en el futuro de la tecnología digital, soluciones que llevan en esencia un intenso compromiso con la calidad.




¿Quieres trabajar con nosotros?




Ofrecemos proyectos de alto nivel, atractivos, dinámicos y con visión de futuro.




Si quieres ver cómo tu trabajo tiene un impacto real en los clientes y personas, te gustan los retos tecnológicos y crees que nunca se deja de aprender… ¡No lo dudes, únete a nosotros!
Show more Show less
HTML:
Aptitudes y conocimientos deseados


Se precisa incorporar a una persona de perfil analítico con ganas de aprender y desarrollarse en consultoría especializada en marketing y transformación digital.


Tareas:


Buscamos un Digital Analyst para nuestras oficinas de Barcelona, con un mínimo de 1 año de experiencia en el uso de herramientas de analítica y reporting que formará parte del equipo de Analytics y Customer Insights.


Trabajará en proyectos donde desarrollará las siguientes funciones:


  • Analizar grandes y complejos volúmenes de datos para generar insights sobre comportamientos de clientes.
  • Desarrollar marcos, modelos, herramientas y procesos para garantizar que los datos influyan en las decisiones en todos los niveles.
  • Análisis avanzado de los resultados de performance Marketing y atribución.
  • Presentación de resultados a cliente y propuesta de implementaciones para la mejora de resultados.
  • Configuración de reporting avanzado en herramientas de visualización unificando diferentes fuentes de datos.
  • Procesar datos utilizando Excel de forma rápida y generando confianza
  • Diseño y e implementación de Cuadros de Mando.


Requisitos:


  • Formación: ADE / Marketing / Marketing Digital / Tecnologías de la información / Informática o Ingeniería similar.
  • Experiencia: Mínimo 1 año de experiencia en proyectos similares a las funciones descritas.
  • Habilidades básicas en el uso de herramientas y lenguajes de análisis utilizados para manipular y exportar datos en grandes conjuntos de datos (SQL) y para analizar / automatizar (Python/ R).
  • Nociones básicas en herramientas BI (Qlikview, Tableau o PowerBI).
  • Pensamiento crítico y capacidades de resolución de problemas.
  • Apasionado por el mundo de los datos y de la analítica de clientes
  • Personas con capacidades comunicativas y de interlocución con clientes. No buscamos sólo perfiles de “back-office”.
  • Orientación a resultados, capacidad analítica y espíritu de equipo.
  • Alto nivel de inglés


Ofrecemos:


  • Puesto de trabajo en nuestras oficinas situadas en el centro de Barcelona.
  • Formar parte de un equipo multicultural con los profesionales más cualificados, que te acompañarán y guiarán en tu día a día.
  • Trabajar en proyectos tecnológicamente punteros y altamente desafiantes para clientes líderes en sus sectores.
  • Disponer de un plan formativo a tu medida que te permita seguir desarrollándote tanto personal como profesionalmente con nosotros.
  • Contar con un seguimiento personalizado de tu carrera, con revisiones de rendimiento periódicas acompañadas de revisiones salariales.
  • Trabajar en un entorno dinámico y flexible.
  • Modelo de trabajo híbrido (online/ presencial)
  • Disfrutar de 22 días de vacaciones además de 5 días en Navidad, 4 días en Semana Santa y jornada intensiva del 1 de Julio al 15 de septiembre.
  • Acceder a los numerosos beneficios sociales que ofrecemos, tales como seguro de vida y accidentes, subvención del seguro médico para ti y para tu familia, descuentos en gimnasios, ventajas fiscales en Ticket Restaurant, Guardería y Transporte y mucho más.
  • Generar impacto social y medioambiental, participando en las iniciativas organizadas por nuestra área de Responsabilidad Social Corporativa.
  • Participar en actividades y eventos extralaborales (campeonatos de eGames, concursos, afterworks…) que fomentan un gran ambiente de trabajo y que consideramos nuestro mayor logro.


Descripción de la Firma


Firma líder en la prestación de servicios profesionales en España y a nivel mundial. Nuestra misión es mantener el estándar de alta calidad alcanzado gracias a la labor diaria de los más de 10.000 profesionales que trabajan con nosotros en nuestras oficinas repartidas por toda España.


Esta diversidad geográfica permite ofrecer un servicio ágil y eficaz a sus clientes. La compañía ha sido valorada por universitarios, empleados y la población en general, como una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en España, gracias a sus políticas de carrera profesional, formación y entorno de trabajo.


Siempre enfocados a las necesidades específicas de cada tipo de negocio, desarrollamos soluciones personalizadas en las áreas de Auditoría, Consultoría, Gestión del Riesgo, Asesoramiento Legal y Fiscal y Asesoramiento en Transacciones.


Nuestro verdadero éxito depende de la capacidad de su equipo humano, ¿te animas a unirte a nosotros?

¿Qué nos hace diferentes?


Nuestra diferencia proviene de nuestra diversidad. Tenemos la visión de negocio de un asesor, la capacidad de diseño de una agencia creativa y el conocimiento de la ingeniería de una empresa de tecnología. Ofrecemos propuestas integradas a nuestros clientes en el futuro de la tecnología digital, soluciones que llevan en esencia un intenso compromiso con la calidad.

Title: Data Analyst Junior
Description:
Job Description




About Us




At Technip Energies, we believe in a better tomorrow and we believe we can make tomorrow better.With approximately 15,000 talented women and men, we are a global and leading engineering and technology company, with a clear vision to accelerate the energy transition.Designing and delivering added value energy solutions is what we do.




If you share our determination to drive the transition to a low-carbon future, then this could be the job for you.We are currently seeking a a Data Analyst Junior, to join the Project Information and Toolsteam based in Barcelona, Spain.




About The Job




Your main missions and responsibilities will be to:




Create dashboards and KPI's for projects and/or disciplines.
Analysis of data and information.
Create processes that allow automating the generation of reports and data collection.
Troubleshoot.




We offer you not only a job, but an inspiring journey in a truly global environment where you team up to break down boundaries thanks to the innovation, creativity and pioneer spirit which drive our people.




About You




We’d love to hear from you if your profile meets the following essential requirements:




Degree in engineering, mathematics or statistics.
Fluent English. Fluent German and/or French will also be valued.
Management of the office package, Python and SQL will be valued.
Previous experience in the development of dashboards and KPIs.
Ability to analyze, detect and solve problems.




Inclusion Standards




In our continuous journey to developing and building culture of inclusion, we adhere to four Inclusion Gold Standards. And you?




We challenge our biases and embrace diversity of thought ;
No one has all the knowledge and solutions, collectively we do ;
We foster a caring environment where people are respected, comfortable to share and be heard ;
We promote active listening for effective decision and action.




Additional information:




Remote work and flexible hours.
Applications that have a certificate of disability will be considered.
Only applications that have permission to work in Spain will be considered.




Once receiving your system application, Recruiting Team will screen and match your skills, experience, and potential team fit against the role requirements.We ask for your patience as the team completes the volume of applications with reasonable timeframe.Check your application progress periodically via personal account from created candidate profile during your application.




We invite you to get to know more about our company by visiting www.technipenergies.com and follow us on LinkedIn , Instagram , Facebook , Twitter , Youtube for company updates.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
AirDNA is a Denver-based technology startup revolutionizing the vacation rental industry, with a big office in Barcelona. In less than seven years, AirDNA has established itself as the leading provider of data and analytics for the $140 billion dollar industry. Our customer roster includes a who’s who of investment banks, hotels, hedge funds, real estate investors, and vacation rental pros. We are bootstrapped, profitable, and ambitious.




We have one of the most impactful datasets to come about in recent years. The short term rental industry has seen staggering growth, capturing the attention of hosts, real estate investors, hedge funds, the largest hotel players and beyond.




The AirDNA Team




At AirDNA, we’re a team of data nerds on a mission to empower our customers to smartly grow their businesses. And we're looking for people with a broad range of experiences and perspectives, who are excited by our mission, values, and drive to change the short-term rental market. In short: Life is never boring here. And we genuinely live and breathe our company values: Happy, Hungry and Honest. People who are ready to exemplify these values are especially encouraged to apply. We invite you to apply even if you are unsure about whether you meet every single requirement in this posting. We carefully consider every application, not just those that check off all the boxes.




Your role




AirDNA is searching for a talented Technical Data Analyst to support our teams in Barcelona. You will be responsible for creating and maintaining pipelines/scripts for data exports and customer deliveries and internal processes, maintaining our Sales Tool and creating and analyzing custom datasets for our Public Relations, Customer Experience, and Sales teams.




We are looking for a hungry troubleshooter, with an analytical mindset and eagerness to get to the source of any problem. You need to be someone with an eye for trends and facility to identify anomalies in large datasets. You also care about customer happiness and know what questions to ask when given vague directions and understand what it means from a customer perspective a day of delay in getting a report. You enjoy being in contact and helping several teams across the organization.




Here's what you'll get to do:




Maintain our internal programs and tools that generate our Enterprise Products
Analyze and troubleshoot any problems that may arise with the data and pipelines. Be the Data Expert in the office
Automate product deliveries and other processes
Assist our PR team pulling and QAing datasets that will be used by world leading journalists. Analyze our Tableau Dashboards to find trends in the short-term rental market
Work with our Sales and Customer Experience teams to set up new product deliveries and generate new reports. Assist our key clients with data ingestion and data deliveries
Help expand our coverage by adding new requested markets on demand to our online tool


Here's what you'll need to be successful:




1+ years of experience working with SQL and Python (pandas, datetime, numpy, dictionaries, packages)
Full proficiency in English both verbally and written
Experience with data visualization/BI tools such as Tableau
Good level of Excel (pivot table, vlookups, formatting, etc)
Analyst mindset and an ability to identify automatable processes
Excellent communication skills, data driven, critical thinker and attention to detail
Understanding of what it means to work in a startup environment: self-starter, flexibility, ability to manage oneself effectively
Data driven, critical thinker and hungry to learn


Nice to have:




Bachelor’s degree in Math, Engineering, CS, Statistics, Economics or another quantitative field.
Github/Gitlab exposure
Having worked closely with Data Science, Data Engineering, Backend and/or Frontend teams or knowing what they are talking about
Familiarity with any of the following: PostgreSQL, PostGIS, Jira, Jupyter Notebooks and related toolsets
Experience in hospitality, tourism or short term reantal industry


Here's what you can expect from us:




Base Salary 30,000 euros
62 days per year to work from anywhere!
36 holidays per year
Health insurance with Sanitas (Vision + Dental included)
Continuing education stipend
Cobee card available for public transport, daycare, restaurants and health insurance
Individual growth plan to progress in the role
A fun and sunny office with big terraces
Talented international team and a vibrant work environment
Bottom-up management: we listen to your ideas and implement them
Team building events
Dog friendly office!


Hiring Process:




First stage: Interview with the People Team at AirDNA (Online-30min)
Second stage: Technical exercise
Third stage: Meet a Peer, chat with our Data Analysts (Onsite 40min)
Final stage: Online meeting with the Hiring Manager (30min)
Ideal start date: May


The AirDNA Team




We're a tight-knit group who care about empowering the next generation of shared economy entrepreneurs. Life is never boring here. We're risk takers. We care about each other and lend helping hands all day, every day.




At AirDNA, we believe that a diverse team is a key part of building a great company. If you want to work with us, we want to hear from you. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.




AirDNA seeks to attract the best-qualified candidates who support the mission, vision and values of the company and those who respect and promote excellence through diversity. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, age, national origin, citizenship, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, physical or mental disability, marital, familial or parental status, genetic information, military status, veteran status or any other legally protected classification. The company complies with all applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment and prohibits unlawful harassment based on any of the aforementioned protected classes at every location in which the company operates. This applies to all terms, conditions and privileges of employment including but not limited to: hiring, assessments, probation, placement, benefits, promotion, demotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leave of absence, compensation, training and development, social and recreational programs, education assistance and retirement.




We are committed to making our application process and workplace accessible for individuals with disabilities. Upon request, AirDNA will reasonably accommodate applicants so they can participate in the application process unless doing so would create an undue hardship to AirDNA or a threat to these individuals, others in the workplace or the company as a whole. To request accommodation, please email compliance@airdna.co. Please allow for 24 hours to process your request.




By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Applicants.

  • 36 holidays per year

  • Cobee card available for public transport, daycare, restaurants and health insurance

The AirDNA Team

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Summary

Product Madness is a Global Powerhouse where the greatest mobile games and experiences are crafted by world-class talent. A top-grossing leader in free to play mobile games, we have more than 800 team members working across seven global talent hubs including London (headquarters), USA, Canada, Spain, Poland and Ukraine. With remarkable hit games including Heart of Vegas, Cashman Casino, Lighting Link and Big Fish Casino, we boast more than 50 million active users and 400 million downloads and counting.

We are Mad about games and the way they bring people together, and that passion and culture is what brings us together as a studio, connects us with our partners we collaborate with, and is what links us to our sister studios across the world.

Product Madness is an Aristocrat Technologies company within its digital game’s division of Pixel United.

Job Posting Title

Data Analyst

Summary

We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our sunny Barcelona office as a Data/Product Analyst. You will be working together with other product analysts and data scientists embedded in our games team. You will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning product data from big datasets. Thus, covering the full scope of data mining to reporting. In addition you will also be responsible to show the impact of product data via dashboards and/or other means of visualisations to key stakeholders throughout the company.

What You'll Do

Why this role?

This role is intended to strengthen the craft of analytics in Product Madness and to ensure the game teams are making informed decisions based on actionable insights. Your key responsibilities will be:


Working closely with product and the game teams, implement tracking in games to capture player data and create reports that give further insight into player behaviour and product performance.
Form new insights and perspectives that inform decisions and help us continue to delight the people playing our games.
Produce reports and deliver insights that have an impact on the future direction of our games and the game roadmap.
Work with game teams and DWH to produce end to end data pipelines that empower end users.
Work closely with product and game teams to create reports and monitoring of daily KPIs.
Investigating issues in the Production environment, analysing and optimising existing product features and A/B tests.
Apply creative thinking towards designing, testing, verifying, and implementing solutions.



Why should you join us?

As well we having the ability to grow and develop your career and work for a people first business that looks after all employees, you will also get some amazing benefits + an outstanding salary


25 days per year + Christmas closure + BCN Bank Holidays + Birthday off
Flexibility of 1 hours at the start and end of the working day + Summer working hours
Yearly bonus scheme
Fully hybrid working arrangements to suit you
50€ Amazon voucher for your birthday
40€ via Uber Eats voucher every month - have a take a way on us
WFH allowance of 250€ (one off) to set up your home office
Cigna - Medical Insurance for all our employees.
GYMPASS - free gym membership
Basket of Fruit worth 25€ each month of fruit and veggies sent to your house.
F&B provided at designated PM Games/Social Nights
Referral Scheme of 5000€ per referral hired (to be paid after successful completion of probation period)



What We're Looking For

What we look for in you


Previous experience in a product or data analyst role
Strong SQL and Excel skills
Experience of standard reporting tools such as Looker/QlikView/Tableau/Power BI etc.
Working experience setting up and analyzing A/B-tests would be desirable
Strong in mathematics and quantitative analysis with a passion for numbers and data
Interested in gaming and the mobile game industry, any experience in these industries would be highly desirable
Fluent in English
A Masters degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or a analytical field is preferred
Experience with Python and/or R would be ideal but not essential



Why Product Madness?

Product Madness is so much more than just a Pool table and a foosball game.

We believe in an honest and transparent approach with our teammates. Company wide weekly Town Halls, All Hands and strategy meetings are just a few ways in which we encourage an open and honest path to achieving complete transparency.

Despite a pandemic, there isn’t a day where we don’t feel connected to one another.

With frequent events, workshops, giveaways, slack coffee and donut sessions we have definitely brought on our office culture to this new virtual world of zoom calls.

We also try to cater for all our staff’s needs – be that a freshly brewed cappuccino made by our professional barista in our free coffee shop or by providing a bountiful supply of tasty snacks to keep us refueled and buzzing.

We love to organise plenty of social get-togethers and action-packed activity days, be it slipping inside an inflatable bumper ball for a mad session of football zorbing or throwing caution to the wind and traversing giddy treetop rope courses at Go Ape. On top of these team-building activities, our lunch and learn workshops, not to mention the lavish Christmas and summer parties, foster that ‘work hard, play hard’ mantra. Our offices are based in the heart of the metropolises of London and Lviv, surrounded by an abundance of diversity and inspiration to keep those ideas flowing.

Our Values


People First



We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More



Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive



We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused



We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

R0012841

A top-grossing leader in free to play mobile games, we have more than 800 team members working across seven global talent hubs including London (headquarters), USA, Canada, Spain, Poland and Ukraine. With remarkable hit games including Heart of Vegas, Cashman Casino, Lighting Link and Big Fish Casino, we boast more than 50 million active users and 400 million downloads and counting.

We are Mad about games and the way they bring people together, and that passion and culture is what brings us together as a studio, connects us with our partners we collaborate with, and is what links us to our sister studios across the world.

Product Madness is an Aristocrat Technologies company within its digital game’s division of Pixel United.

Job Posting Title

Data Analyst

Summary

We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our sunny Barcelona office as a Data/Product Analyst. You will be working together with other product analysts and data scientists embedded in our games team. You will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning product data from big datasets. Thus, covering the full scope of data mining to reporting. In addition you will also be responsible to show the impact of product data via dashboards and/or other means of visualisations to key stakeholders throughout the company.

What You'll Do

Why this role?

This role is intended to strengthen the craft of analytics in Product Madness and to ensure the game teams are making informed decisions based on actionable insights. Your key responsibilities will be:

  • Working closely with product and the game teams, implement tracking in games to capture player data and create reports that give further insight into player behaviour and product performance.
  • Form new insights and perspectives that inform decisions and help us continue to delight the people playing our games.
  • Produce reports and deliver insights that have an impact on the future direction of our games and the game roadmap.
  • Work with game teams and DWH to produce end to end data pipelines that empower end users.
  • Work closely with product and game teams to create reports and monitoring of daily KPIs.
  • Investigating issues in the Production environment, analysing and optimising existing product features and A/B tests.
  • Apply creative thinking towards designing, testing, verifying, and implementing solutions.


Why should you join us?

As well we having the ability to grow and develop your career and work for a people first business that looks after all employees, you will also get some amazing benefits + an outstanding salary

  • 25 days per year + Christmas closure + BCN Bank Holidays + Birthday off
  • Flexibility of 1 hours at the start and end of the working day + Summer working hours
  • Yearly bonus scheme
  • Fully hybrid working arrangements to suit you
  • 50€ Amazon voucher for your birthday
  • 40€ via Uber Eats voucher every month - have a take a way on us
  • WFH allowance of 250€ (one off) to set up your home office
  • Cigna - Medical Insurance for all our employees.
  • GYMPASS - free gym membership
  • Basket of Fruit worth 25€ each month of fruit and veggies sent to your house.
  • F&B provided at designated PM Games/Social Nights
  • Referral Scheme of 5000€ per referral hired (to be paid after successful completion of probation period)


What We're Looking For

What we look for in you

  • Previous experience in a product or data analyst role
  • Strong SQL and Excel skills
  • Experience of standard reporting tools such as Looker/QlikView/Tableau/Power BI etc.
  • Working experience setting up and analyzing A/B-tests would be desirable
  • Strong in mathematics and quantitative analysis with a passion for numbers and data
  • Interested in gaming and the mobile game industry, any experience in these industries would be highly desirable
  • Fluent in English
  • A Masters degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or a analytical field is preferred
  • Experience with Python and/or R would be ideal but not essential


Why Product Madness?

Product Madness is so much more than just a Pool table and a foosball game.

We believe in an honest and transparent approach with our teammates. Company wide weekly Town Halls, All Hands and strategy meetings are just a few ways in which we encourage an open and honest path to achieving complete transparency.

Despite a pandemic, there isn’t a day where we don’t feel connected to one another.

With frequent events, workshops, giveaways, slack coffee and donut sessions we have definitely brought on our office culture to this new virtual world of zoom calls.

We also try to cater for all our staff’s needs – be that a freshly brewed cappuccino made by our professional barista in our free coffee shop or by providing a bountiful supply of tasty snacks to keep us refueled and buzzing.

We love to organise plenty of social get-togethers and action-packed activity days, be it slipping inside an inflatable bumper ball for a mad session of football zorbing or throwing caution to the wind and traversing giddy treetop rope courses at Go Ape. On top of these team-building activities, our lunch and learn workshops, not to mention the lavish Christmas and summer parties, foster that ‘work hard, play hard’ mantra. Our offices are based in the heart of the metropolises of London and Lviv, surrounded by an abundance of diversity and inspiration to keep those ideas flowing.

Our Values

  • People First


We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
  • MAD for More


Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company.
  • Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
  • Globally Inclusive


We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
  • Customer Focused


We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

R0012841

Title: Junior Data Analyst - Prácticas
Description:
¿Te gustaría trabajar para la consultora líder en el sector inmobiliaria en todo el mundo?

¿Quieres formar parte de un equipo que ayuda a los clientes a impulsar su negocio aplicando modelos y algoritmos complejos a grandes cantidades de información? ¿Quieres desarrollar tus habilidades en gestión de datos, automatización de procesos y visualización de resultados para conseguir un modelo de negocio data driven? ¿Eres una persona proactiva, creativa y que le gusta trabajar en equipo? Si es así, queremos conocerte.

En el departamento de Data Science de CBRE, estamos buscando jóvenes profesionales, con conocimientos en gestión de datos, para automatizar los procesos de modelización del departamento y ayudar al desarrollo de soluciones predictivas innovadoras que aborden los nuevos desafíos comerciales de nuestros clientes.

FUNCIONES


Participación en la estructuración de las bases de datos del departamento y la automatización de los procesos de modelización
Generación de informes y presentaciones de las tendencias futuras del sector inmobiliario y de la economía.
Presentaciones internas para explicar los análisis realizados.
Participación en proyectos de modelización, tanto econométrica como de Machine Learning, a nivel nacional e internacional.
PERFIL

REQUISITOS IMPRESCINDIBLES


Experiencia en programación en software de inferencia estadística, principalmente R, Python y SQL.
Se valorará la experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos econométricos o de Machine Learning.
Habilidad en pensar de forma analítica, cuantitativa y creativa.
Orientación en encontrar soluciones prácticas a problemas de negocio complejos.
Capacidad de redactar y estructurar informes.
Dominio del Inglés.
Capacidad de comunicación.
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo.
Se valorará el conocimiento del Sector Inmobiliario.
REQUISITOS DESEADOS


Grado en Matemáticas, Estadística o similares.
Preferiblemente Máster en Data Science o similares.
Habilidad para resolver tareas complejas.

OFRECEMOS


Proyecto innovador y diferencial.
Posibilidad de iniciar la carrera profesional en la consultora Nº1 Líder en Real Estate.
CBRE está comprometido con la igualdad y no discriminación, por lo que, en coherencia, espera que, en el marco de las presentes relaciones, se respete tal compromiso y se evite cualquier conducta, expresión, referencia o decisión que pudiera lesionar la igualdad pretendida.

Title: Data Analyst Operaciones
Description:
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en 118 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 80 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 80% por mujeres.

Buscamos un/a

Data Analyst Operaciones

¿CÓMO SERIA TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?

¿CÓMO ES UN/A DATA ANALYST OPERACIONES ONLINE EN MANGO?

Tu objetivo será desarrollar la visión analítica de las operaciones online y generar insights que ayuden a la toma de decisiones de negocio.

En tu día a día…

Ayudaras a definir los KPI los principales y darás visibilidad sobre los indicadores de negocio de operaciones.
Mejorarás la calidad de los datos en colaboración con los equipos de Data y Tecnología
Ayudarás a la operativa mediante reporting/dashboarding y automatización de procesos.
Realizarás Benchmark de los principales mercados para identificar opciones de mejora y gaps de servicio respecto la competencia
Crearás las alertas necesarias para detección de incidencias


¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?

Que tengas formación en áreas cuantitativas (Matemáticas, Estadística, IT, Ingeniería, ADE…)
Que aportes entre 1-2 años de experiencia laboral en análisis y visualización de datos (PowerBI, Looker…)
Que tengas conocimiento en programación SQL y un nivel avanzado de Excel
Valoraremos positivamente experiencia en e-commerce y operaciones
Valoraremos positivamente experiencia R/Python
Que tengas capacidad analítica, técnica y de resolución de problemas. Que seas una persona entusiasta, participativa, con ilusión por aportar nuevas ideas y apasionada por la analítica.


¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?

Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido
Horario Flexible (entrada de 8h a 9h30 y salida de 17h a 18h30), jornada intensiva los viernes (de 8h a 9h hasta las 14h / 15h) y mayoría de vigilias de festivos
Posibilidad de Teletrabajo
Descuento del 25% en todas nuestras líneas además de un Market de muestrario para renovar tu armario dos veces al año
Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería
Retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc.
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallés
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo y cursos específicos en función de tus necesidades
Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings sobre transformación digital, moda y actividades de nuestros equipos
Servicio médico propio, servicio de fisioterapia una vez a la semana, sala de fitness y vestuarios en nuestras oficinas centrales
Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad con un ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso


You got it?

We like you!

Title: Analista de datos junior
Description:
Agromillora Iberia SLU, es una compañía líder a nivel mundial en el sector viverístico y un referente en producción y comercialización de árboles frutales y plantas de olivo con los más elevados estándares de calidad genéticos y sanitarios. En Agromillora creemos y apostamos por incorporar profesionales apasionados por la agricultura, por nuestros productos y por el modelo agronómico que hemos desarrollado y que ayuda a los productores a mejorar la eficiencia de sus cultivos y la calidad de sus productos, impulsando el desarrollo de la agricultura en el mundo.

Actualmente estamos buscando un Analista de Datos júnior, para ayudar la compañía en la construcción de un nuevo modelo de datos y en su posterior explotación.

Funciones y responsabilidades:

Entender las necesidades específicas del negocio en cuanto a uso de datos, y contribuir de forma significativa a su resolución.
En una fase inicial, y en coordinación con los departamentos de operaciones, comercial, finanzas e IT, implementar al detalle la reestructuración de los ficheros maestros de productos, clientes, tarifas, etcétera.
En una fase inmediatamente posterior, desarrollar proyectos de explotación de datos en entornos de BI.

Requisitos:

Formación universitaria de área científico-técnica, particularmente Estadística, Economía o Ingeniería.

Experiencia previa en explotación de datos con herramientas de BI.

Lugar de trabajo: Sant Sadurní D´Anoia, necesario vehículo propio.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
OBS Business School es la 1ª Business School 100% born online en España. Con más de 36.000 alumnos formados desde nuestra fundación, ofrecemos MBAs y Másters online que se adaptan a las necesidades del mercado nacional como internacional en constante evolución. OBS Business School forma parte de Planeta Formación y Universidades (división educación de Grupo Planeta), unos de los grupos líderes en el sector educativo en el mundo hispanohablante.

Para apoyar a nuestro crecimiento a nivel nacional e internacional, estamos en la búsqueda de Data Analyst, apasionado de los datos para el Departamento de Admisiones.

Misión del Puesto:

Dominar nuestra herramienta de gestión de candidatos para la extracción de información.
Gestionar la información comercial disponible en el Departamento de Admisiones a fin de generar el reportings necesarios para el correcto seguimiento de indicadores.
Analizar los procesos existentes en los cuales se recopilan datos para proponer una optimización sustentada en la planificación a desarrollar con los estándares que permita el contexto de negocio y las herramientas disponibles.
Dar visibilidad de toda la información del departamento con diferentes Dashboard.
Dar soporte en el proceso de toma de decisiones estratégicas del área proporcionando datos fiables a partir de la información recopilada.


Funciones:

Dominio del proceso en nuestro CRM
Creación, optimización y propuesta de circuitos
Identificación y creación de KPI’s
Optimización y gestión de BBDD
Realizar Dashboard (cuadros de mando) fiables
Reportes: diarios, semanales y mensuales


¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contrato Indefinido y a jornada completa (Horario de 12h a 21h)
Podrás desarrollarte profesionalmente gracias a nuestros planes de formación y desarrollo de talento interno.
Descuentos y promociones exclusivas para nuestros empleados (masters y posgrados, sellos editoriales, coleccionables, Casa del Libro…).
Un atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales a través del plan de retribución flexible que incluye: tarjeta transporte, tarjeta restaurante, cheque guardería, seguro médico, etc.


Requisitos:

Conocimientos:

Dominio muy avanzado de Excel
Dominio muy avanzado de Power BI, herramienta clave para los reportings
BBDD: Extracción-Transformación-Visualización-Carga (ETL)
Se valorarán favorablemente conocimientos en: SQL, QLIK, Programación PYTHON, Programación R


Habilidades:

Persona proactiva, resolutiva y exigente
Aporte ideas y soluciones
Anticipación problemas
Facilitador de toma de decisiones
Analítico, atención al detalle, estructurado
Fiable, confiable y metódico
Visión de negocio
