Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our opportunity

Zurich Global Employee Benefits Solutions (ZGEBS) is a business unit within Zurich Insurance Group whose objective is to support multinational customers in structuring global employee benefits solutions that cover local and/or international employees in multiple countries. ZGEBS manages and operates captive, pooling and International Program (ZIPE) solutions that combine local insurance policies – provided by local Zurich units or selected external partners – into a reinsurance arrangement for multinational customers. These offerings cover employee benefits insurance risks such as death, disability, accident and medical coverages.

We are excited to invite applications to implement our ambitious objective to grow and expand our business around the world.

Data & Reporting Analyst strives to apply a portfolio management approach and work cross functionally with Sales, Underwriting and Finance to develop, manage and oversight activities in relation to the end to end delivery of life insurance services to our customers.

You have experience in working in a fast paced international business environment, analytic thinker who likes to drive topics from prototyping to final implementation in collaboration with different stakeholders. You like to work in a dynamic team where activities are based on capabilities, skills and willingness to help each other.

Your role

As a Data and Reporting Analyst your main responsibilities will involve:


Manage relationship and activities related to our Network Partners and Customers
Producing Customer and Network Partners reports
Streamlinining processes and data analysis to ensure excellent delivery standard
Monitoring portfolio data and performance
Proactively ensuring customer satisfaction through the monitoring and implementation of related metrics.
Establishing best practice to optimize end service delivery
Ensuring financial and accounting closing are performed according to deadlines
Actively collaborating with other teams and Subject Matter Experts to identify relevant data sources, help develop and improve operational and customer reports


Your Skills And Experience

As a Data and Reporting Analyst your skills and qualifications will ideally include:


A university degree, preferably in an analytical field (Math, Statistics, Physics, Finance or IT)
Relevant work experience of 3-5 years related to the above mentioned responsibilities
Basic knowledge in the insurance business is preferred.
Excellent understanding of data administration and management functions (collection, analysis, distribution etc.)
Ability to work with large data sets across different business segments and extrapolate findings to support decision-making
A good understanding of SQL, Python /R and experience in visualizing data using tools is an asset
Basic knowledge in additional data analytics / visualization tools such as SAS, Microsoft BI or similar tools is considered as an asset
Communication, presentation, project management and relationship skills


Additional Information

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:


Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 80% - you choose
Flexible working hours
Wide range of internal and external trainings
Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs
Ticket restaurant
Life Insurance
Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company
Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you
Special banking and insurance conditions
Exclusive Employees discounts


Primary work location is Barcelona, Poblenou . Please apply with your CV in English.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

Why Zurich

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that’s what makes our team so great!

Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet .

Remote working:
Schedule: Full Time
Recruiter name: Santamaría Rodríguez Laura

HTML:
Our opportunity

Zurich Global Employee Benefits Solutions (ZGEBS) is a business unit within Zurich Insurance Group whose objective is to support multinational customers in structuring global employee benefits solutions that cover local and/or international employees in multiple countries. ZGEBS manages and operates captive, pooling and International Program (ZIPE) solutions that combine local insurance policies – provided by local Zurich units or selected external partners – into a reinsurance arrangement for multinational customers. These offerings cover employee benefits insurance risks such as death, disability, accident and medical coverages.

We are excited to invite applications to implement our ambitious objective to grow and expand our business around the world.

Data & Reporting Analyst strives to apply a portfolio management approach and work cross functionally with Sales, Underwriting and Finance to develop, manage and oversight activities in relation to the end to end delivery of life insurance services to our customers.

You have experience in working in a fast paced international business environment, analytic thinker who likes to drive topics from prototyping to final implementation in collaboration with different stakeholders. You like to work in a dynamic team where activities are based on capabilities, skills and willingness to help each other.

Your role

As a Data and Reporting Analyst your main responsibilities will involve:

  • Manage relationship and activities related to our Network Partners and Customers
  • Producing Customer and Network Partners reports
  • Streamlinining processes and data analysis to ensure excellent delivery standard
  • Monitoring portfolio data and performance
  • Proactively ensuring customer satisfaction through the monitoring and implementation of related metrics.
  • Establishing best practice to optimize end service delivery
  • Ensuring financial and accounting closing are performed according to deadlines
  • Actively collaborating with other teams and Subject Matter Experts to identify relevant data sources, help develop and improve operational and customer reports

Your Skills And Experience

 As a Data and Reporting Analyst your skills and qualifications will ideally include:

  • A university degree, preferably in an analytical field (Math, Statistics, Physics, Finance or IT)
  • Relevant work experience of 3-5 years related to the above mentioned responsibilities
  • Basic knowledge in the insurance business is preferred.
  • Excellent understanding of data administration and management functions (collection, analysis, distribution etc.)
  • Ability to work with large data sets across different business segments and extrapolate findings to support decision-making
  • A good understanding of SQL, Python /R and experience in visualizing data using tools is an asset
  • Basic knowledge in additional data analytics / visualization tools such as SAS, Microsoft BI or similar tools is considered as an asset
  • Communication, presentation, project management and relationship skills

Additional Information

 As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:

  • Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 80% - you choose
  • Flexible working hours
  • Wide range of internal and external trainings
  • Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs
  • Ticket restaurant
  • Life Insurance
  • Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company
  • Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you
  • Special banking and insurance conditions
  • Exclusive Employees discounts

Primary work location is Barcelona, Poblenou . Please apply with your CV in English.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Empresa del sector energético.|Ubicada en la zona del Vallés Oriental.




About Our Client




Empresa del sector energético en pleno crecimiento ubicada en el Vallés Orienta.




Job Description




Liderar los proyectos de análisis de datos coordinándose con el equipo de datos.
Poner foco en el impacto de la aplicación de la tecnología en el negocio.
Liderar los proyectos asignados de business analytics y casos de uso de extremo a extremo, reportando a la dirección del proyecto.
En colaboración con el equipo de data: diseñar, implantar y optimizar una estrategia a largo plazo del tratamiento de la información.
Documentar las distintas fases de los proyectos.
Realizar análisis del entorno y diseñar un sistema de reporting para la visualización de las datos.
The Successful Applicant




Grado en matemáticas, estadística, ingeniería, ADE o Informática
Experiencia consolidada R, Python, SQL/PLSQL.
Conocimientos de Talend.
Dominio de técnicas de aprendizaje automático, técnicas estadísticas y minería de datos.
Experiencia en Power BI i Tableau
Nivel de inglés B2.
What's on Offer




Oportunidades de carrera y desarrollo profesional.




Contact: Alejandro Mediano

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for the next challenge? Do you enjoy Data Management? This opportunity is for you!

Multinational inside the industrial and medical sector responsible for the production and distribution of gases is looking for several Data Analysts located in Barcelona, Madrid, Porto or Lisbon.

Tasks

You will be in charge to generate value out of data by identification, driving and implementing use cases in the area of analytics
This role is aimed to support in definition and execution of global business analytics strategy, help to position business analytics team as central point of contact for all data analytics
The Data Analytics Expert acts as the interface between Business and IT area - defines and discusses content related requirements with business and transform into IT / implements requirements using state-of the art technology
Moreover, you will be in charge of the execution and management of projects within business analytics closely aligned with business, IT
Last but not least, responsibilities like coaching and training of virtual teams and functional areas within the core disciplines of analytics (e.g. Tableau training)


Requirements

You have a University diploma in Computer Science, Business Economics or Business
Advanced level of English language is mandatory
Solid computer skills, including Microsoft Office, databases, web-based applications
Further you have the ability to write and execute complex SQL queries to extract data from a variety of internal sources
Significant experience with Tableau or any Data Visualization Tool is require for this role
Python and/or R development skills would be a plus
You are highly organized and adaptable individual with effective time management
Travel availability (for dedicated meetings, for training purposes or knowledge exchange experiences)


Benefits

Competitive salary
Possibility of growth inside the company
Multicultural atmosphere

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
We are Wall Street English, the premier provider of English language instruction for individuals and corporate clients around the world. Built to be the best, by the best, our highly-qualified teachers, personal coaches, immersive classes, and proven method mean guaranteed results.




Founded in 1972, we've taught more than 3 million students in more than 29 countries around the world. At Wall Street English, every day of our over 50-year history has been about learning, teaching, and investing for tomorrow.




Wall Street English is looking for a Product Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics & BI department in Barcelona office.




The Data Analytics & BI department is recently formed and focused on delivering actionable data insights to help deliver growth and profitability. We identify opportunities by working closely with business teams. We build data solutions including stories told through analyses, clear and actionable visualisations in BI reports and relevant AI or ML models. We support test and learn initiatives by providing robust test design and measurement.




Reporting to the Director of Analytics & BI, the Product Data Analyst will work directly with the Product team. They will be expected to run projects from inception to delivery with limited support.




What You Will Be Doing




The role requires a confident, self-starter who will champion data-led insight, decision-making, and solutions within our Product organisation. They will get many opportunities to develop skills across all data disciplines as we identify and develop new ways of using data to deliver business growth and profitability.




Data manipulation and exploration – exploring new datasets
Designing, building, and improving dashboards and reports with high quality visualisations
Delivering actionable insights to Product Managers
Identifying where data can provide solutions within the Product, including identifying opportunities to use cloud services to build and deploy AI & ML models
Support A/B testing analysis and reports
Work within an Agile methodology, providing transparency on workload and progress




Your Profile




Degree in a STEM subject
Excellent problem solving and analytics skills
Ability to elicit requirements and map business needs to solutions
Statistical knowledge
Strong commercial experience of querying, analysing and providing insights from diverse datasets
Advanced experience manipulating data stored in relational databases using SQL e.g. SQL Server
Experience working with web and app tracking data
Strong data visualization skills using tools such as Power BI
Advanced Excel skills
Experience with advanced analytics using Python or R
Experience working with geographically distributed teams
Native or bilingual speaker of English




Nice to have:

Experience working with Data Warehouses e.g. Redshift




Work Arrangement:




Hybrid (2 days in office/3 days work from home). The office is in the city center of Barcelona.







If you believe you can #GoFurther, we look forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job




Each time we eat and drink, we vote for the world we want to live in.




Danone’s mission is bringing health through food to as many people as possible and we want to invite people to join the movement for a healthier world. We recognize the power people have to impact the world through their daily choices. Healthy food needs a healthy planet, and this is what our new signature One Planet One Health embodies.




Danette, Evian, Activia, Volvic, Blédina, sound familiar to you? Do you know that behind these brands there is always Information Technology pushing them forward?




At Danone, we use advanced and innovative IT solutions which are implemented in all Danone units around the world to contribute to our mission bringing health through food to as many people as possible. Don’t wait, click and discover the Danone IS/IT universe and join the movement your IT skills could be a real asset for the alimentation revolution!




https//youtu.be/MqjF1HxsTyw




About You




Profile & Experience




Minimum of 5-6 years’ experience in the Data & Analytics Domain.
Minimum of 1 -2 years’ experience as Functional or Business Analyst in a product team.
Proven Track record of Implementing efficient and flexible dashboards / reports / data visualization capabilities.
Ability to demonstrate a mix of technical skills and business processes knowledge and proven experience in rolling out a data product in multiple markets. Essential to have experience in experience in data catalogue documentation and manage the product use throughout all the stages of the product lifecycle.
Experience working with Data Architects, Ingestion, Data scientists, Developers and visualization teams in an agile framework.
Strong ability to connect and communicate to distinct stakeholders in a complex organization, managing stakeholders from Global, Local, Business and IT colleagues.
Experience implementing modern data strategies and solutions using cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, Google), Informatica Cloud, Power BI or similar tools.




Competencies




A minimum of a Bachelor's /Masters Degree is required; a field in Computer Science, Math, or statistical background.
Excellent level in SQL-like languages (SQL, Python, NOSQL, …), data warehousing(Snowflake/ redshift/ others)
Feeling comfortable with the implementation of dashboards with the main reporting tools in the industry (PowerBI / SpotfIre / Kibana etc., or equivalent)
Good knowledge and curiosity about best-in-class Data technologies
Experienced in Functional Analysis/ Business Analysis / Data Analysis
Proficiency in English
Comfortable with written and verbal communication - strong analytic mind
Capability to express complex data concepts into lay language for stakeholder management




About Us




As a Data Analyst, you will be our eyes in the ocean of data. We expect you to run experiments and studies to find quantitative answers from simple to more complex business or internal questions, having an easy access, and critical view on our data. This role will help the team to have a good control on the content of the data, the consistency, the quality, and should be able to provide deeper insights into the data.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to take the responsibility of designing the specification required for the developments we will plan to find the right data sources, how to transform them, how to analyze & provide insights, while ensuring the functional tests/validations, and creating the definition of done and make sure it is reached, together with the Product Owners.




We are looking for a candidate who has a strong knowledge on both data analyze/querying Data using SQL/ Python, visualizing through PowerBI and a good experience in turning the business needs into analytical insights and provide recommendations to the business with problem solving techniques.




In this position you will be reponsible for




Data Analysis Expertise




Data Analysis querying and exploit the data sets, tables, read and define the right data marts, navigate into the different environment (DWH, Datalakes, etc.) and extract relevant data for business
Data Based Decision & Advices know how to leverage the quantitative insight from the data while keeping a critical eye to the content/reliability/information provided. Answering questions, providing precise insights or order of magnitudes easily.
Data visualization represent the data insights in synthetic / tailor made dashboards and reports (Power BI, and/or other standard Business Intelligence tools)




Product Support to Data Governance




Knowledge Management keeping an up-to-date documentation / data & metadata description and linking it with the Data Excellence/Master Data Management program and MDM tools.
Monitoring Being proactive in the definition of the data quality KPIs to ensure a well monitored data quality level.




Implementation Follow-Up and Operationel Excellence




Backlog Gather and refine the backlog of user’s stories/requirements and ensure the right execution of the priorities set by the Product Owners & Senior Product Owners.
Turn business needs into deliverables
The description, documentation, and functional tests of new features to be done.
Define the rules to validate the expected implementation of the features / User’s Stories (Definition Of Done)
Validate the deliveries with the right quality/non-regression level.
MVPs Maximizes efficiency in a constantly evolving environment using Minimal Viable Product delivery, and rapid prototyping.
Keep a flexible/agile state of mind, while managing the backlog transparently and efficiently and communicating regularly on the progresses.




Experience in developing innovative data solutions, agile ways of working, intellectual curiosity, and collaborating with small agile delivery teams are critical to enable you to be successful. Furthermore, it is important that you possess strong problem-solving skills and ability to logically analyse complex requirements or processes.




You will be a passionate with the ability to gain business partner agreement, communicate confidently at both the technical and data team level, and collaborate with a wide variety of technical and non-technical teams

  • Monitoring Being proactive in the definition of the data quality KPIs to ensure a well monitored data quality level.

  • The description, documentation, and functional tests of new features to be done.
  • Define the rules to validate the expected implementation of the features / User’s Stories (Definition Of Done)
  • Validate the deliveries with the right quality/non-regression level.
  • MVPs Maximizes efficiency in a constantly evolving environment using Minimal Viable Product delivery, and rapid prototyping.
  • Keep a flexible/agile state of mind, while managing the backlog transparently and efficiently and communicating regularly on the progresses.


Experience in developing innovative data solutions, agile ways of working, intellectual curiosity, and collaborating with small agile delivery teams are critical to enable you to be successful. Furthermore, it is important that you possess strong problem-solving skills and ability to logically analyse complex requirements or processes.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: El Prat de Llobregat, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Giesecke+Devrient is a global company that offers security technologies, both in the physical and digital world. Every day, billions of people benefit from G+D innovations in their personal and business lives. With around 11,600 employees across 32 countries, we develop, manufacture, and distribute products and solutions for the safeguarding of payment processes, identities, connectivity, and data.

At G+D, we are looking for a Data Analyst within the team based in El Prat de Llobregat, Barcelona.

Your Duties

Using automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources.
Removing corrupted data and fixing coding errors and related problems.
Developing and maintaining databases, and data systems – reorganizing data in a readable format.
Performing analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data.
Filter Data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to identify and correct code problems.
Using statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction.
Assigning numerical value to essential business functions so that business performance can be assessed and compared over periods of time.
Analyzing local, national, and global trends that impact both the organization and the industry.
Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.
Working with programmers, engineers, and management heads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies.
Preparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to take important decisions based on various facts and trends.

Your profile

Degree in Maths or other scientist discipline.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in similar position.
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data.
Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, Oracle, R, MATLAB, and Python.
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
Experience in handling reporting packages like Business Objects, programming (Javascript, XML, or ETL frameworks), databases.
Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages like Excel, SPSS, SAS to be used for data set analyzing.
Adept at using data processing platforms like Hadoop and Apache Spark.
Knowledge of data visualization software like Tableau, Qlik.
Knowledge of how to create and apply the most accurate algorithms to datasets in order to find solutions.
Problem-solving skills.
Accuracy and attention to detail.
Adept at queries, writing reports, and making presentations.
Team-working skills.
Verbal and Written communication skills.
Proven working experience in data analysis.

What we offer

Culture and Diversity: Join a people oriented environment with different nationalities and a great team spirit, flat hierarchies (everyone speaks to everyone). Equal Opportunity Employer and LGBT+ friendly.
Global Teams: Enjoy collaborative work in Agile/SCRUM teams and with stakeholders around the globe.
Innovative Products: Design and develop business processes and IT solutions for innovative products and digital solutions.
Career Development: Continuous training and coaching, talent program.
Social Benefits: Private medical insurance, transport ticket, in-house parking.
Flexible work time and remote work: Core time Mo-Th 9:30 – 17:00, 3 days of remote work.
Own Canteen: Take a break with our breakfast and lunch service: Choose between a big range of menus, salad desk and sandwich service. Fruit packages.
Location: El Prat de Llobregat. Easy communication by public transport o private transport.
transporte público Bus 88 y 110 desde Barcelona y PR4 desde el Prat.

  • Developing and maintaining databases, and data systems – reorganizing data in a readable format.
  • Performing analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data.
  • Filter Data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to identify and correct code problems.
  • Using statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction.
  • Assigning numerical value to essential business functions so that business performance can be assessed and compared over periods of time.
  • Analyzing local, national, and global trends that impact both the organization and the industry.
  • Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.
  • Working with programmers, engineers, and management heads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies.
  • Preparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to take important decisions based on various facts and trends.

Your profile

  • Degree in Maths or other scientist discipline.
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience in similar position.
  • Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data.
  • Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, Oracle, R, MATLAB, and Python.
  • Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
  • Experience in handling reporting packages like Business Objects, programming (Javascript, XML, or ETL frameworks), databases.
  • Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages like Excel, SPSS, SAS to be used for data set analyzing.
  • Adept at using data processing platforms like Hadoop and Apache Spark.
  • Knowledge of data visualization software like Tableau, Qlik.
  • Knowledge of how to create and apply the most accurate algorithms to datasets in order to find solutions.
  • Problem-solving skills.
  • Accuracy and attention to detail.
  • Adept at queries, writing reports, and making presentations.
  • Team-working skills.
  • Verbal and Written communication skills.
  • Proven working experience in data analysis.

What we offer

  • Culture and Diversity: Join a people oriented environment with different nationalities and a great team spirit, flat hierarchies (everyone speaks to everyone). Equal Opportunity Employer and LGBT+ friendly.
  • Global Teams: Enjoy collaborative work in Agile/SCRUM teams and with stakeholders around the globe.
  • Innovative Products: Design and develop business processes and IT solutions for innovative products and digital solutions.
  • Career Development: Continuous training and coaching, talent program.
  • Social Benefits: Private medical insurance, transport ticket, in-house parking.
  • Flexible work time and remote work: Core time Mo-Th 9:30 – 17:00, 3 days of remote work.
  • Own Canteen: Take a break with our breakfast and lunch service: Choose between a big range of menus, salad desk and sandwich service. Fruit packages.
  • Location: El Prat de Llobregat. Easy communication by public transport o private transport.
  • transporte público Bus 88 y 110 desde Barcelona y PR4 desde el Prat.

AVL is the world's largest independent company for development, simulation and testing technology of powertrains (hybrid, combustion engines, transmission, electric drive, batteries and software) for passenger cars, trucks and large engines.

Develop and maintain data analysis tools and algorithms to support the development and testing
Perform statistical analyses and modeling of the data to identify trends and patterns
Collaborate with engineers and team members to interpret data and provide insights and recommendations
Develop and present reports and visualizations to communicate data insights and findings to non-technical profiles
Contribute to the continuous improvement of the systems through data-driven decision making

An international working environment with opportunities for personal and professional development
Competitive salary and benefits package

Title: People Data Analyst
Description:
eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world's largest online travel companies and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. Under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo – it serves more than 18 million customers per year across 46 markets. Listed on the Spanish Stock Market, eDreams ODIGEO works with over 665 airlines and has partnerships with 130. The brand offers the best deals in regular flights, low-cost airlines, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for consumers across the globe.

As a People Data Analyst, you will be working alongside a passionate and dynamic team of people analytics professionals to drive data-informed decisions related to our people operations, with a particular focus on Talent Management.

This role will be embedded within our People team, where you will have the opportunity to collaborate with a diverse group of team members who share your passion for using data to drive business outcomes.

The main responsibilities will be:

Partner with cross-functional teams to identify key metrics and develop dashboards that provide insights into our people operations.
Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify trends and patterns that inform business decisions.
Participate and co-drive the creation of an People data platform and develop models and frameworks to support strategic
workforce planning, talent acquisition, retention, and performance management.
Collaborate with HR, Finance, and other business functions to identify opportunities for process improvement and automation.
Advocate for a data-driven approach, building processes to ensure data quality excellence and ability to advise on internal mobility decisions.
Support Chief People Officer in the preparation of documentation material for various audiences including the Company’s Board of Directors.
Proactively seek out new opportunities for data analysis and continuous improvement within our people analytics function, helping to shape the future of our organization.


Qualities we value for the role:

>2 years of experience in a People Data Analyst role or similar roles.
Knowledge of People functions and metrics.
Proven ability to be analytical and handle data effectively.
Ability to function as an effective and respected partner to internal clients.
Advanced knowledge of Google Sheets, alternatively, Excel.
Working knowledge in data visualization tools (Looker Studio, or other data visualization tools).
Understanding of and experience with SQL and relational databases.
Experience with ETL tools and Python knowledge is highly valued.
Ability to communicate fluently in English, as it is our main working language.


What do we offer?

A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.
Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.
Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills trainings, language lessons as well as a subscription to Coursera Online Learning.
Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.
We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy!
A phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance.
New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.
Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.
Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand!


… And the opportunity to work in a dynamic, dedicated, fun and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!

Come fly with us and join us now.

eDreams ODIGEO under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo –is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: El Prat de Llobregat, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Giesecke+Devrient is a global company that offers security technologies, both in the physical and digital world. Every day, billions of people benefit from G+D innovations in their personal and business lives. With around 11,600 employees across 32 countries, we develop, manufacture, and distribute products and solutions for the safeguarding of payment processes, identities, connectivity, and data. At G+D, we are looking for a Data Analyst within the team based in El Prat de Llobregat, Barcelona. Your Duties

Using automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources.
Removing corrupted data and fixing coding errors and related problems.
Developing and maintaining databases, and data systems – reorganizing data in a readable format.
Performing analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data.
Filter Data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to identify and correct code problems.
Using statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction.
Assigning numerical value to essential business functions so that business performance can be assessed and compared over periods of time.
Analyzing local, national, and global trends that impact both the organization and the industry.
Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.
Working with programmers, engineers, and management heads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies.
Preparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to take important decisions based on various facts and trends.


Your profile

Degree in Maths or other scientist discipline.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in similar position.
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data.
Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, Oracle, R, MATLAB, and Python.
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
Experience in handling reporting packages like Business Objects, programming (Javascript, XML, or ETL frameworks), databases.
Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages like Excel, SPSS, SAS to be used for data set analyzing.
Adept at using data processing platforms like Hadoop and Apache Spark.
Knowledge of data visualization software like Tableau, Qlik.
Knowledge of how to create and apply the most accurate algorithms to datasets in order to find solutions.
Problem-solving skills.
Accuracy and attention to detail.
Adept at queries, writing reports, and making presentations.
Team-working skills.
Verbal and Written communication skills.
Proven working experience in data analysis.


What we offer

Culture and Diversity: Join a people oriented environment with different nationalities and a great team spirit, flat hierarchies (everyone speaks to everyone). Equal Opportunity Employer and LGBT+ friendly.
Global Teams: Enjoy collaborative work in Agile/SCRUM teams and with stakeholders around the globe.
Innovative Products: Design and develop business processes and IT solutions for innovative products and digital solutions.
Career Development: Continuous training and coaching, talent program.
Social Benefits: Private medical insurance, transport ticket, in-house parking.
Flexible work time and remote work: Core time Mo-Th 9:30 – 17:00, 3 days of remote work.
Own Canteen: Take a break with our breakfast and lunch service: Choose between a big range of menus, salad desk and sandwich service. Fruit packages.
Location: El Prat de Llobregat. Easy communication by public transport o private transport.
transporte público Bus 88 y 110 desde Barcelona y PR4 desde el Prat.

Title: Data Analyst - Operations
Description:
Description:

📍Location: Barcelona, Spain

🌍 International environment

💰Competitive salary and perks




The revolution starts with small things: driving EVs, taking profit from renewable energy sources to avoid fuel... At Wallbox we work to make the world greener!

Why join Wallbox?

We create smart charging systems that combine innovative technology with outstanding design and manage the communication between vehicle, grid, building, and charger. We work with electric cars, build smart chargers, use solar panels and inverters and integrate everything into solutions for users around the world. Founded in 2015 as a Barcelona based start up, we have since grown to over 1000 Wallboxers from over 45 nationalities with a presence in Europe, Asia and the Americas!

From a top Spanish start-up to the first Spanish company to be listed on the NYSE, we are growing rapidly and we want you on board!




Our Data Journey:

Wallbox is committed to become a data driven company, not only for improving our decision making processes but also for helping us drive better our product development and incorporate data into our existing products or even create new business models.

We started our data journey just one year ago and it has already been an amazing drive! We’ve built a passionate and vibrant team, organised in a hub & spoke model, with roles such as data analysts, data engineers and analytics engineers.

Also we’ve been building a modern data stack, with technologies like Snowflake, Airflow, Fivetran, DBT, Tableau and Databricks. Our long term vision is to walk towards a data mesh model, where we will split people into producers and consumers domains.

Today our data lake is ingesting more than 1M events per hour coming from more than 350 sensors in our chargers. And this is just the beginning, as our goal is to reach one million online chargers by 2025.




What will you be doing?

Work as a Data analyst for our Operations team which is responsible for production planning, continuous improvement, material management and process optimization at Wallbox
Engage with internal stakeholders to gain an understanding of the problems that need to be solved and gather requirements for analytical tasks
Enable data driven process improvements through analysis of sales, production, logistics and external data
Extract, load and reconcile large data sets from multiple system platforms and sources.
Utilise SQL or other advanced analytic tools to perform data extract and query functions.
Build post-measure dashboards that will serve as a monitoring tool for diverse stakeholders and assess the impact of new process improvements
Work with Data Engineers to identify and add new datasets to the data platform. Collaborate with them for roadmap definition.
Be a steward of data quality, ensuring that metrics and KPIs are consistently reported across the catalogue of dashboards and data products
Have a key role in building data culture within the company
Define the direction, structure, processes, and standards for Data across the company (e.g. experimentation framework)
Drive a culture of data-informed decision making as we scale.




Must have:

Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering or other fields with a strong mathematical-statistical background
2+ years experience in working in a data driven analytics environment including an understanding of how to engage and influence decision makers
Exceptional analytical skills, lateral thinking and experience in solving highly challenging problems
Be fluent with one or more common data-related programming languages (Python or R)
Very good knowledge of SQL and experience in working with large data sets
Fluent in business English




Nice to have:

Experience in working with Data Visualisation tools (e.g.Tableau, Qlikview)
Experience in Manufacturing, Operations,Energy, Mobility or Automotive industry will be good to have
Experience in working with predictive models




Benefits:

Half-day Fridays!
Hybrid policy: 2 days of remote work
First-class private health insurance after your first month at Wallbox
Online group training sessions twice a week
Free online language classes (Spanish & English) twice a week
Flexible compensation valid for restaurants & food delivery apps, transportation,
childcare, and learning & development.
Hundreds of discounts on different brands & services with our Wallbox Circle benefits
platform
Car discounts & special advantages if you choose an EV!
Learn and grow in a company of over 45 nationalities and counting!
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI (inglés alto) - sector Farma
Description:
Si tu objetivo es seguir creciendo profesionalmente en el área de los datos, ésta es tu oferta!




¿Qué puede ofrecerte atSistemas?




👩‍💻Plan de Carrera: Todos nuestros profesionales tienen a su disposición procesos diseñados específicamente para sus funciones dentro de la compañía: modelo de competencias, evaluaciones, planes de formación y certificación, proyectos y eventos.

✈Vacaciones: 22 días laborables + 2 días de libre disposición + 24 y 31 de diciembre (cierre empresa)

✨Formación: Tendrás opciones para formarte en las últimas tecnologías y en INGLES! Además podrás contar con nuestro programa de certificaciones oficiales y las licencias de Udemy Business. Consulta nuestro calendario formativo: https://www.atsistemas.com/es/unete/formacion

🎁Sorpresas: Recibirás sorpresas en momentos especiales

🎈Plan Amigo: Puedes ser Embajador de nuestra marca a través de nuestro Plan Amigo

🌱Quokka: programa de actividades para promover el bienestar emocional, la actividad física, y la nutrición saludable

🏆Club de ventajas: Programa de beneficios y descuentos (ocio, tecnología, bienestar y salud...)

🤍Kudos: Iniciativa para fomentar una cultura de feedback y reconocimiento




¿Qué es relevante? Cuanto más mejor, pero tenemos ofertas tanto nivel medio como senior




- Elaboración de informes y cuadros de mando con Power BI. Conocimiento medio/alto

- Creación de modelos, ETL (extracción, transformación y carga) y transformación de consultas

- Documentación y gestión de evolutivos

Experiencia con Cloud (Redshift)




Es necesario aportar nivel alto de inglés y tener disponibilidad para desplazarte 1 día a la semana a sus oficinas, ubicadas en Barcelona ciudad.







Si te identificas con estos valores, no lo dudes y únete a nuestro equipo!

Title: Data Analyst BI (Barcelona)
Description:
Desde Azertium IT nos gustaría contar con los mejores profesionales del sector, y actualmente, estamos en búsqueda de un Analyst Business Intelligence con al menos 3 años de experiencia laboral, para formar parte de nuestro equipo, con gran desarrollo profesional.




Modalidad de trabajo hibrido (Barcelona).




Requisitos técnicos:




Experiencia mínima de 3 años como Responsable de la definición técnica, desarrollo, ejecución técnica de todos los proyectos de BI




dentro del área de tecnología de la compañía.




Experiencia en entornos analíticos Big Data y de Business Intelligence Tradicional.
Experiencia en el uso de herramientas ETL/ELT Pentaho.
Experiencia en modelado de datos para soluciones analíticas.
Experiencia en el uso de herramientas de BI sobre en Power BI.
Experiencia en el uso del entorno de Azure Cloud (Data Lake, Synapse, DataBricks) pero sobre todo en Azure Synapse ya que la actual infraestructura que tenemos.
Conocimientos de SQL SERVER.
Conocimientos de JIRA.
Conocimientos de Python.
Se valorará conocimientos de Navision aunque no es imprescindible




Ofrecemos formación, contrato indefinido, desarrollo y flexibilidad laboral.

Title: Part-time Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
The vision of NEWM is to create a community-owned platform that directly connects artists with their supporters; removing the middlemen and replacing them with code that’s not incentivized to make a profit. To achieve this goal, we are developing a multi-level platform powered by several decentralized services for artists to publish, distribute, directly promote, fund and launch their music.

We're an early startup with a committed and motivated team of currently 40 international people that cover different areas such as marketing, finances, technology and design. We are based in the US, but we are a remote-first company.

We are not a fully funded company yet which means that many people still work for us on the side and get compensated in NEWM Tokens.

What is a NEWM Token? Have a look at our whitepaper page 21 ff.

You will find our whitepaper on our website.

Tasks

We are looking for a part-time (10-15 hours per week) marketing data analyst starting from March 2023 to help us:

Manage and set up our Google Analytics & Google Tag manager (GTM) environments and processes.
Set up our google tag manager dashboard
Data collection from social media channels & website
Analyze and report on a holistic set of KPIs for digital marketing channels in addition to the website, including but not limited to events, social, email, ads and campaigns
Reporting and Visualization of the data
Provide Google Analytics support for members of the team
Regular communication with developers, product owners and business stakeholders to enable iterative improvements to tracking and reporting
Marketing Campaign analytics (e.g. campaign performance analysis)


Requirements

Qualifications:

Hands-on experience with Google analytics & Google tag manager (variables, events, segments, dimensions, custom queries, etc)
Expertise in analyzing and reporting data from Web Analytics platforms
Strong skills in Microsoft Excel or Google spreadsheets. Experience with Google Data studio & visualization software (e.g. Tableau) is a plus
Proficient understanding of e-commerce customer journeys
Fluent in English
Problem-solving oriented thinking
Ability to work in a team and strong communication skills
Ability to work independently


Benefits

Benefits:

The compensation will be in NEWM Token for the time being
Awesome, international team
Fully remote
Inclusive and supportive work culture
Opportunity to develop your specification
Work closely with our senior data analyst

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d) Power BI expert
Description:
Job description:



We are looking for a talented and motivated colleague to join our team in the Global Commercial Excellence department of ZF Aftermarket. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and implementing strategies to drive revenue growth, improve market share, and enhance customer satisfaction. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop and execute go-to-market plans, identify new business opportunities, and optimize pricing and product offerings.



 



The aftermarket environment is undergoing a massive shift in electrified, connected, intelligent, and shared mobility, and we invite you to watch the following keynote speech from our Vice President outlining ZF's exciting new strategy in this space. At ZF, we are looking for talented professionals who are passionate about data-driven innovation and eager to help shape the future of the automotive industry. If you are a driven, curious, and dedicated professional looking to join a dynamic and innovative team. Join ZF and be part of a team that is at the forefront of automotive innovation!



 



Job Location: Near 22@Barcelona "Districte de la innovació"

Your tasks:



Communicate data in visual ways that are useful for both subject matter experts as well as business users
Transform, improve, and integrate data, depending on the business requirements
Provide visual, technical, and editorial guidance
Acquire understanding of the business needs by asking the right questions
Maintenance and Monitoring – ensure the final products are working seamlessly over time, with continual improvements, while understanding / analyzing the usage and feedback from the user groups



Profile description:



Your profile:



Experience in Mobility / Automotive Aftermarket (or similar business) - is preferred
Experience with Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS), and the Structured Query Language (SQL)
Advanced skills in working with data visualization tools (Tableau / Power BI)
Excellent Communication skills
Critical thinking: able to look at numbers, trends, and data and come to new conclusions based on the findings

Title: Analytics Specialist
Description:
ALOHAS is more than a fashion brand: it’s a responsible shopping experience and a chance to participate in the fight against overproduction in fashion.




Working at ALOHAS is being part of the innovation and growth of a Spanish start-up with a young, creative and proactive team, good communication and a high level of energy! It’s demanding but extremely rewarding due to an environment where we take pride in learning from one another and strive to make sustainability a way of life beyond the workplace.




In a nutshell, we love what we do and it shows! 😀




THE ROLE




We are looking for an Analytics Specialist, highly motivated self-starter who is adaptable, detail-oriented, and proficient at multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment as a data-driven marketer.




You'll be the owner of the technical analytics framework collaborating with Global Digital Director on insights from audiences engaging in other Product tools to inform conversion opportunities and growth, helping ALOHAS to improve and optimize its online marketing activities.




YOUR CHALLENGE




Measure and analyze marketing channel and campaign performance to enhance effectiveness (e.g., Web, SEO, Paid Ads, Affiliates, Email, Social Media, etc.)
Work with the CRO on the design of site experiments, implementing and testing opportunities via Personalization or A/B testing and researching new data sources
Be the owner of the tracking platforms, setup, new implementations, bugs, event creation, etc
Work in Big query to set up queries and extract data
Support the team in implementing additional analytics toolsets
Create a data governance framework and roadmap for analytics, giving guidance where required
Lead the build of cross-channel dashboards through the use of data visualization tools
Support work on integrating digital data with other data sources
Share insights and reports to senior management and other internal stakeholderd
Ensure that analytics data is accurate and there is sufficient monitoring in place to spot issues
Use project management techniques to ensure all changes are delivered on time, to scope and to budget




YOU WILL ROCK AT THIS ROLE IF YOU HAVE




Degree in data science, statistics, computer science, business analytics or related field
Hands-on analytical and measurement experience of digital channels such as Web, SEO, E-mail, Affiliates, Paid Ads, Social Media
Strong analytical skills; ability to analyze raw data, draw conclusions, and develop actionable recommendations for stakeholders with varying levels of analytic expertise
Experience with Shopify is an asset
1 year’s experience in an internal/client-facing digital data analysis role
Strong technical abilities and skills specific tool knowledge Google Analytics, Power BI, 365 dynamics, 365 CRM, GTM, Big query and powerapps
Experience with dashboarding and reporting and building end-to-end real-time reporting
Works well cross-functionally to drive tangible business outcomes leveraging analytics




BENEFITS Of Being Part Of ALOHAS




Culture of freedom, diversity & inclusion, and responsibility ✨
Flexible schedule: Fit it into your routine! ⏰
Discounts: You will have special discounts 💯 and we do not forget your family and friends either!
Office: In the heart of Barcelona, in the Gracia neighbourhood, where we take care of coffee ☕ and fruit 🍎
Work remotely: live and work wherever you want 🌍 within the CET time zone!
Home office setup: You will get a laptop + electronic devices like a keyboard, mouse, and second screen 💻
Keep learning with ALOHAS 🎓 We offer English courses to our employees, more languages coming soon!
We take care of your happiness 🌈 and professional growth with constructive feedback 💪
After-work events in Barcelona and Madrid every month 🎉




Ready for the challenge?🚀




About ALOHAS




Want to know more? Video Presentation




Apply to work with us: careers.alohas.io




Our website:alohas.io/ IG: @alohas

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Data2Diamond 

Somos un equipo de expertos en analítica de datos, impulsados por la pasión de construir soluciones de análisis de negocios de vanguardia. Ayudamos a los responsables de la toma de decisiones, a entender y analizar sus datos para hacer llevar su negocio al siguiente nivel. Hemos entregado soluciones en toda Europa y EE.UU. para múltiples industrias como la aviación, el comercio minorista, las finanzas y los seguros. 

 

Acerca del puesto de trabajo 

Actualmente, estamos buscando un (Ella/El/Elle) Analista de Datos Senior que liderará las iniciativas de Business Analytics, incluyendo la recopilación de requisitos, análisis exploratorios, visualización de datos y storytelling para presentar los insights a los usuarios finales. 




Lo que harás 

Extraer datos de fuentes primarias y secundarias, evaluar la calidad y el significado de los datos, traducir los datos a un formato legible. Utilizar herramientas estadísticas para identificar, analizar e interpretar patrones y tendencias en conjuntos de datos complejos que podrían ser útiles para el diagnóstico y la predicción. 
Colaborar con desarrolladores de ETL, desarrolladores de inteligencia empresarial, científicos de datos y líderes de alto nivel para identificar oportunidades de mejora de procesos, proponer modificaciones del sistema y diseñar estrategias de gobernanza de datos para incorporar las mejores prácticas. 
Realizar análisis exploratorios de datos y examinar los datos para reconocer e identificar patrones. Utilizar técnicas de modelación de datos para crear resúmenes y observaciones clave para líneas de servicio funcionales, por ejemplo, arquitectura de datos, gobernanza de datos, inteligencia empresarial y ciencia de datos. 
Colaborar con el equipo de ciencia de datos para obtener datos externos e introducirlos en el entorno de desarrollo de ciencia de datos. Mantener la instancia de la base de datos de Data Science y todos los conjuntos de datos que se han definido para el análisis. 
Desarrollar y dirigir múltiples proyectos interdepartamentales, establecer relaciones de trabajo eficaces con los grupos de clientes asignados para obtener resultados empresariales. Participar con equipos interfuncionales en los esfuerzos de integración para fusionar plataformas de datos con sistemas y aplicaciones empresariales. 




Lo que buscamos 

Actitud positiva con una gran pasión por aprender y siempre estar abierto a nuevos retos. 
Licenciatura en Informática, Sistemas de Información, Administración de Empresas, Finanzas, Sistemas de Información de Gestión, Matemáticas, Física, Ingeniería, Estadística, Economía, y / o campo relacionado. 
Mínimo 3 años en Análisis de Datos/Informes, Sistemas de Gestión de la Información, Herramientas de Inteligencia de Negocio, y/o afines. 
Se valorará muy positivamente la experiencia en Analítica Comercial. 
Experiencia y conocimientos intermedios de programación SQL y Python. 
Experiencia y conocimientos intermedios de herramientas de Business Intelligence (Preferiblemente Tableau, pero también se valorará experiencia en otras herramientas como Qlik, PowerBI). 
Fuertes habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita para Storytelling. 
Nivel avanzado de inglés. 

 

Qué ofrecemos 

Salario competitivo entre 40k y 60k euros/anual. 
Equipo de alto rendimiento. 
Horario de trabajo flexible. 
Programa de aprendizaje continuo. 
Increíbles eventos de Team building. 
Remuneración flexible: seguro médico, tickets restaurante. 




💪💪💪 Únete a nuestro equipo 💪💪💪

Show more Show less
HTML:
Data2Diamond 

Somos un equipo de expertos en analítica de datos, impulsados por la pasión de construir soluciones de análisis de negocios de vanguardia. Ayudamos a los responsables de la toma de decisiones, a entender y analizar sus datos para hacer llevar su negocio al siguiente nivel. Hemos entregado soluciones en toda Europa y EE.UU. para múltiples industrias como la aviación, el comercio minorista, las finanzas y los seguros. 

 

Acerca del puesto de trabajo 

Actualmente, estamos buscando un (Ella/El/Elle) Analista de Datos Senior que liderará las iniciativas de Business Analytics, incluyendo la recopilación de requisitos, análisis exploratorios, visualización de datos y storytelling para presentar los insights a los usuarios finales. 


Lo que harás 

  • Extraer datos de fuentes primarias y secundarias, evaluar la calidad y el significado de los datos, traducir los datos a un formato legible. Utilizar herramientas estadísticas para identificar, analizar e interpretar patrones y tendencias en conjuntos de datos complejos que podrían ser útiles para el diagnóstico y la predicción. 
  • Colaborar con desarrolladores de ETL, desarrolladores de inteligencia empresarial, científicos de datos y líderes de alto nivel para identificar oportunidades de mejora de procesos, proponer modificaciones del sistema y diseñar estrategias de gobernanza de datos para incorporar las mejores prácticas. 
  • Realizar análisis exploratorios de datos y examinar los datos para reconocer e identificar patrones. Utilizar técnicas de modelación de datos para crear resúmenes y observaciones clave para líneas de servicio funcionales, por ejemplo, arquitectura de datos, gobernanza de datos, inteligencia empresarial y ciencia de datos. 
  • Colaborar con el equipo de ciencia de datos para obtener datos externos e introducirlos en el entorno de desarrollo de ciencia de datos. Mantener la instancia de la base de datos de Data Science y todos los conjuntos de datos que se han definido para el análisis. 
  • Desarrollar y dirigir múltiples proyectos interdepartamentales, establecer relaciones de trabajo eficaces con los grupos de clientes asignados para obtener resultados empresariales. Participar con equipos interfuncionales en los esfuerzos de integración para fusionar plataformas de datos con sistemas y aplicaciones empresariales. 


Lo que buscamos 

  • Actitud positiva con una gran pasión por aprender y siempre estar abierto a nuevos retos. 
  • Licenciatura en Informática, Sistemas de Información, Administración de Empresas, Finanzas, Sistemas de Información de Gestión, Matemáticas, Física, Ingeniería, Estadística, Economía, y / o campo relacionado. 
  • Mínimo 3 años en Análisis de Datos/Informes, Sistemas de Gestión de la Información, Herramientas de Inteligencia de Negocio, y/o afines. 
  • Se valorará muy positivamente la experiencia en Analítica Comercial. 
  • Experiencia y conocimientos intermedios de programación SQL y Python. 
  • Experiencia y conocimientos intermedios de herramientas de Business Intelligence (Preferiblemente Tableau, pero también se valorará experiencia en otras herramientas como Qlik, PowerBI). 
  • Fuertes habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita para Storytelling. 
  • Nivel avanzado de inglés. 

 

Qué ofrecemos 

  • Salario competitivo entre 40k y 60k euros/anual. 
  • Equipo de alto rendimiento. 
  • Horario de trabajo flexible. 
  • Programa de aprendizaje continuo. 
  • Increíbles eventos de Team building. 
  • Remuneración flexible: seguro médico, tickets restaurante.

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
Ready for your next adventure?

We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile games studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games are positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, and they are played and loved by millions of fans all over the world. We are proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, and we are on a mission to offer a great gaming experience and bring fun to everyone!

What will you do?

As a Junior Data Engineer you will help build the architecture that drives our business.

You will design and implement scalable systems that can handle 100K events per second and work with databases with over 150 TB of compressed data.

You will design Socialpoint’s Data Warehouse and ensure the highest level of data integrity and robustness. Finally, you will make all this data available to the different teams using cutting-edge visualization tools.

To achieve all of this you will work closely with awesome developers and data scientists to make Socialpoint’s BI tools and architecture the best in the industry.

This is you

1+ years of programming or scripting experience in Python. Experience with other programming languages will also be considered.
1+ years of experience in SQL. You can optimize a query for a specific database and understand the different capabilities of a given vendor DB.
You have a big interest in data and how it’s transformed into useful, actionable information.
It would be nice if you have…

Experience implementing BI solutions.
Dimensional modeling skills or experience designing a Data Warehouse.
Experience with Big Data / Column store DBs (Redshift, Presto, Vertica, BigQuery...).
And you are also

Professional, passionate about video games and analytics, problem solver, proactive, team worker, rigorous and data oriented.
You are smart, creative and pragmatic. You love researching the newest advances and finding practical ways to integrate them into your work.
You work fast without forgetting quality, quickly understand existing code and learn new concepts easily.
You understand Data Engineering is also about solving business problems, not just technical ones.
You have a good English level.

What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?

Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we have employed a hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office in Barcelona so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you’re not already here).
An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays.
A very generous ticket-restaurant to restore some life-points.
Private medical insurance for you and your family, to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons (English & Spanish ).
Spotify Premium to add that special soundtrack that every adventure deserves.
Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.
Players develop…Oops, sorry! People development is key for us: an amazing budget just for you to spend skilling up your abilities & knowledge to achieve real growth opportunities!
Coming to work in the office? Don’t worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:
Want to stay in shape? We have state of the art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
A massive gaming room equipped with all consoles and games you could ask for.
Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for your aches and pains.
Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).

The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now! Please click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.

Intrigued? We’d love to hear from you. Please click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You’re welcome on the team no matter where you’re from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It’s a trick question – mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

It’s a trick question – mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

Title: Data Analyst Lead
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Fluidra, a multinational group listed on the Spanish Stock Exchange, is the global leader in the pool and wellness industry. Founded in 1969, Fluidra has long-standing experience in developing innovative products and services in the global residential and commercial pool market.

Fluidra has a clear mission: to create the perfect pool and wellness experience responsibly.

Purpose: You will take responsibility for creating and managing data sets, developing reports, and

troubleshooting data issues.

Support Regional data leads and business areas
Active Listening → Value Proposal → Deliver to customers
Data modelling and ETL process (SQL / SNOWFLAKE/INFORMATICA)
Create Dashboards and Reports (PowerBI)
Build advanced analytics algorithms (Python /R)
Propose new business value added solutions and data uses cases
Training & Engagement of Data users

Duties And Responsibilities

Lead data and analytics squads to develop and maintain a data models and infrastructure using a range of different storage technologies that enables optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from multiple data sources.
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet both functional and non-functional business requirements.
Support the development of processes and standards for data mining, data modelling and data protection.
Build analytic tools that identify patterns and trends to deliver insights that can inform effective business decisions
Design and implement continuous process improvements for automating manual processes and optimizing data delivery.
Assess and report on the unique data needs of key stakeholders and troubleshoot any data-related technical issues through to resolution.
Work with the broader data and analytics team to improve data models that support business intelligence tools, improve data accessibility and foster data-driven decision making.
Ensure traceability of requirements from Data through testing and scope changes, to training and transition

Functions, Activities And Accountabilities

Data Analytics and Sales BI

Project leading
Proactively add value to the business
Data R&D
Data Adoption & Engagement
Project Timing & Budget Control

Skills And Abilities

Business and objective-oriented mindset.
Advanced written, verbal, and analytic skills, and demonstrated ability to influence and facilitate sustained change.
Ability to convey information clearly and concisely to all levels of staff and management about programs, services, best practices, strategies, and organizational mission and values.
Proven ability to focus on priorities, strategies, and vision.
Very Good understanding in Data Foundation initiatives, like Modelling, Data
Quality Management, Data Governance, Data Maturity Assessments and Data Strategy in support of the key business stakeholders.
Actively deliver the roll-out and embedding of Data Foundation initiatives in support of the key business programs advising on the technology and using leading market standard tools.
Coordinate the change management process, incident management and problem management process.
Ensure traceability of requirements from Data through testing and scope changes, to training and transition.
Drive implementation efficiency and effectiveness across the pilots and future projects to minimize cost, increase speed of implementation and maximize value delivery

Education: Bachelor’s in a Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics or Computer Science discipline

Experience: 5 + Years of experience in enterprise-wide data governance, policies, procedures, and implementation

Tools: SQL/Snowflake, Informatica ETL, PowerBI, etc

Languages: A High Level of English and Spanish is mandatory.

Sant Cugat del Vallès

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
ABOUT US

ShopFully is the tech company reinventing local shopping worldwide.

Thanks to our marketplaces (DoveConviene, Tiendeo, PromoQui and VolantinoFacile) we enable 45+ million users globally to save money and time when shopping at their favourite local stores. Our AI-driven platform helps 400+ retailers and top brands reach their ideal audiences and finally drive them to their stores, boosting local sales.

This is why today we are one of the leading international players in Drive to Store.




We’re a team of over 370, spanning 30 different nationalities across 12 countries. Are you ready to join us?







ABOUT THE ROLE

You will be responsible for designing and implementing scalable ETL processes towards the enterprise data warehouse and data lake
You will take care of everything related to the use of data to support the sale and improvement of our products (e.g. search for products loopholes), from the data ingestion phase to the visualization phase
You will closely follow business and product dynamics: your relational skills will be an advantage in the analysis and definition of data processes that meet business requirements
Our data platform is completely in the AWS cloud, it is modern and inspired by the big technological players and allows us to manage both batch and real-time applications.







SKILLS WE ARE SEARCHING FOR (mandatory)

You have a good knowledge of the SQL language and Python
You have knowledge of the basics of Big Data application development
You have knowledge of the cloud world and in particular AWS
You are able to work in a team and coordinate with multiple internal stakeholders







SKILLS WE LOOK FOR (optional)

You have knowledge of the basics of the dimensional fact model and data warehousing
You have knowledge of at least one ETL tool (Pentaho Data Integration, Talend, etc.)
PySpark
It should be a plus also if you have knowledge of Tableau and R







WHAT WE OFFER

An opportunity to build your experience in an internationally growing scale-up company
A young and informal work environment
Flexible work arrangements encouraging smart working
Company laptop and all you need to set up a proper home-working station
1.5 hour of Learning Time per week







TO FEEL AT HOME IN SHOPFULLY YOU SHOULD

ACT AS AN OWNER: no challenge is too big for you! We set clear goals and finish what we start. We go the extra-mile and fix what doesn't work: that's how we achieve great results.
RELY ON DATA: let the data do the talking, so we think, plan and act supported by fact checked data and we value calculated risk taking. We measure our success to keep improving.
PLAY TOGETHER: magic happens in teams! That’s why we communicate clearly and support each other. We believe in sharing helpful feedback and building trust. Together we are unstoppable.







LOCATION: BARCELONA, with possibility of hybrid working arrangements.







ShopFully will process your personal data for this application as indicated in the Privacy Notice pursuant to Arts. 13 and 14 of Regulation EU 2016/679 and that you can view here: https://corporate.shopfully.com/it/privacy-policy/

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
What makes Netcentric a great fit for you?




At Cognizant Netcentric, we come to work every day with the mission of leveraging cutting-edge technology to create memorable digital experiences for the worlds leading brands. And we do it as a diverse, global community of over 1500+ Adobe experts collaborating across countries, cultures, languages and technologies.




We're energized by an inclusive and responsive organizational culture that brings together the entrepreneurial spirit of a startup with the resources, growth opportunities and stability of a larger global organization. Holacracy is the cornerstone of how we work, empowering every individual with the power to make an impact within our organization. All this encourages us to learn and grow as individuals, and unite as a team to build innovative digital experiences that touch peoples lives.




Job Description




We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst professional who loves to transmit his/her passion for web technologies and big data projects. You will consult internal stakeholders by leveraging data insights. You will be the interface between the product team and the business. You are a good fit, if you are a sharp mind that gathers insights and turns them into business value.




You have a strong analytical mindset and are a great communicator to convey your insights.




Roles & Responsibilities in your day-to-day activities you will:




Consult internal stakeholders on using data to gain meaningful insights
Collaborate with members of the digital, product marketing, and business stakeholders to provide actionable insights on the performance of digital channels.
Guide product marketers in identifying key performance indicators for their areas and build appropriate reporting that provides insight into the performance of initiatives within each area.
Derive actionable consumer insights from trends observed data and reports for the business owners and stakeholders
Extract existing data to calculate/format into presentable reports, charts, and graphs
Examine and evaluate the purpose and content of business reports to develop new or improve existing format
Design, build and implement new report formats and layouts on a customized basis as requested by the process owners
Validation and clean-up of the production data. Individual productivity tracking and scorecard preparation
Create automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance.
Apply data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems integrated with the products.
Ensure the accuracy of the reports
Continuously work with product teams and improve the product
Responsible for product reporting and guiding team along with Product Owner
Consult on projects with respect to tracking and measuring all desired on and offline touch points.
Advocate customers through the creation of Analytics, Data Management and Customer Data Platform solutions.
Added advantage:
Experience in Tag Management with the ability to read and write code
Model business processes in data architecture for analysis and optimisation
Workshop attendance - online, as well as some onsite travel required.





Required Skills:




5 years of experience as Data Analyst
Products, MS Power BI, Google Data Studio / Looker
Basic understanding of SQL and queering data to derive insights for business
Good communication skills (verbal and written) and Strong Interpersonal Skills
Report writing, presentation and insight generation
Creating Dashboards in (Excel, PowerBI, Google Data Studio etc.)
Understanding of Marketing needs
Data Science interface
Creative skills on visualization
Can inspire, gather insights and convey key messages to the business
Out of the box thinking, linking data sets
Abstract thinking
Working hours CET +/- hour





What makes us smile when we look at your profile:




Experience in international projects and working with remote teams
Not afraid to run workshop and knowledge sharing sessions





At Netcentric you get:




Permanent contract
30 working days of vacation
Flexible working hours
Recognition bonus system
Private health insurance
Apple work equipment
WFH equipment + welcome package
WFH monthly expenses compensation
Access to Udemy courses
Adobe certification
Sponsored gym membership
Tax-free benefits (ticket restaurant, kindergarten and transport)
A dynamic and international team
Everyone has a voice; we are a Holacracy organization
