We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst professional who loves to transmit his/her passion for web technologies and big data projects. You will consult internal stakeholders by leveraging data insights. You will be the interface between the product team and the business. You are a good fit, if you are a sharp mind that gathers insights and turns them into business value.


You have a strong analytical mindset and are a great communicator to convey your insights.


Roles & Responsibilities in your day-to-day activities you will:


  • Consult internal stakeholders on using data to gain meaningful insights
  • Collaborate with members of the digital, product marketing, and business stakeholders to provide actionable insights on the performance of digital channels.
  • Guide product marketers in identifying key performance indicators for their areas and build appropriate reporting that provides insight into the performance of initiatives within each area.
  • Derive actionable consumer insights from trends observed data and reports for the business owners and stakeholders
  • Extract existing data to calculate/format into presentable reports, charts, and graphs
  • Examine and evaluate the purpose and content of business reports to develop new or improve existing format
  • Design, build and implement new report formats and layouts on a customized basis as requested by the process owners
  • Validation and clean-up of the production data. Individual productivity tracking and scorecard preparation
  • Create automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance.
  • Apply data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems integrated with the products.
  • Ensure the accuracy of the reports
  • Continuously work with product teams and improve the product
  • Responsible for product reporting and guiding team along with Product Owner
  • Consult on projects with respect to tracking and measuring all desired on and offline touch points.
  • Advocate customers through the creation of Analytics, Data Management and Customer Data Platform solutions.
  • Added advantage:
  • Experience in Tag Management with the ability to read and write code
  • Model business processes in data architecture for analysis and optimisation
  • Workshop attendance - online, as well as some onsite travel required.


Required Skills:


  • 5 years of experience as Data Analyst
  • Products, MS Power BI, Google Data Studio / Looker
  • Basic understanding of SQL and queering data to derive insights for business
  • Good communication skills (verbal and written) and Strong Interpersonal Skills
  • Report writing, presentation and insight generation
  • Creating Dashboards in (Excel, PowerBI, Google Data Studio etc.)
  • Understanding of Marketing needs
  • Data Science interface
  • Creative skills on visualization
  • Can inspire, gather insights and convey key messages to the business
  • Out of the box thinking, linking data sets
  • Abstract thinking
  • Working hours CET +/- hour


What makes us smile when we look at your profile:


  • Experience in international projects and working with remote teams
  • Not afraid to run workshop and knowledge sharing sessions


At Netcentric you get:


  • Permanent contract
  • 30 working days of vacation
  • Flexible working hours
  • Recognition bonus system
  • Private health insurance
  • Apple work equipment
  • WFH equipment + welcome package
  • WFH monthly expenses compensation
  • Access to Udemy courses
  • Adobe certification
  • Sponsored gym membership
  • Tax-free benefits (ticket restaurant, kindergarten and transport)
  • A dynamic and international team
  • Everyone has a voice; we are a Holacracy organization

Title: Lead Data Analyst - Finance
Description:
Overview




PepsiCo is using the power of data to transform the way our world-famous portfolio of brands is sold every day. Our Data & Analytics organization influences every aspect of how we sell and move our products. In just a short period of time, they’ve built new capabilities that have defined the roadmap across all our brands. Members of our team solve complex problems facing our rapidly changing business and get to see their work come to life in the real world




Join PepsiCo’s Enterprise Data Operations Organization which develops quality data collection processes, maintains the integrity of our data foundations and enables business leaders and data scientists across the company to have rapid access to the data they need for decision-making and innovation.




Your mission




As a member of the data engineering team, you will be the key domain expert overseeing PepsiCo's business process and drive a strong discussion for how Supply Chain, Financial, Consumer, Channel, Category business needs to be defined and prioritize by working very closely with business leads, data science team and data engineering team. You'll develop an in-depth understanding of business processes in and translate business requirements to data engineering team in technical way.




Responsibilities




Your day to day with us:




Discover, analyze, and scope data requirements & representing them in conceptual and logical data models
Gather and analyze data pertaining to various business processes such as forecasts, capital requirements, inventory, logistic, manufacturing and production capacity to develop supply chain models. geographics, POS, pricing and promotion, store profile, e commerce data to develop channel models.
Create high-level process models (system interface diagrams, workflow & swim lane diagrams, data flow diagrams) to represent processes for the area under analysis
Empower the business by creating value through the increased adoption of data, data science and business intelligence landscape.
Responsible to improve the quality of data in relation to defined expectations
Perform analysis of system data to identify patterns, exceptions, and erroneous data




Qualifications




What will you need to succeed:




Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain and/or Operations Management is Required, Masters Preferred.
6+ years of experience with data analysis & data profiling in project, business requirements definition or data engineering in CPG or Manufacturing Industry.
5+ years’ work experience in the areas of Distribution Network Analysis, Manufacturing, Production Network Optimization, Transportation, Demand Planning, or other areas related to Supply Chain or other domains such as Financial, Consumer, Channel, Category etc.
4+ years of strong Data Profiling experience & ability to identify trends and anomalies in the data to in-form data model build out.
Experience in working with Datasets from POS Aggregators such as IRI, Nielsen, Kantar etc.
Experience working with structured/unstructured datasets, ability to clearly document and communicate requirement to technical team members.
Experience with Business Intelligence tools, SQLTools.
Strong knowledge and understanding of Supply Chain data elements and processes per the necessary inscope data domain (i.e., Customer, Material, Vendor)
Ability to translate business requirements into critical data dependencies and requirements
Able to challenge and align various stakeholders to a common set of standards
Self-starter with excellent written & verbal communication skills.
Self-learner and eager to understand data, business processes, concepts, and technologies




What makes us different?




Hybrid work model & collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Entrepreneurial environment in leading international company
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
Diverse team from over 25 countries
Have a stake in D&I strategy and Bring your whole self to work




About PepsiCo




We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo. We operate with start-up mindset – agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.




PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization – a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PO5CdBmWjUY




So, if you’re ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we’d love to chat.




 We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability

Title: Data Strategy Senior Analyst
Description:
Overview




#Locations: Barcelona, Spain; Vitoria-Gasteiz, Spain




With data deeply embedded in our DNA, PepsiCo Data & Analytics transforms data into consumer delight. We build and organize business-ready data allowing PepsiCo’s leaders to solve business problems with the highest degree of confidence. Our platform of data products and services ensures data is activated at scale. This enables new revenue streams, deeper partner relationships, new consumer experiences, and innovation across the enterprise.




As a member of the Strategy & Ecosystem team, the Enterprise Data Strategy Senior Analyst is responsible for researching, analyzing and supporting the development of global data strategy for PepsiCo.




This role joins the Enterprise Data Strategy team and will lead strategy projects. The role helps to align PepsiCo’s data strategy, with the strategic goals of the enterprise and the rapid development of data capability within the industry . The successful candidate will have a deep understanding of the value of all types of data assets, and have skills and experience in data and AI strategy, data products, data management and how these relate to business strategy.




Responsibilities




Your day to day with us:




Be responsible for the development of Enterprise Data strategy research projects, through the research, synthesis, analysis and evaluation of different elements of the data lifecycle
Create strategic approaches that enable the application of these elements into the PepsiCo business.
Lead cross-section data strategy discussions, develop data strategy roadmaps in conjunction with other teams in PepsiCo D+A and across broader PepsiCo’s portfolio – a highly matrixed organization – resulting in value-add and scalable plans to support the business with enterprise data
Communicate our data strategy to/with stakeholders, internal and external, developing clear and concise message that reflects the complexity of approach but ensures the strategy is clear and assessable for non-technical leaders
Partner with subject matter experts across delivery functions to validate business needs and create a baseline understanding of the as-is




Qualifications




What will you need to succeed?




Minimum 5 years working in strategy driven business functions
Minimum 3 years experience working within data lifecycle areas (data strategy, data management, governance, data science)
Experience consulting in Strategy preferred, ideally working with large, multinational enterprises
Bachelor’s Degree required
Master’s degree preferred




Skills, Abilities, Knowledge




Strong strategic thinking and analysis
Presentation and communication skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences
Deep knowledge in researching and creating strategy and position papers for senior and executive leaders
Deep knowledge of data products, the possibilities of AI and execution with CPG use cases
Working knowledge of common data science capabilities and techniques




What makes us different?




Hybrid work model & collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Entrepreneurial environment in leading international company
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
Diverse team from over 25 countries
Have a stake in D&I strategy and Bring your whole self to work




About PepsiCo




We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo. We operate with start-up mindset – agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.




PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization – a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PO5CdBmWjUY




So, if you’re ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we’d love to chat.

Title: Data Engineer Trainee
Description:
Our opportunity

Life is too short to just tick the box. Reimagine the box with Zurich!

We are looking for a Data Engineer Trainee to join the Data Science & Engineering team as part of the Data & Business Intelligence (DBI) Solution Delivery & Operations department! This is an exciting opportunity as we offer:


Interesting and challenging tasks in a friendly environment
Significant learning experiences: a hands-on introduction to real world data processes working directly with senior management
Opportunities to work on real world data gathering and processing techniques


During this experience not only you will learn and boost your career but also you will build relationships and have fun with teams all over the world!

With us you will have a real opportunity to make a difference and be part of the team!

Your role

As a Data Engineer Trainee, you will assist CBD-Intel management and analysts in with:


Automation of tasks related to departmental finance management and team budget control.
Learning and improvement of support ticket management, using automation and/or apis to connect underneath.
Start working in a support Team, understanding usual tasks to do in a daily basis as Monitoring, resolve incidents, or release management.
Use programming languages like scala or python to develop
Participate in cloud based projects (Azure & AWS)
Evaluating the quality and identifying the areas of improvement
You will learn about product development methodologies, like data ops and agile, but also about product discovery and delivery


Your Skills And Experience

We would like to give this opportunity to somebody who is:


Studying a degree/master's degree related to science, statistics, computing or technical subjects
Knowledge of programming language, Python or similar
Fluent in English: B2
Open mind to join a team and work within an international context Duration of the internship as long as the university allows
Flexible work
Active student status with Spanish University/School is mandatory
University student interested in developing career in tech field
Looking for at least 6 months part-time/internship program
Tech savvy approach
An enthusiastic, capable, curious person craving to learn
A good team player with responsible and can-do attitude
Able to use English for communication with colleague and managers from abroad on daily basis


Additional Information

We offer benefits such as:


Paid Internship
Option to work remotely within Spain
Up to 30 hours weekly with Flexible schedule
LinkedIn and internal training opportunities
Special discounts on different brands and products & great banking and insurance conditions.
Welcome pack that includes amazing gadgets.
A cool workspace with gaming, gym, and fun area!
A variety of clubs for you to get to know your colleagues and have fun, e.g. hiking, skiing, reading and many others!
Free coffee and fruit at the office.


Primary work location is Barcelona Poblenou .

Does it look like you have found your future job? Don’t wait anymore and apply sending your CV in English!

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

Why Zurich

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that’s what makes our team so great!

Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet .


Location(s): ES - Barcelona
Remote working: Yes
Schedule: Part Time
Recruiter name: Besteiro Cerda Maria Sol

  • Opportunities to work on real world data gathering and processing techniques

During this experience not only you will learn and boost your career but also you will build relationships and have fun with teams all over the world!

With us you will have a real opportunity to make a difference and be part of the team!

Your role

As a Data Engineer Trainee, you will assist CBD-Intel management and analysts in with:

  • Automation of tasks related to departmental finance management and team budget control.
  • Learning and improvement of support ticket management, using automation and/or apis to connect underneath.
  • Start working in a support Team, understanding usual tasks to do in a daily basis as Monitoring, resolve incidents, or release management.
  • Use programming languages like scala or python to develop
  • Participate in cloud based projects (Azure & AWS)
  • Evaluating the quality and identifying the areas of improvement
  • You will learn about product development methodologies, like data ops and agile, but also about product discovery and delivery

Your Skills And Experience

 We would like to give this opportunity to somebody who is:

  • Studying a degree/master's degree related to science, statistics, computing or technical subjects
  • Knowledge of programming language, Python or similar
  • Fluent in English: B2
  • Open mind to join a team and work within an international context Duration of the internship as long as the university allows
  • Flexible work
  • Active student status with Spanish University/School is mandatory
  • University student interested in developing career in tech field
  • Looking for at least 6 months part-time/internship program
  • Tech savvy approach
  • An enthusiastic, capable, curious person craving to learn
  • A good team player with responsible and can-do attitude
  • Able to use English for communication with colleague and managers from abroad on daily basis

Additional Information

 We offer benefits such as:

  • Paid Internship
  • Option to work remotely within Spain
  • Up to 30 hours weekly with Flexible schedule
  • LinkedIn and internal training opportunities
  • Special discounts on different brands and products & great banking and insurance conditions.
  • Welcome pack that includes amazing gadgets.
  • A cool workspace with gaming, gym, and fun area!
  • A variety of clubs for you to get to know your colleagues and have fun, e.g. hiking, skiing, reading and many others!
  • Free coffee and fruit at the office.

Primary work location is Barcelona Poblenou .

Does it look like you have found your future job? Don’t wait anymore and apply sending your CV in English!

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

Why Zurich

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that’s what makes our team so great!

Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet .

  • Location(s): ES - Barcelona
  • Remote working: Yes
  • Schedule: Part Time
  • Recruiter name: Besteiro Cerda Maria Sol

Title: Data Engineer _ Analytics and Modeling analyst
Description:
There will never be a typical day at Accenture Digital, but that’s why people love it here. The opportunities to make a difference while working on exciting client initiatives are limitless in this ever-changing space. Our clients operate at scale in international markets – you’ll be working with famous brands and household names – no worrying about how to explain what you do to your family again!

We are looking for a Data Engineer for our projects in MK Operations

Responsabilities:


Develop Transformation and ETL logic to populate in a Centralized Repository by collecting data from the different sources in different formats.


Experience in Data Extraction, Transforming and Loading ETL between Homogenous and Heterogeneous Systems.


Exposure on development staging production environments.


Requirements:


Bachelors' degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent graduates


Minimum 2 years of experience


Strong data extraction & SQL query skills


Strong understanding of database design technique and dimension modelling.


Strong understanding of Data integration.


Strong Analytical and problem-solving skills.


Strong understanding of Python and Java applied to data processes.


Ability and willingness to acquire knowledge about the new technologies, good analytical and interpersonal skills with ability to interact with individuals at all levels.


Nice to have:


Fluent English


Proficient in implementing all transformations available using GCP tools.


Previous experience on developments with Apache Beam and Apache POI

Title: Customer Intelligence Analyst
Description:
¿Qué puede salir bien, cuando puedes ser TÚ, también en el trabajo? En Zurich, trabajamos cada día para que encuentres el espacio para ser quién eres. No somos perfect@s, creemos en la diversidad y apostamos por su riqueza.

Cuidar de tu bienestar es nuestra prioridad, por ello apostamos por la flexibilidad para que puedas dar lo mejor de ti, cuidando de lo que más te importa.

La sensibilidad con el medio ambiente forma parte de nuestro ADN. Podrás involucrarte con acciones reales que generan impacto para construir un planeta más sostenible.

¿Te imaginas lo épico que puede ser trabajar en una compañía que lidera el cambio ? Nosotros ya nos hemos puesto en marcha y estamos revolucionando la forma de hacer seguros. De ahí nace Klinc , nuestro seguro 100% digital que ya lo está petando.

Para construir un futuro brillante , hacen falta gestos épicos . ¿Lo hacemos?

¿Cuál será tu reto?

Tu objetivo será el de recopilar, analizar y utilizar datos relacionados con los clientes con el fin de mejorar la toma de decisiones en Zurich. Identificar tendencias, patrones y comportamientos del cliente para ayudar a desarrollar mejor la estrategia de la compañía.

¿Cómo será tu día a día?


Recopilación, explotación y análisis de datos de clientes provenientes de diversas fuentes para sacar conclusiones.
Ofrecer conocimientos técnicos para definir, extraer y sintetizar datos de clientes para ayudar en la toma de decisiones y la identificación de oportunidades.
Actualización y seguimiento de los dashboards de cliente. Detección de incidencias y mejoras.
Presentar los resultados de los análisis realizados adaptándolos al foro para mejorar la comprensión y toma de decisiones.
Analizar y crear puntos de vista basados en los datos disponibles y en los requisitos establecidos por otras áreas a fin de ofrecer información detallada para contribuir a mejorar el desarrollo de la estrategia.
Gestionar diversos proyectos simultáneamente para cumplir plazos acordados.
Formar parte de equipos multidisciplinares de proyectos relacionados con datos de clientes para garantizar el cumplimiento normativo (compliance) y GDPR.
Impulsar la Visión Única de Cliente
Interactuar con IT y Data Governance el seguimiento y evolución del repositorio MDM (Master Data Management)
Detectar necesidades de mejora de explotación de datos de cliente.
Seguimiento, diseño y creación de KPIs de cliente.
Participación en proyectos de segmentación de clientes, de mediadores, de modelos de propensión, de cálculos de valor del cliente.


Para tener éxito en el rol sería ideal:


Grado Estadística, Matemáticas, Económicas o similar. Master relacionado con data (Big data, Inteligencia del dato, Data science), gestión o similar.
Experiencia en puestos similares de gestión del dato de clientes en los últimos 5 años.
Conocimiento de herramientas actuales de BI, Data Science, ML. (p.e. Microstrategy, Python, Power BI).
Experiencia en proyectos transversales y construcción del dato.
Habilidades de comunicación y estructuración de presentaciones con mensajes claros y con impacto.
Capacidad analítica y agilidad numérica.
Trabajo en equipo y adaptabilidad al cambio.
Visón Cliente.
Orientado a resultados.
Nivel alto de Inglés.


#PorSerDeZurich

Nos interesa tu bienestar y queremos cuidar de ti. Estos serán algunos de tus beneficios:


FlexWork: nos gusta la flexibilidad. Por ello, te ofrecemos un modelo híbrido mega flexible para trabajar cómo y dónde quieras. Te ayudamos con un bono de oficina en casa.
Tickets restaurant para que disfrutes de tus restaurantes y deliveries favoritos de lunes a domingo.
En Zurich, tu descanso es importante. Tendrás 25 días de vacaciones, y además te regalamos el día del seguro y el día de tu cumpleaños para que disfrutes de lo que más te gusta.
Retribución flexible: te ofrecemos diferentes opciones para que elijas las que más te encajan: Seguro médico, guardería, formación, etc.
Podrás disfrutar de un día de trabajo remunerado para dedicarlo al voluntariado que elijas.
Oportunidades Zurich, para que puedas moverte a otras áreas de la compañía a nivel local o internacional.
Cuidamos de tu desarrollo: tendrás más horas de e-learning que series en Netflix, plan personalizado de mentoring, formación en skills digitales, etc.
¿Quieres perfeccionar tu nivel de inglés? ¡Te ayudamos y te ofrecemos clases!
¡Asegúrate con Zurich! Tenemos muchos descuentos en productos aseguradores y ventajas bancarias.
En Zurich, pensamos en tu futuro y disponemos de plan de jubilación y seguro de vida.
Mens sana in corpore sano . ¿Eres runner o te encantaría empezar? ¡Te ofrecemos inscripciones gratis a nuestras carreras! ¿Lo tuyo es entrenar en el gym? ¡También tenemos descuentos para ti!
Referral bonus si nos recomiendas algún talento top como tú.


“Zurich, Nº 1 en Top Employers 2023.

Ya son 16 años consecutivos entre las empresas mejor valoradas”

En Zurich, estamos orgullosos de nuestros colores y creemos que un equipo diverso marca la diferencia. Queremos incorporar a personas diferentes, únicas y excepcionales. Para ello, aplicamos una política de igualdad de oportunidades que no deja a nadie atrás.

Estamos construyendo una compañía en la que todas las personas son bienvenidas. En caso de diversidad funcional, no dudes en aplicar. ¡Nos encantará conocerte!

Que puedas ser TÚ es nuestra prioridad, porque juntos llegamos más lejos.

¡Únete y #HagámosloÉpico!

Title: Credit Data Analyst with English - PageGroup SSC
Description:
Great opportunity to boost your career in Finance!|International Company SSC in Barcelona




About Our Client




At the heart of PageGroup's business are the thousands of people's lives we change, the outstanding service we provide to our clients and candidates and the exciting opportunities within our offices all over the world. We're proud to set the standard in the recruitment profession - our specialist service with a personal touch is how we change lives for people through creating opportunity to reach potential.




PageGroup was established in the UK in 1976. We're now a FTSE 250 organization with operations in 36 countries, providing recruitment services and career opportunities at a local regional and global level.




In Barcelona, our Shared Services Centre regroups positions to support our operations in Europe and globally. Find out more here: https://www.pagepersonnel.es/clientprofile/pagegroup-shared-services-centre




Job Description




Being based in our Barcelona Shared Services Centre within the Order-to-Cash department, the role supports the creation and growth of a global team in charge of credit & litigation management. The position aims to provide support to the regional credit teams through data analysis, reporting & efficiency improvement. In the first few months the role will be dedicated to support the launch/stabilization of the activities and will evolve to data-driven/reporting activity.




Support customer data collection process (optimization of the credit application)
Extract information & data from the different systems (Sales, Finance & PowerBI)
Work with the credit bureau to interpret, automate & integrate data within reporting
Ensure data accuracy & consistency to ensure correctness of credit risk & litigation reporting
Work closely with the different stakeholders (Project team, IT, Credit Managers, local finance business partner) in order to design, maintain, automate and optimize PowerBI reports
Prepare monthly, quarterly and adhoc credit & litigation report, KPIs & analysis to be reviewed by the regional credit managers
Investigate inconsistencies, answer queries from the credit managers & resolve them in collaboration with the different teams
Produce mass credit scoring to be reviewed by the credit manager
Manage credit risk alert received from credit bureau
When needed produce Market & business risk report
Participate in Finance improvement projects through supporting the implementation of new processes, tools automation and best practices.
The Successful Applicant
Administrative, data analyst degree or
Ideally prior experience in:
working in finance/O2C and shared service center environment
collaborating effectively with international team/cross-team to deliver
Good knowledge of all core MS Office applications, especially
Knowledge in powerBi will be a plus
Analytical, problem-solving mindset understanding on how to handle, resolve issues
Dynamic, organized with a methodical
Proven ability to work independently and take
Continuous improvement mindset
Outstanding attention to details and accuracy; ability to identify data are correct, complete and consistent
Excellent communication
Fluency in English is a must
What's on Offer




Experience in a multinational environment (+40 nationalities in the SSC)
Competitive compensation and benefits package in Barcelona, various well-being activity options
Contact: Dogukan Akin




Quote job ref: JN-032023-5983217

Title: BUSINESS ANALYST DATA
Description:
Descripción




Somos una Consultora de Recursos Humanos especializada en la captación de talento para organizaciones empresariales. En ISPROX tenemos el objetivo de seleccionar talento para las compañías que mejor cuiden el capital humano y tengan en el centro de sus políticas a las personas. Apostamos por estar cerca de nuestros clientes y candidatos con una amplia red de delegaciones en España, Francia, Portugal, Holanda y México.




Funciones




Desde Isprox estamos buscando un/a un Business Analyst con el objetivo de analizar la BBDD con una visión negocio y cliente desarrollando informes para el análisis del negocio.




La persona seleccionada se incorporará establemente en el equipo de Data Analytics dentro de un importante cliente del entorno financiero.




Responsabilidades principales:




Analizar BBDD bajo la visión negocio y clientes.
Recoger las necesidades de negocio y asesorar sobre su impacto.
Definir y diseñar el entorno de generación de informes, incluidas las fuentes de datos, la seguridad y los metadatos. (Uso de herramientas de visualización como PowerBI).
Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con clientes y el equipo de Data para priorizar y definir los requisitos comerciales.
Identificar y comprender problemas y oportunidades. Reconocer omisiones o ambigüedades de los requisitos del usuario.
Iniciativas de apoyo, toma de decisiones estratégicas sobre nuevos proyectos.




Requisitos




Mínimo 1 año de experiencia como Business Analyst.
Formación: Ingeniería Informática / Datos / Telecomunicaciones / Matemáticas.
Fuertes habilidades analíticas.
Experiencia en el trabajo en equipos ágiles, receptivos a las cambiantes prioridades comerciales.
Inglés fluido.
Conocimiento de herramientas de visualización: Power BI, Click o similar
Conocimientos de SQL.
Buen nivel de Excel.
Residencia en Terrassa o alrededores.




Se ofrece




Contratación indefinida y estable. Buscamos a una persona que quiera permanecer en una empresa potente con buen clima laboral, y crecer en autonomía y responsabilidades.
Flexibilidad horaria de Lunes-Viernes, posibilidades flexibles de diseñar tu propio horario (teletrabajo&presencial).
Progresión y crecimiento profesional y salarial, sin límite. Buscamos a una persona con ambición y deseo de prosperar profesionalmente.
Show more Show less

Requisitos


  • Mínimo 1 año de experiencia como Business Analyst.
  • Formación: Ingeniería Informática / Datos / Telecomunicaciones / Matemáticas.
  • Fuertes habilidades analíticas.
  • Experiencia en el trabajo en equipos ágiles, receptivos a las cambiantes prioridades comerciales.
  • Inglés fluido.
  • Conocimiento de herramientas de visualización: Power BI, Click o similar
  • Conocimientos de SQL.
  • Buen nivel de Excel.
  • Residencia en Terrassa o alrededores.


Se ofrece


  • Contratación indefinida y estable. Buscamos a una persona que quiera permanecer en una empresa potente con buen clima laboral, y crecer en autonomía y responsabilidades.
  • Flexibilidad horaria de Lunes-Viernes, posibilidades flexibles de diseñar tu propio horario (teletrabajo&presencial).
  • Progresión y crecimiento profesional y salarial, sin límite. Buscamos a una persona con ambición y deseo de prosperar profesionalmente.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Acquisition
Description:
Our mission? Creating the finance solution that energizes SMEs and freelancers, so they can achieve more. We simplify everything from everyday banking to bookkeeping and spend management. At Qonto, we’re passionate about creating the best product, so if you’re looking for an ambitious team that’s revolutionizing an old-fashioned industry, get in touch!

Our journey: Alexandre and Steve launched Qonto in July 2017. Since then, the team has earned the trust of more than 350,000 customers and opened offices in Paris, Berlin, Milan, and Barcelona. Last summer, we joined forces with Penta, a market leader based in Berlin and Belgrade, forming a united team of 1000 Qontoers. We also made it to the Top 3 of LinkedIn Top Startups France !

Our values:

Ambition | We tackle big challenges. No matter what.

Teamwork | We create momentum by working together, at the same speed.

Mastery | We pursue excellence through continuous learning. We face challenges with humility. Every day.

Integrity | We're open. We're honest. And we earn the trust of our clients and each other.

You can find out more about the Qonto Way here .

Our beliefs: Diversity brings success. We actively recruit people from a range of backgrounds, employ inclusive hiring techniques; and work with our external partners to continually increase and improve our DEI initiatives. As a result, we obtained a rating of 87/100 in 2023 for the annual Index of professional equality and are happy to say that 44% of our teams are women.

To follow Qonto's ambition in terms of data we created the Data team, handling Data Analysis, Engineering, and Science. The data department has grown from 5 to 50 people within two years (and we're still hiring)!

Business Intelligence is key in any business and so it is at Qonto! As a Senior Data Analyst, you will join the BI team (25 talented business data analysts), and be focused on supporting our growth team to grow our revenues and client base by optimizing the onboarding funnel, acquiring more and better clients, retaining and upselling our existing clients

You will be in charge of enabling functional teams in their decisions with self-service data monitoring and alerting.

⛳️ As Senior Data Analyst - Acquisition at Qonto, you will

Define the right performance indicators to help the business team measure without bias the performance of their teams, initiatives, or product features
Build Dashboards and cockpits that allow each business team to pinpoint abnormalities in the performance.
Monitor KPIs proactively and raise alerts to business teams when abnormalities happen.
Build and scale the data analytics stack: Write advanced SQL queries to build data marts and support best practices in developing documentation and training to enable self-serve analytics for functional team


🚀 Example of our projects

Build the acquisition cockpit to monitor the attributed volumes, spending, and value of our client acquisition strategy
Monitor the OKRs of our 4 markets (FR, DE, IT, and ES) to help Country directors to steer their teams
Build the monitoring of the retention of our clients once they started paying their subscriptions and deep dive into the reason for churn
Monitor the drops on the onboarding funnel starting from the website, through the register with both products & ops teams


🔥 What You Can Expect

Work in a fast-paced multicultural environment with a strong focus on quality
Be autonomously in charge of your own project passing through all stages: understanding business needs, data modeling, and visualizing data.
Find solutions for the business needs of different departments: Finance, Growth, Operations, Strategy, Product
Share Knowledge: across the whole tech team (internal & external talk, weekly meetings, tech monthly) and the community (articles & Meetups)


⚙️ The stack we mainly use

Warehouse and SQL: Snowflake ❄️
ETL: Airflow & DBT
Data Visualization: Tableau & Metabase


🤝 About Your Future Manager

Omar is in charge of 2 Data Analyst teams: Growth & Strategy/People.

Their Background?


After passing through french companies both in the airline & e-commerce industries, Omar grew Qonto’s Data Analysts team from 4 generalists to 20+ DA split into 5 specialized teams. He also reached to build robust guidelines for Qonto’s Data project management, Data Visualization, and QA standards.

What do they bring to the team?


Together with the Lead Data Analysts, Omar promotes healthy communication between team members, continuously improves the team’s operating system, accelerates all team members’ growth towards proficiency... and chases all sources of waste which can bring down the team’s morale and velocity!

🏅About You

Experience: You have at least 3 years of experience in data analysis, ideally in a start-up, tech, or consulting environment. You are familiar with attribution models, and marketing campaign data and you know the difference between Front End events tracking and back-end data. Experience with a/b testing is a plus

Business & solution-oriented mindset : You are able to understand business problems, curious to dive into detailed data, yet able to zoom out and see the big picture, which allows you to provide actionable insights to your business partners across varied scopes.

You have excellent communication skills and the ability to adapt messaging to technical and non-technical audiences.

Mastery: You are eager to improve. You know how to understand stakeholder challenges. You have a strong command of SQL, Data modeling, Data visualization. Knowledge of Tableau is a huge plus.

Languages : You speak English

Qonto is an open-minded company. Don’t tick all the boxes? Apply and we’ll let you know if we think you could fit the role. You never know ☺️

🎁 Perks

A laptop. An inclusive work environment. A tailor-made career track. And so much more to help you succeed…

A central fully-renovated building in Barcelona with WeWork services
Monthly team events
Tailor-made remote work policy depending on the job you apply for
23 days of paid leave + 5 additional days of paid leave
Alan ( Seguro ) health insurance, Moka Care to take care of your mental health and gym access with Urban Sports Club
An Edenred lunch card: 100% covered
50% public transportation reimbursement
A progressive parenthood policy as part of our commitment to the Parental Act (1 in 6 of Qonto employees is a parent!) and childcare benefits with selected partners


💪 Our hiring process:

Interviews with your Talent Acquisition Manager and future managers
A remote exercise to demonstrate your skills and give you a taste of what working at Qonto could be like


We will send you an interview guide so you can best prepare yourself.

On average our process lasts 20 working days and offers usually follow within 48 hours 🤞

Thank you for considering joining Qonto. We cannot wait to learn more about you!

One last thing. We recently raised 486M€ in our Series D to ensure we keep growing safely, despite the current economic environment looking a bit gloomy. We revealed our plans for the future here .

To learn more about us:

Qonto's Blog | Business Insider | Metropoli Abierta | Europa Press

Title: Consultor Power BI
Description:
Job Description

Buscamos gente como tú: ¡Que disfrutas de tu trabajo, aceptas retos para llegar más lejos en tu carrera, te sientes orgulloso de pertenecer a una compañía Top Employer, te gusta el trabajo en equipo y colaborar con tu experiencia para que todos seamos mejores en nuestro día a día!

¿Quieres recibir formación en últimas tecnologías y tener la posibilidad de certificarte de manera gratuita?

¿Quieres trabajar en un ambiente dinámico, con proyectos de gran envergadura aplicando tecnología de última generación y trabajar en equipo con profesionales de primer nivel?

Buscamos en cualquier localización a varios Consultores Power BI , apasionados por los datos en todas sus formas y procesos. Extracción, transformación, procesamiento y visualización.

Imprescindible


Experto en PowerBI, tanto en las áreas de visualización, como especialmente, modelado
Conocimiento de las herramientas complementarias a PowerBI (DAX Studio, Tabular Editor,)
Optimización de rendimiento en PowerBI
Utilización de Data Warehouses y modelización usando metodologías Kimball/Inmon
Experiencia en entornos empresariales complejos y con grandes volumetrías de datos
Trabajo en equipo usando frameworks agile
Interlocución con áreas de negocio
Comunicación en inglés
Proactividad y ganas de aportar.


Deseable


Experiencia usando PowerBI en escenarios de tiempo real/streaming
Conocimiento de otras herramientas de la Power Platform (PowerAutomate, PowerApps)
Experiencia en plataformas de Datos cloud (Snowflake, Azure Synapse,..)


¿Qué beneficios ofrecemos en Avanade?


Horario que te permitirá conciliar vida laboral y personal.
Participación en proyectos importantes para clientes de primer nivel nacional e internacional.
Una atractiva remuneración compuesta por un salario bruto anual y un programa de beneficios corporativos y retribución flexible.


Puedes revisar la lista completa de beneficios en el siguiente enlace: benefits-spain.pdf (avanade.com)

¿Estás interesado? ¡Inscríbete ahora!

Te esperamos ¡Avanade es tu compañía!

About Avanade

Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.

We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.

We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping young people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.

Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

Title: Senior Game Data Analyst
Description:
At Tilting Point, we combine data, technology, talent and groundbreaking marketing to scale games to success.

As the Senior Game Data Analyst, you will work closely with game teams to help inform decision-making regarding features of the game, balancing, player interactions, finding hidden opportunities and much more.

Your Future at Tilting Point

Analyze large, complex datasets to address ad-hoc and long-term operational and strategic business questions
Draw meaningful conclusions and provide actionable insights from data to shape and influence in-game features, economies, and future product roadmaps
Own the taxonomy for game data, ensuring all key performance metrics are measurable and can be analyzed efficiently.
Present analytical findings as both written communication and visual representations that are clear, concise, and understandable, to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Build relationships with stakeholders and processes around data deliverables to ensure data driven decisions can be made at all levels across Tilting Point
Collaborate with all teams at Tilting Point, driving and supporting data and analytics related projects with game team, User Acquisition, Marketing, Engineering, and more


Your XP & Skills

Effectively communicate in English across verbal and written form.
University degree (BA or BS) in Analytics, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Management, Information Systems, Computer Science or a related field
3+ years of work experience as a data analyst or scientist, supporting consumer-facing products, mobile app/game preferred
Proficient with SQL
2+ years with Python/R a plus
Adept in at least one visualization tool such as Tableau
Familiarity with PySpark and/or Amplitude a plus
Passionate about mobile/social gaming with a good understanding of the market.


Location

This position is 100% hybrid from Spain, preferably in the Barcelona area.

What We Offer

Unlimited Vacation Policy, on top of the 23 official vacation days.
Home office expenses bonus & WFH setup support
Wellness & Sports monthly allowance
Daily Meal allowance [Flexoh]
Flexible retribution program for Childcare and Public Transportation [Flexoh]
Private Health Insurance, covering you and your first family circle (Partner, Children) [DKV Integral Elite]
Training & Development support
Sabbatical program for your 5th and 10th anniversary at Tilting Point
4 Office Closing days, on top of the regular Bank Holidays (distributed throughout the year)
Spanish, Catalan and English group language lessons (online)
Annual Tax Declaration aid bonus
Work time reduction for new parents upon returning from Parental Leave
Office in Gracia with drinks, coffee, healthy snacks, plug & play set up, and events.


Interested? We would love to hear from you!

All submissions are confidential.

Direct applicants only - No agencies/headhunters.

Tilting Point provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, promotion, termination, time off, and compensation.
Show more Show less

Title: DATA ENGINEER
HTML:
Join us at Allianz and become a part of a team that is making a difference in people's lives.

We're seeking individuals with a passion for big data and a drive to deliver insights that truly help people during their toughest times.

What are you going to do in Allianz? 

  • Engage directly with stakeholders to understand their needs;
  • Work in a highly collaborative team to find solutions to business problems,
  • Contribute to the solutions at the backend of the data stack, from ETL to data modelling. Also, including frontend, like dashboards;
  • Take ownership and responsibility for the quality of the solutions and ensure best practices are used;
  • Learn new technical skills and help the team succeed;
  • Collaborate with other teams within the Allianz Group.

What does Allianz need from you? 
  • Strong academic background in mathematics, statistics, IT engineering or similar;
  • Fluency in English and Spanish;
  • Excellent SQL and query optimization skills and good understanding of data modelling techniques;
  • Solid Python programming and experience building data pipelines;
  • Azure or experience with other cloud vendors;
  • Ability to understand business needs and turn them into meaningful data products;
  • Self-starter with a drive and curious mindset;
  • Willingness to step outside their comfort zone to broaden skills and learn new technologies;
  • High level of collaboration and open to sharing knowledge and feedback.
  • Bonus skills include:
    • Experience with CI/CD automation and tools like Github Actions;
    • Experience with Luigi/Airflow;
    • Experience with BI and Analytics tools such as PowerBI;
    • Experience with Docker, K8s;
    • Experience with Insurance and SAS language;
    • Exposure to Agile workplace.

What does Allianz offer you?

  • A hybrid working model;
  • Offices that adapt to your needs, with a smart working model and collaborative spaces;
  • Flexible hours so that you can have a good balance between your personal and work life;
  • Specific training in your field of activity and You Learn We Pay program;
  • Multiple employee discounts in sports centers - mens sana in corpore sano;
  • Financial compensation for lunch and teleworking expenses;
  • Special prices in our insurance products for you and your family;
  • Many more benefits...

24397 | Ingeniería informática y tecnológica | Junior | Non-Executive | Allianz Spain | Jornada completa | Indefinido

El Grupo Allianz es una de las compañías asesguradoras y de gestión de activos de mayor confianza en el mundo. Cuidar a nuestros empleados, sus ambiciones, sueños y desafíos, es lo que nos convierte en un empleador único. Juntos podemos construir un entorno en el que todos se sientan empoderados y con la confianza para explorar, crecer y dar forma a un futuro mejor para nuestros clientes y el mundo que nos rodea.

En Allianz creemos en una plantilla diversa e inclusiva y estamos orgullosos de ser un empleador que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades. Te animamos a dar lo mejor de ti en el trabajo, sin importar de dónde eres, tu aspecto, a quién amas o en qué crees.

Por lo tanto, consideramos solicitudes de empleo independientemente de su origen étnico o cultural, edad, género, nacionalidad, religión, capacidad diferente u orientación sexual.

Únete a nosotros. Let´s care for tomorrow.

Nota: La diversidad de mentes es una parte integral de la cultura empresarial de Allianz. Una forma de lograr equipos diversos es a través de la rotación regular de los empleados Executive de Allianz entre funciones, entidades de Allianz y geografías . Por lo tanto, la compañía espera de sus empleados una apertura general y una alta motivación para cambiar de puesto con regularidad y recopilar experiencias en todo el Grupo Allianz ".

Title: Power BI Specialist
Description:
Etnia Barcelona (www.etniabarcelona.com) es mucho más que una marca de gafas independiente. Es color, calidad y cultura. Somos rebeldes y libres, innovadores y valientes. Nuestras gafas son el reflejo de una manera de ser, un estilo de vida, una actitud. Puro carácter mediterráneo. Y, por supuesto, puro TALENTO: un equipo joven, creativo y multicultural que comparte el amor por el arte, que se emociona con el trabajo bien hecho y siempre busca más allá.




Necesitamos para incorporarse en nuestro equipo de IT un experto en Power BI.

Sus funciones principales son:




- Elaboración y publicación de dashboards según las necesidades en las áreas de finanzas y comercial de la compañía.

- Mejoramiento continuo de catálogos y reportes existentes.

- Atender requerimientos de transformación de data para presentación de resultados usando herramienta Microsoft Power BI




Requisitos indispensables:




Que se encuentre cursando el último año de Ingeniería Informática o ciclo equivalente.
Conocimientos de IT: Base de datos relacionales, SQL Server (DDL, DML, DCL), SSDT (Analysis Services, Reporting Services, Intregration Services), Power bi.

Experiencia laboral mínima de 1 a 3 años en puesto similar

Conocimientos en ETLs
Conocimientos de MySQL
Poseer certificaciones en SQL, Bussines Analytics o similares.

Política de trabajo flexible

Title: Data & BI Lead - Barcelona
Description:
About the role



We are currently looking for a Data & BI Lead to help solve client business challenges overseeing a team of data professionals and implementing structure data strategies in a digital media environment.

Day to day you will work with multiple clients to understand their data needs and provide solutions that meet their unique requirements. The role involves utilizing tools such as a Presto-like platform to extract, transform, and load data for reporting and analytics purposes, while also providing support to the data science department. The Data Management Lead is responsible for ensuring the accuracy and integrity of data through the implementation of quality control procedures. This role requires a strong leader who is up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data management.




About Locaria



Locaria blends insight, data, talent and technology to take global content further for ambitious brands.



We are a pioneering multilingual content activation agency which specialises in supporting marketing and e-commerce teams, media agencies and creative production houses. We are central to the global content solution of Stagwell, the challenger advertising network.



Home to the Association of Translation Companies' Innovator of the Year
Shortlisted for three business awards by The Drum
Named "Best Workplace for Training & Personal Development" by Adaptive

Every day we celebrate the power of amazing content to engage global audiences. At the heart of this is our diverse global team across ten offices, who believe in our vision that content is an indispensable, strategic service. At the heart of our collaborative culture are our values, which inform everything we do.



If you love great content, understand the importance of local language and culture, and want to be part of a dynamic team, then this is the place for you.





Requirements



Key Responsibilities:



Develop and implement data management strategies to support reporting, dashboarding, and business intelligence initiatives.
Oversee the daily operations of the data management team, ensuring that all tasks are completed efficiently and effectively.
Work closely with the data science department to provide support and guidance on data-related projects and initiatives.
Utilise Presto-like tools to extract, transform, and load data for reporting and analytics purposes.
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data by implementing and enforcing data quality control procedures.
Collaborate with multiple clients to understand their data needs and provide solutions that meet their unique requirements.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data management, making recommendations for improvements and new solutions as needed.


You will have the following core skills and abilities:



Strong knowledge of SQL
Good understanding of data structures and processes in digital media channels: ideally PPC, shopping, SEO, paid social, display
Experience with PrestoSQL or BigQuery
Experience with GDS, Datorama, Tableau, or similar
Being able to manage a team of data professionals, including setting performance goals, providing coaching and feedback, and fostering a positive team dynamic.
Strong analytical individual who enjoys lateral thinking and problem solving
Proactive individual who is confident taking the initiative and working with colleagues across teams and departments
Experience in client facing situations; pitching, presenting and discussing activity in emails, calls and in meetings


You will be:



Friendly, approachable and able to collaborate with both technical and non-technical colleagues.
Curious, adaptive, and proactive - continually looking for new opportunities for the Data team to work with clients and Locaria as well as its sister agencies in the Stagwell network.
Highly organised in order to keep on top of multiple projects at once

Successful candidates will have a strong mathematical and technical background. Excellent communication and team skills are vital as the role interfaces across the agency and with clients.



You'll also live up to the Locarian Values:



We take content further
We grow together
Celebrating Individuality
Doing good along the way
With care

Locaria is global by nature and vastly strengthened by multicultural, international and eclectic teams. Working together to achieve shared goals, our employees recognise the importance of our core value ‘celebrating individuality', and are supported by Locaria's breadth of cultural resources and insights that attract and retain the best talent.



We appreciate the unique perspectives and experiences that each person brings to our team and are fully committed to ensuring equal opportunities across the board, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability and gender identity. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let our team know.



Join our team and become part of a vibrant workplace and company culture that values and celebrates individuality!





Benefits



In return for your enthusiasm and expertise, we can offer an exciting and multicultural place of work, competitive salary, wide range of benefits, and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organization.




Some of these benefits include:



Holiday: You will be entitled to 22 working days paid leave per year (pro-rata in first year), excluding public holidays.
Flexible Working: Opportunities to work from home up to 3 days a week through our Flexible Working Policy, and to work from anywhere as part of our Abroad Working Policy.
Refer a Friend Scheme: We're always on the lookout for talented people. If you refer a friend who is then hired, we will award you with a bonus of up to 2,000 Euros depending on the level of the role being recruited for.
Birthday Day Off: As a gift from us you will receive an extra day off for your birthday each year. If your birthday falls on a weekend, then you can take this the Friday before or Monday after.
Rest and recharge: The option to lengthen your standard 1 hour lunch break by 30 minutes, as long as you maintain the same number of hours you work a day.
Time off to volunteer: In line with our 'Doing Some Good Along The Way' value, all employees are entitled to up to 2 days off a year to get involved in charity initiatives.
Annual Wellbeing and Learning & Development Calendars: We promote a healthy working environment with a focus on growth, which is why we have a calendar with dedicated Wellbeing and Learning & Development sessions and initiatives throughout the year
Equipment: You will be equipped with a laptop, extra screen, mouse and keyboard.

Join our team and become part of a vibrant workplace and company culture that values and celebrates individuality!



Benefits

In return for your enthusiasm and expertise, we can offer an exciting and multicultural place of work, competitive salary, wide range of benefits, and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organization.


Some of these benefits include:

  • Holiday: You will be entitled to 22 working days paid leave per year (pro-rata in first year), excluding public holidays.
  • Flexible Working: Opportunities to work from home up to 3 days a week through our Flexible Working Policy, and to work from anywhere as part of our Abroad Working Policy.
  • Refer a Friend Scheme: We're always on the lookout for talented people. If you refer a friend who is then hired, we will award you with a bonus of up to 2,000 Euros depending on the level of the role being recruited for.
  • Birthday Day Off: As a gift from us you will receive an extra day off for your birthday each year. If your birthday falls on a weekend, then you can take this the Friday before or Monday after.
  • Rest and recharge: The option to lengthen your standard 1 hour lunch break by 30 minutes, as long as you maintain the same number of hours you work a day.
  • Time off to volunteer: In line with our 'Doing Some Good Along The Way' value, all employees are entitled to up to 2 days off a year to get involved in charity initiatives.
  • Annual Wellbeing and Learning & Development Calendars: We promote a healthy working environment with a focus on growth, which is why we have a calendar with dedicated Wellbeing and Learning & Development sessions and initiatives throughout the year
  • Equipment: You will be equipped with a laptop, extra screen, mouse and keyboard.

Title: Data Partnerships Senior Analyst – Insights
Description:
Overview




With data deeply embedded in our DNA, PepsiCo Data & Analytics transforms data into consumer delight. We build and organize business-ready data allowing PepsiCo’s leaders to solve business problems with the highest degree of confidence. Our platform of data products and services ensures data is activated at scale. This enables new revenue streams, deeper partner relationships, new consumer experiences, and innovation across the enterprise.




As a member of the Strategy & Ecosystem team, the Senior Analyst of Data Partnerships – Insights will be a key player on the emerging Global Data Partnerships team. This role will develop and leverage/manage strategic data partnerships, data acquisition, data asset optimization, data acquisition efficiencies and innovative solutions to drive business value, speed, and impact.




This is a strategic and dynamic role that is positioned to drive effectiveness creating value through centralized data partner management and data acquisition, with close collaboration across Commercial, Procurement, Audit, Legal, Compliance, Information Technology, Governance and more (navigating account team through to contract and incorporation planning).




Moreover, this person will support building capabilities and best practices in data acquisition and data partner management by bringing together a deep understanding about CPG business and partner assets.




This role will manage a subset of Commercial data partnerships focused on Insights, internal customers and the Enterprise Master Data Management Team and Enterprise Data Governance Team.




Responsibilities




Your day with us:




Help support building a Global Partnerships Center




Manage an assigned group of existing data partnerships
Assist with the onboarding of new data partnerships, assets and tools
Optimize partner asset mix to produce best-in-class solutions




Support building the Global Data Acquisition Strategy & Governance




Determine if existing data partnerships meet the needs of the Commercial organization
Proactively research and understand the global landscape and identify new data opportunities.
Ensure existing data partnerships are delivering quality data, on time and without issues




Help Implement Strategy & Drive Customer Satisfaction




Support the Strategy & Transformation Product Portfolio created out of existing or purposely acquired data that can be used to improve decision making and intelligent action by consumers, the enterprise or other organizations
Support ensuring the Data Partner offers a satisfying service to the business in a timely manner and proactively helps our business partners chose the most effective and valuable External Data Products




Optimize Data Acquisition




Help manage and optimize the respective relationships/contracts with our current and emerging vendors, including third party agreements, data sharing and contracts
Help identify and raise redundancies in data acquisitions and redundancy in resources who are involved in this activity




Qualifications




What will you need to succeed:




Minimum 4 years experience managing data partnerships in the insights, syndicated, research or similar space
Minimum 4 years data management experience (data automation, data quality, data governance, data stewardship)
Minimum 3 years experience in CPG goods industry experience, or related
Commercial, Legal and Regulatory basic knowledge with respect to data acquisition and usage.
Bachelor’s Degree, Masters a plus
Experience with building strategic relationships with partners, leading to valuable business outcomes
Understanding of various types of external data, including retail audit data, transaction data, consumer/household panel, traditional consumer demographic data, category trends and forecasting and more
Exposure to risk assessment and legal reviews of vendor contracts and licensing agreements related to external data
Demonstrated analytics skills and use of multiple software tools
Relevant business experience in meta data management/governance
Contractual Negotiations
Strategic Contract/Account/Vendor Management




Differentiating Competencies Required




Robust data knowledge in CPG industry
Metadata Management and Governance
Knowledge of Consumer Privacy Laws at the Global, Regional and Local Levels
Knowledge of Data Privacy Laws at the Global, Regional, and Local Levels
Willingness to learn
Can operate in a fast moving, changing environment
Advance Negotiation Skills




What makes us different?




Hybrid work model & collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Entrepreneurial environment in leading international company
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
Diverse team from over 25 countries
Have a stake in D&I strategy and Bring your whole self to work




About PepsiCo




We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo. We operate with start-up mindset – agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.




PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization – a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PO5CdBmWjUY




So, if you’re ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we’d love to chat.




 We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability




#Locations: Barcelona, Spain; Vitoria-Gasteiz, Spain

Title: WW Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Responsibilities

Acts conduit and leader between media, data infrastructure, data sciences and marketing teams.
Leads the formalization of goal setting and success measurement process for campaigns and digital projects.
Exercises unique mastery to utilize and optimize marketing dashboards and data models.
Leads the data integrity, data accuracy and testing processes in markets and countries.
Acts as an advocate and thought leader for data and marketing analytics in markets and countries.
Provides senior teams actionable recommendations and strategic plans based on analytical research.
Determines strategy for marketing policies and resolving complex information.
Identifies and determines opportunities for predictive modeling in order to optimize operations and forecast future outcomes.

Knowledge & Skills

Expert in marketing/sales strategies, analyzing data and identifying insights to optimize and develop campaigns, identifying opportunities to improve campaign performance, increasing knowledge of our audiences and answering key marketing & business questions.
Understanding of advanced statistical methods; have an interest in predictive modeling and a passion for digital and social and their implications for the business.
Strong SQL experience working with large customer and transactional databases.
Expert in data visualization software (e.g. Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, Datorama).
Mastery knowledge of marketing principles, practices, activities and procedures.

Impact/Scope

Lead cross-country data-driven actionable planning with high degree of complexity involved in terms of customer or cross-function touchpoints.
Manage large scale of cross-function/ cross-country marketing investment and programs.
Influence marketing investment to strategic programs to optimize revenue and margin.
Provide thought leadership in statistical & analytical modeling to optimize revenue and margin across product/services/solution portfolio.

Complexity

High – Extensive cross- functional/cross-organizational senior management interface; deals with complex strategic issues.

Education & Experience

Bachelor Degree or equivalent in Statistics, Engineering, or Computer Science.
10+ years of work experience in related field.

About HP

You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

Title: Credit Data Analyst with English - PageGroup SSC
Description:
Great opportunity to boost your career in Finance!|International Company SSC in Barcelona




About Our Client




At the heart of PageGroup's business are the thousands of people's lives we change, the outstanding service we provide to our clients and candidates and the exciting opportunities within our offices all over the world. We're proud to set the standard in the recruitment profession - our specialist service with a personal touch is how we change lives for people through creating opportunity to reach potential.




PageGroup was established in the UK in 1976. We're now a FTSE 250 organization with operations in 36 countries, providing recruitment services and career opportunities at a local regional and global level.




In Barcelona, our Shared Services Centre regroups positions to support our operations in Europe and globally. Find out more here: https://www.pagepersonnel.es/clientprofile/pagegroup-shared-services-centre




Job Description




Being based in our Barcelona Shared Services Centre within the Order-to-Cash department, the role supports the creation and growth of a global team in charge of credit & litigation management. The position aims to provide support to the regional credit teams through data analysis, reporting & efficiency improvement. In the first few months the role will be dedicated to support the launch/stabilization of the activities and will evolve to data-driven/reporting activity.




Support customer data collection process (optimization of the credit application)
Extract information & data from the different systems (Sales, Finance & PowerBI)
Work with the credit bureau to interpret, automate & integrate data within reporting
Ensure data accuracy & consistency to ensure correctness of credit risk & litigation reporting
Work closely with the different stakeholders (Project team, IT, Credit Managers, local finance business partner) in order to design, maintain, automate and optimize PowerBI reports
Prepare monthly, quarterly and adhoc credit & litigation report, KPIs & analysis to be reviewed by the regional credit managers

  • Proven ability to work independently and take
  • Continuous improvement mindset
  • Outstanding attention to details and accuracy; ability to identify data are correct, complete and consistent

Title: DATA ENGINEER (CLIENTE FINAL)
Description:
Sebastián Consultores, Headhunter especializado en perfiles tecnológicos, selecciona para importante empresa nacional orientada a servicios de geomarketing y bigdata, un DATA ENGINEER para ampliar el departamento de tecnología.




La persona seleccionada se encargará de:




Diseño de Arquitectura de Datos y procesos de ETL
Construcción y mantenimiento de estructuras de datos. Velar por las políticas de datos de la compañía.
Sincronización con los datos resultantes de los clientes en cada una de las integraciones del producto..
Mantener los programas desarrollados, procurando una continua mejora de los mismos y solventando problemas que limiten su eficiencia.
Colaborar en el diseño técnico de las aplicaciones con los analistas.
Satisfacer las políticas y prácticas relativas a la seguridad de la información




Se ofrece:




Contratación directa por cliente final.
Contrato indefinido.
Posibilidad de teletrabajo (50%) y horario de entrada flexible.
Ambiente laboral técnico. Estructura plana donde se pueden aportar ideas y conocimientos.
Ubicación: Barcelona. Zona L´ Antiga Esquerra de L´ Eixample
Salario Fijo (50-55K) + beneficios sociales (Seguro médico, tickets restaurant, formación…).




Requisitos:




El perfil que buscamos:




Formación Académica: Grado en informática o Matemáticas. Se valorarán otro tipo de formación relacionada con el puesto.




Experiencia de, al menos, 4 años en el desarrollo de las funciones con:




Dominio de Ingeniería de datos a través de Python y SQL.
Conocimientos DataCloud: Snowflake.
Domino con desarrollos de ETL y Statistical Programming.
Experiencia demostrable con Pipeline de Datos y herramientas de catálogos de datos.
Experiencia en diseño de modelos analíticos y Data Visualization.
Conocimientos de Machine Learning y Analítica Predictiva.
Metodologías Agiles (SCRUM, Kanban)




Se valorará:




Nivel de inglés alto.
Conocimientos sobre Geomarketing, geoposicionamiento y mejoras funcionales sobre producto tecnológico.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
¡En K-LAGAN te estamos esperando para continuar creciendo juntos!




Somos una empresa estratégica internacional de servicios tecnológicos, comprometida esencialmente con su equipo y con la sociedad. Ofrecemos soluciones en servicios IT, desarrollos de ingeniería, de electrónica, y proyectos de I+D. Nuestro compromiso es contratar a los mejores talentos independientemente de su raza, religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades, promoviendo su desarrollo profesional y personal.







Misión: Como Data Engineer formarás parte de un equipo de data transversal para IT al tanto de la estrategia de la compañía y participación en la misma, aportando tu visión analítica y tu background técnico, aportando tus propias ideas, nuevos métodos o tecnologías con el objetivo de mejorar el stack tecnológico actual.




Nuestro perfil ideal cuenta con:

•Experiencia práctica con orquestadores de datos (Apache Airflow)

•Experiencia profesional de más de 2 años trabajando con herramientas de cuadros de mando de BI (p. ej. Looker, Power BI, Qlik sense...)

•Sólidos conocimientos de SQL y experiencia trabajando con bases de datos en el cloud (Snowflake es un plus)

•Experiencia de más de 1 año en la creación de pipelines ELT de nivel de producción con DBT




Nuestro proceso de selección incluye:

-Primera entrevista

-Entrevista Técnica /prueba técnica

-Entrevista Final




Además, en K-LAGAN, queremos que disfrutes de toda la experiencia completa de ser parte de nuestro equipo, por ello ofrecemos:




¡IMPRESCINDIBLE! Contrato indefinido y proyecto estable.

MODALIDAD: Híbrido - Barcelona

TEAM BUILDING: Barbacoas, cafés tecnológicos e igual este año se nos ocurren más cosas para estar más cerca de vosotros.

SEGUIMIENTO CONTINUO: contarás con nuestros fantásticos TBM para seguir creciendo y tener feedback sobre tu desempeño y día a día.

DEPARTAMENTO DE CARRERAS Y FORMACIÓN ¿Quieres dar el siguiente paso? ¡Te ayudamos!

EVENTOS ESPECIALES: Cena de verano, Cena de Navidad y Día Solidario.

DÍA CUMPLEAÑOS LIBRE: ¡disfrútalo cómo, dónde y con quién quieras!

AYUDAS en guarderías, KM e idiomas.




¿Crees que podría ser interesante para ti?




¡Escríbeme y lo comentamos!
