About Avanade

Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.

We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.

We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping young people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.

Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

Title: IT Business Analyst - Analytics & Audience Activation
Description:
Position Summary

The Analytics & Audience Activation Analyst will be integrated in the Global team responsible for the implementation of global digital media solutions and digital analytics strategy across the different Nestlé businesses and markets. Working closely with business teams and other IS/IT teams and solutions, will be responsible for enriching the data strategy of Nestlé. We are looking for a candidate who has hands-on expertize on Web Analytics and Insights, who is fully skilled in the Google toolset (Google Marketing Platform) and masters both technical and functional aspects of the products.

As part of the AdTech team you will be responsible for analyzing and refining business and functional requirements and later collaborating with team members to translate these digital requirements into meaningful processes and specifications and ensuring quality products. He/she will solicit requirements through interviews, workshops, and/or existing analytics, systems documentation or procedures, supports implementation team, and ensure functional documentation of the solutions.

As an Analyst you will be supporting the build and deploy of specific AdTech products by analyzing business needs, helping to define project scope and taking part in the implementation of digital packages with internal and external partners ensuring adherence with the architectures, solutions, tools and overall implementation framework.

A day in the life of...

Lead integrations of Google Analytics 360 and Google Analytics 4 with other Digital products used or developed by Nestlé as well as with other Google products (Search, Display, Video, BigQuery).
Gather and validate business requirements for analytics projects and solutions such as: Google Analytics, Google Looker Studio, Google Tag Manager and Google BigQuery.
Define Analytics architecture and implementation best practices.
Deliver consultancy services to our markets and brands on Web Analytics strategy and implementation for websites (WebCMS), eCommerce sites, mobile apps or Chatbots.
Ensure monitoring and control of Global GA and GTM Guidelines across all digital assets of the organization.
Support the design, build and deploy of IT solutions for AdTech at global level to ensure adoption and usage across Nestlé businesses and markets.
Challenges Business stakeholders into improving existing business processes through experience and monitoring of best practices.
Ensure project consistency and relevance by performing scoping assessments to determine feasibility of projects.
Responsible for the collection of Business requirements raised by stakeholders at Nestlé HQ and/or markets, and their analysis to produce functional specifications.
Responsible for the fit/gap analysis by performing system analysis.
Ensure that relevant stakeholders are involved in specification of new services and/or major upgrades to existing services.
Prepare and lead training activities for internal and external stakeholders. Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation (included users’ guidelines and training materials).
Build Strong awareness of latest industry trends to ensure the relevance of Digital Media solutions and active industry benchmarking.


What Will Make You Successful

Degree in IT, Computer Science, Engineering, Digital Business or equivalent work experience.
5+ years of experience working with Google Analytics 360 and Google Tag Manager 360 and their APIs.
5+ years of experience in managing project in Digital media and analytics industry: Web analytics, Display or Search Media, Programmatic Media Buying (preferably on Demand side), Data Management Platforms (DMP)
Experience on analyzing and breaking down problems and information using structured frameworks and methodologies.
Analytical thinking abilities and client facing communication skills
Business focus ability.
Experience with Google Looker Studio, BigQuery and Power BI.
Curiosity to learn and power to adapt, a can-do attitude and receiver obsessed mindset
Ability to develop/maintain productive business relationships.
Excellent English written and oral communications skills.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Mobility: the position may involve international traveling.

The following experience will make you a more successful candidate:

3+ years of experience in a complex, matrix based international company, global environment and with virtual teams.
Experience with “AI for Marketing” leveraging Google Cloud’s BigQuery and ML components.
Experience with Google Tag Manager Server Side Tagging.
Post-degree in Digital Marketing
Experience with multi-source data integration projects.
Experience leveraging MS Sharepoint, MS Teams, JIRA and Confluence.


Benefits

An attractive and dynamic international working environment with the most talented and engaged IT professionals in their field and working with best-in class technologies

Be yourself @Nestlé, everyone else is taken! Our values are rooted in respect, we champion diversity and inclusion, and believe on the power of diversity to build winning teams where everyone can be the best version of themselves

Personal and professional growth through ongoing training and constant career opportunities reflecting our conviction that people are our most important asset

Great benefits including competitive salary and a comprehensive social benefits package

Hybrid working environment with flexible working scheme, allowing everyone to meet their needs enjoying the advantages of remote work and combining with the amazing Nestlé facilities (dog friendly!) and culture.

Join Us!

We are Nestlé, the largest food and beverage company. We are 308,000 employees strong driven by the purpose of enhancing the quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. Our values are rooted in respect: respect for ourselves, respect for others, respect for diversity and respect for our future. With more than CHF 91.4 billion sales in 2018, we have an expansive presence with 413 factories in more than 85 countries. We believe our people are our most important asset, so we'll offer you a dynamic inclusive international working environment with many opportunities across different businesses, functions and geographies, working with diverse teams and cultures. Want to learn more? Visit us at www.nestle.com.

Title: Digital Analyst (They/He/She)
Description:
Adsmurai, compañía tecnológica especializada en estrategia, optimización y automatización de campañas de marketing digital, escala el crecimiento real de las marcas, aunando el mejor talento y soluciones innovadoras.

Nacida con la visión de generar un impacto positivo en las personas a través de una mejor publicidad, dispone de sede en Barcelona y cuatro oficinas en todo el mundo, Adsmurai ha conseguido reunir desde 2014 a más de 300 expertos digitales, creativos y desarrolladores. Siendo una de las únicas compañías a nivel mundial con partnerships oficiales con Facebook, Instagram, Google Premium, Pinterest y TikTok (además de su colaboración con Linkedin, Snapchat y Twitter).



Tras la reciente adquisición de Zinkdo, consultoría y contenido orgánico, y la consolidación de los departamentos Search, Programática y Creatividad, Adsmurai se posiciona en 2023 como una fuerza líder en el mercado digital apostando por la diversificación de servicios full-funnel.
 



🔎 Estamos buscando un/a brillante Digital Analyst para formar parte de nuestro equipo.
 



🚀 Los retos de la posición son:




Seguimiento de los clientes y necesidades respecto a analítica y atribución.
Crear cuadros de mando e informes personalizados en función de los objetivos del cliente.
Identificar activos digitales y estructuras de páginas web que garanticen las mejores mediciones.
Crear/Definir modelos de atribución, embudos, cuadros de mando...
Realizar análisis de usabilidad en diferentes dispositivos (escritorio, tabletas, móviles).
Crear tests A/B y multivariantes para mejorar la tasa de conversión de una web en diferentes dispositivos.
Realizar mediciones cross-device.

 



💯 Eres tú si:




Tienes conocimiento de Google Analytics (o Adobe Analytics).
Tienes experiencia en proyectos de analítica y medición. Entiendes qué métricas son clave para conseguir información relevante que permita tomar decisiones de negocio relacionadas con datos.
Cuentas con experiencia previa en proyectos de data & CRO.
Has utilizado A/B Testing tools (Google Optimize, Optimizely…)






✨ Nice to have:




Conocimientos de Google Tag Manager (u otras herramientas como Tealium, Adobe Dynamic Tag Management, Segment…).
Nociones de Google Analytics 4.
Experiencia con herramientas de visualización de datos (Looker Studio, DataStudio…).
Comprensión y gestión de diferentes modelos de atribución y de mediciones cross-device.
Experiencia en medición de aplicaciones.
Manejo de herramientas de gestión de cookies (CMPs como Cookiebot, OneTrust…).
Muy valorable conocimiento de tecnologías DMP y CDP.

 



🤙🏾 ¿Qué ofrecemos?




Contrato indefinido.
Jornada intensiva los viernes y Agosto.
Flexibilidad horaria de entrada y salida.
Modelo híbrido oficina-remoto.
Crecimiento profesional a través de nuestro Plan de Carrera. Desde tu inicio tu Team Lead te guiará para potenciar tus Soft y Tech Skills.
23 días de vacaciones (+1 por año de antigüedad).
Día libre por tu cumpleaños.
Actividades de equipo y afterworks.
Formación activa.
Clases de inglés.
Acuerdos con gimnasios.
Plan de retribución flexible: seguro médico, ticket restaurante, transporte y/o guardería.

 



🍀 Estos son nuestros valores:




Make things happen: Aplicamos la razón en la toma de decisiones basándonos en datos. Gestionamos de principio a fin y orientándonos a resultados.
Walk, run, fly: Disparamos la proactividad ejecutando ideas. Nos marcamos metas ambiciosas, tenemos curiosidad y no tenemos miedo al fracaso.
Passionate players: Trabajamos con actitud positiva y ponemos pasión en todo lo que hacemos, con perseverancia y orgullo por nuestro trabajo.
Work together: Construimos relaciones de confianza basadas en la honestidad. Escuchamos, empatizamos y respetamos a las personas.






Nuestra cultura está en línea con los valores universales de libertad, cooperación y pasión por mejorar. Trabajamos cada día para que todo el mundo tenga las mismas oportunidades independientemente de su sexo, etnia, nacionalidad, orientación sexual, creencias políticas o religiosas y nunca aprobaremos ninguna acción discriminatoria.



Adsmurai nació en 2014 de una conversación entre amigos y tratamos de mantener y transmitir ese buen rollo y convertirlo en un pilar fundamental de nuestra cultura.



¿A qué estás esperando para unirte?

Title: SQL/R DEVELOPER
Description:
Our Opportunity

We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled SQL Developer with R language experience to join our international Business Technology Solutions organization.

In this role, you will be responsible for supporting accumulation management modelers in the process and workflow automations.

You will be responsible for building new and enhancing existing applications with SQL, making sure they run in a robust and performant manner.

Solutions will be developed for both local and global customers.

You will proactively expand your expertise in both existing and new functionalities, along with best practices in the relevant space, applying these learnings in your daily job.

Your role

As a SQL/R DEVELOPER your main responsibilities will be:


Manage SQL development, able to read and execute SQL execution plan.
Maintaining and optimization of SQL DB.
Manage the solution components and dependencies with other upstream and downstream systems.
Maintain alignment of the solution with application development and security best practices.
Support in testing and validation of changes and automation.
Oversee issue resolution.
Participate in defect triages.
Supporting accumulation management modelers.


Your Skills And Experience

As a SQL/R DEVELOPER your skills and qualifications will ideally include:


University level education or equivalent.
Advanced level of English.
Strong knowledge of SQL (developer able to read and execute SQL execution plan, housekeeping, monitoring the db, optimization – performance management, new implementation).
Understanding of SSIS: ETL processes, automation of process execution troubleshooting, understand dynamic SQL query execution.
Experience in Orchestration (preferably Azure Data Factory)
Experience in R language: package development (i.e., not only scripting)
Knowledge in Tidyverse (collection of R Packages designed for data science)
Knowledge in Webservices
Knowledge in Touchstone APIs
Nice to have understanding of .NET, C#, API
Nice to have understating of Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) deployments.
Nice to have Basic understating of Azure Cloud and Azure DevOps
Soft skills + understating AGILE methodology and principles.
Team collaboration skills
Analytical and problem-solving capabilities


Additional Information

 As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:


Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 100% - you choose
Flexible working hours
Wide range of internal and external trainings
Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs
Ticket restaurant
Life Insurance
Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company
Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you
Special banking and insurance conditions
Exclusive Employees discounts


Primary work location is Barcelona, Poblenou. Please apply with your CV in English by clicking on the button “Apply online”.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer.  We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

You are the heart & soul of Zurich!

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We highly value the experience and know-how of our employees and offer a wide range of opportunities across business areas to encourage you to apply for new opportunities within Zurich when you are ready for your next career step.

Let’s continue to grow together!


Location(s): ES - Barcelona, ES - Remote Work
Remote working: Yes
Schedule: Full Time
Recruiter name: Gallego Zazo Alvaro

Title: AD, IT BP Intl' Data, Analytics & Insights
Description:
30108

Some opportunities happen only once in a lifetime - like a job where you have the chance to change lives. At Alexion, people living with rare and devastating diseases are our Guiding Star. We are driven to continuously innovate and create meaningful value in all we do to help patients and families fully live their best lives. We value the uniqueness and diversity of our employees and recognize that nurturing the diverse perspectives and strengths of our people translates into innovative breakthroughs for patients.

Associate Director,

IT Business Partner International

Data, Analytics & Insights (Rare Disease Unit)

Location: Barcelona

This Is What You Will Do

The IT Business Partner, International Data, Analytics & Insights is responsible for Business engagement and IT alignment at global , regional and country/market level. She/he is responsible of Data, Analytics & Insights cross functional IT demand and delivery portfolio management, enabling strategic alignment, business growth and performance, leveraging the power of Data & Technology to generate business visibility and insights, support existing processes and ensure high level of adoption and prepare our region for next gen of Data solution (AI, ML, etc).. He/She act as interface between International Rare Disease business teams (regional & markets) , International IT business partners (with main focus on commercial, medical, digital & innovation) and our Global Data COEs spread cross geography (US, Ireland, Spain/Barcelona) . Strong understanding of Data EU regulation and compliance strongly recommended.

This role is located in our Alexion Barcelona Hub in Spain and reports to the Head of IT International Rare Disease Unit based in Zurich International HQ .

You Will Be Responsible For

Act as main IT point of contact for Rare Disease business for all Data, Analytics & insight related matters (roadmap, demand & delivery management, new capability, gap analysis & resolution etc)
Responsible for Business partnership & IT strategic alignment supportive of Business & IT/Data COEs objectives and priorities, road mapping, solution co-design, co-creation and delivery , and identifying opportunities to bring value to our business and patients leveraging Enterprise Technology, Digital & Data capability
Ensure IT solution and services are delivered on-time, effective, with high quality and adequately communicated and socialized for enhanced user experience and solution adoption. Lead our improvement effort, identify gaps, build action plan for resolution/enhancement, ensure high level of adoption cross our geography
Agile way of working , user experience and performance focused
Responsible for leading the translation of business requirements to functional and technical requirements, planning and project managing on execution, through sprint cadences and continuous development practices, in close collaboration business, IT organization and COEs, Privacy, quality & security etc groups.
Act as IT local escalation point, address employee service concerns and escalations from technology and process perspective, reroot to relative IT functions within IT RdU and/Or AZ IT technology services

You Will Need To Have

Fluent in English , Spanish is a strong plus
Experience leading Analytics groups / program supporting commercial, medical or R&D preferable in pharma environment
Bachelor / Master Degree
Demonstrated experience as Data SMEs /IT business analyst managing business engagement and relationship in data analytics and insights scope
Experiences in Project management
Experience in data integrations, data modelling, BI and data analytics and reporting (Qlik & Power BI preferred), exposure to data lake, Veeva CRM/SFDC, Query & Developpement (SQL, Python, ..)
Pharma & biotech experience preferred
Experience in advanced analytics, predictive analysis, AI/ML a strong plus for future internal opportunities
Strong analytical skills and business process oriented. Attention to detail and ability to think strategically and see the big picture. Communication efficient at all level of the organization
Innovative and autonomous leader. Strong team player, collaborator and networker
Ability to operate in matricial environment.
Role is office based

We Would Prefer For You To Have

10 years progressive similar experiences
Proven track record of delivering strategy and solution on Data analytics, insights , advanced analytics, - Gathering business requirement, building data roadmap. delivering on objectives and influencing key business stakeholders in matricial and pharma environment
SDLC , LMS, Project management/PMI demonstrated exposure and experience

Alexion is a global biopharmaceutical company focused on serving patients and families affected by rare diseases and devastating conditions through the discovery, development and commercialization of life-changing medicines. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Alexion has offices around the globe and serves patients in more than 50 countries. Further information about Alexion can be found at: www.alexion.com.

Alexion is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where every single person can belong because of their uniqueness. The Company will not make decisions about employment, training, compensation, promotion, and other terms and conditions of employment based on race, color, religion, creed or lack thereof, sex, sexual orientation, age, ancestry, national origin, ethnicity, citizenship status, marital status, pregnancy, (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), parental status (including adoption or surrogacy), military status, protected veteran status, disability, medical condition, gender identity or expression, genetic information, mental illness or other characteristics protected by law. Alexion provides reasonable accommodations to meet the needs of candidates and employees. To begin an interactive dialogue with Alexion regarding an accommodation, please contact accommodations@Alexion.com. Alexion participates in E-Verify.

AstraZeneca completed its acquisition of Alexion, marking the creation of Alexion, AstraZeneca Rare Disease. If you're interested in career opportunities with AstraZeneca, click here.

HTML:
30108

Some opportunities happen only once in a lifetime - like a job where you have the chance to change lives. At Alexion, people living with rare and devastating diseases are our Guiding Star. We are driven to continuously innovate and create meaningful value in all we do to help patients and families fully live their best lives. We value the uniqueness and diversity of our employees and recognize that nurturing the diverse perspectives and strengths of our people translates into innovative breakthroughs for patients.

Associate Director,

IT Business Partner International

Data, Analytics & Insights (Rare Disease Unit)

Location: Barcelona

This Is What You Will Do

The IT Business Partner, International Data, Analytics & Insights is responsible for Business engagement and IT alignment at global , regional and country/market level. She/he is responsible of Data, Analytics & Insights cross functional IT demand and delivery portfolio management, enabling strategic alignment, business growth and performance, leveraging the power of Data & Technology to generate business visibility and insights, support existing processes and ensure high level of adoption and prepare our region for next gen of Data solution (AI, ML, etc).. He/She act as interface between International Rare Disease business teams (regional & markets) , International IT business partners (with main focus on commercial, medical, digital & innovation) and our Global Data COEs spread cross geography (US, Ireland, Spain/Barcelona) . Strong understanding of Data EU regulation and compliance strongly recommended.

This role is located in our Alexion Barcelona Hub in Spain and reports to the Head of IT International Rare Disease Unit based in Zurich International HQ .

You Will Be Responsible For
  • Act as main IT point of contact for Rare Disease business for all Data, Analytics & insight related matters (roadmap, demand & delivery management, new capability, gap analysis & resolution etc)

Lead our improvement effort, identify gaps, build action plan for resolution/enhancement, ensure high level of adoption cross our geography

  • Responsible for leading the translation of business requirements to functional and technical requirements, planning and project managing on execution, through sprint cadences and continuous development practices, in close collaboration business, IT organization and COEs, Privacy, quality & security etc groups.

Title: Senior Data Engineer (based in any location in Spain)
Description:
As Google Cloud's premier partner in AI, we provide world-class businesses with cutting-edge data solutions in the cloud. We help clients take leading technology to the limits by combining our expertise in machine learning, data engineering, and analytics. With Google Cloud as our foundation, we help businesses future-proof their solutions, deepen their understanding of consumers, increase competitive advantage and unlock operational efficiencies.

Our team consists of experts in machine learning, data science, software engineering, mathematics, and design. We share a passion for data & analysis, operate at the cutting edge, and believe in a pragmatic approach to solving hard problems.

THE ROLE

As a Data Engineer you will work with colleagues on the data engineering and architecture part of our consulting projects, building robust pipelines and wrangling data in a way that it becomes easy to visualise and ready to be fed into our machine learning models. In addition to that, you will be helping us to build out the data engineering side of our next-generation machine learning products.

Furthermore, you will:

Work with the most innovative and most scalable data processing technologies
Build innovative state-of-the-art solutions with our customers
Work closely with our tech partners: Google Cloud, Tableau, Looker
Work in an agile and dynamic environment together with a small team with our data scientists, machine learning experts, data analysts and data engineers


Requirements

Strong programming and architectural experience, ideally in Python or Java, and SQL
3+ years of experience building (big) data solutions
Extremely passionate about data and analytics
Experience with ETL tools, Hadoop-based technologies (e.g. Spark) and/or data pipelines (e.g. Beam, Flink)
Experience building scalable and high-performant code
Experience in producing tested, resilient and well documented applications
The ability to take ownership, end-to-end and finding creative solutions
Experience in architecting, building, maintaining and troubleshooting cloud infrastructure
Excellent interpersonal skills, verbal and written communication skills; a team player and keen learner who loves building great things together
Working experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or Amazon Web Services (AWS)
BSc or MSc degree in Computer Science or a related technical field
Professional working proficiency in English
Bonus Points:

Love for the command line with optional affinity for Linux scripting
Experience building scalable REST APIs using Python or similar technologies
Experience with Agile methodologies such as Scrum
Basic knowledge of and ideally some experience with data science topics like machine learning, data mining, statistics, and visualisation
Contributions to open source projects


Benefits

The Basics: 25 days holiday in addition to bank holidays, pension scheme, team bonus payable annually, home equipment allowance

Health & Wellbeing: Private Healthcare Insurance, Employee Assistance Program, Working From Home Allowance, Discounted Gym Membership

Learning: Datatonic encourages continuous learning at all levels with a generous conference budget, freedom to explore the latest tools and technologies as well as regular knowledge-sharing activities. You will get access to Linux Academy, Coursera, and LinkedIn Learning and a €800 Conference Budget

Career Development: A personalised development plan to ensure you hit your professional goals with a clear roadmap for progression

Impact: The opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI and ML solutions spanning multiple industries and with market-leading organisations

Innovation: Access to Datatonic LABs, our Research & Development hub. Experiment and bring forward ideas, create impactful and meaningful work in a creative and collaborative environment - even just for fun!

Team Vibe & Social: A welcoming and friendly team plus regular monthly (some virtually) social events and seasonal events with expenses partially covered

WORKING FOR DATATONIC

We’re an eclectic team with lots of different interests and personalities. We have many different roles across data science, engineering, analytics, consulting, marketing, business development, and operations. We have offices in the UK, Stockholm, Geneva, Munich, and Barcelona, and we work with clients in many other European countries. We allow for flexible working hours and the possibility of remote work.

As a company, we have a strong emphasis on learning and professional development. Our core values are:

Cultivating Excellence

A hub for continuous learning, curiosity, developing ideas, testing things out - and then putting ‘excellence’ into practice.

Owning It

Working collaboratively in cross-functional teams to achieve customer delight. We love what we do and draw immense satisfaction from taking responsibility and seeing the results of our work.

Purposeful Impact

Creating positive change for our customers, using the most relevant machine learning and analytics approaches and the best technologies to meet real business needs.

Winning with Partners & Friends

Our business has been built on great partnerships and open-source collaboration. It’s one thing to be successful, but to do it in partnership with great people and other great companies is even better in our opinion.

Datatonic is committed to being an equal opportunities employer. Diversity, equity and inclusion are a key part of our values and central to our overall mission of recruiting, retaining and promoting a diverse mix of colleagues. We encourage applications from all backgrounds, abilities and communities. If you require any accommodations or adjustments to our interview process, please reach out to jobs@datatonic.com and we will do our best to assist you.

Title: Global IT Master Data (SAP MDG-F) Business Solution Analyst
Description:
The Position




The ASPIRE Roadmap (ASPIRE Program) is a multi-year program which aims at defining and developing the functional ERP roadmaps in order to simplify, standardize and automate business processes and systems leveraging SAP’s, industry and available Roche best practices.




As the ASPIRE Global IT Master Data Business Solution Analyst, you are responsible for driving alignment of the global Master Data template requirements for the program.




Your primary responsibilities include:




Delivering SAP MDG, covering full lifecycle of master data related to all relevant Roche S/4 Master Data objects
Ensuring that SAP MDG fulfills Roche business and compliance requirements
Design of SAP MDG for your area (Finance), including the necessary integration aspects with the existing Master Data Solutions at Roche
Collaborating with the relevant business and IT leads to ensure continuous alignment of master data solutions
Ensuring the smooth transition from and co-existence with legacy and non-ERP MDM systems
Understanding and adhering to Roche Master Data Management principles, policies and standards
Accountable for the specific MDG implementation project, managing Solution Delivery with AD/AM centers, current Roche Master Data team, System Integrators and internal Roche ERP teams




You bring the following qualifications:




5+ years of experience in managing/working with MDM systems in large global enterprises in the Pharma industry
Experience in implementing and working with SAP MDG-F and other MDG modules
Good knowledge of other SAP systems and Solution Manager (desirable)
Preferable experience in managing complex data migrations in validated environments
Thorough knowledge of one or more modules of SAP ERP, preferably FICO
Good knowledge of S/4 HANA and working experience in Quality/compliance Management and CSV
Thorough understanding of PMI, Agile, SAFe or other leading project management methodologies
C-level fluency in English. Any additional language is a plus




At Roche, we believe in diversity and inclusion as essential values for our success. We have special interest in integrating people with disabilities into our teams. If you have a disability, for us it is a plus, and we have special benefits for you: Go ahead and present your candidacy!




Who we are




At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.




Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: DIXCOVER_Programa de Prácticas en APPLIED INTELLIGENCE - Barcelona
Description:
DIXCOVER – Programa de Prácticas en Applied Intelligence

Bienvenido a DIXCOVER, el Programa de Prácticas de Accenture, dónde descubrirás el apasionante sector de la Innovación, la tecnología y la consultoría de la mano de Accenture, un líder mundial.

¿qué es APPLIED INTELLIGENCE y por qué unirme?

Haz realidad tu concepto de la IA con un punto de partida sólido y una idea clara. Una buena estrategia es fundamental para la transformación.

Applied Intelligence: es una combinación de IA con datos, analítica y automatización que, siguiendo una sólida visión estratégica, transformará el negocio, en todas las funciones y en todos los procesos, a escala.

Te incorporarás a Applied Intelligence como becario, lo que significa que serás uno más del equipo ayudando a los clientes a entender como la IA los lleva al éxito en diferentes campos:


Inteligencia Artificial: Amplía las capacidades humanas y mejora el rendimiento con estrategias y soluciones end to end en IA


Automatización inteligente; Elimina fricciones en el negocio y haz que los sistemas y procesos sean más productivos y se adapten al cambio.


Datos y analítica: elementos básicos en cualquier proyecto de IA.


IA y Analítica avanzada: genera valor a partir de datos sin estructura (texto, imágenes, voz) usando búsquedas, analítica, NPL y aprendizaje automático.


Gestión de datos de empresa: ayudamos a almacenar, mover, integrar y administrar datos para eliminar barreras y extender capacidades analíticas.


Requisitos


Estudiantes de 3º, 4º de Grado y/o Master en Ingeniería Informática, telecomunicaciones, matemáticas, física o grados especializados en Data y Analítica de Datos.


Ciclos Formativos de grado superior vinculados con Data y Analytics.


Disponibilidad para compaginar tus estudios y prácticas sin bajar el nivel en ninguno de los dos.


Alto nivel de inglés, al menos un C1.


¿Qué ofrecemos?


Prácticas formativas remuneradas


Horario flexible (mañana o tarde)


Tutelaje durante toda la duración de la beca


Prácticas de 3 a 6 meses, con posibilidades de ampliación


Si, al finalizar tu beca Dixcover, has tenido una buena evaluación por parte de tutor, has terminado tus estudios, y existen vacantes en Accenture podrás incorporarte sin pasar un nuevo proceso de selección con un contrato indefinido.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Descripción del Departamento

La misión del departamento es liderar la transformación Data-Driven de la compañía en Iberia, es decir influenciar en la toma de decisiones del negocio en base a datos. Para ello, creamos toda la arquitectura de datos, diseñamos y gestionamos toda la estrategia del Bussines Intelligence. Y por último llevamos a cabo los proyectos de analítica avanzada de la compañía, con el fin de tener herramientas analíticas que nos ayuden a tener mejor conocimiento del mercado y nuestros clientes, aumentar las ventas del negocio y generar más eficiencias.




Responsabilidades

· Trabajarás en la definición, desarrollo , implementación y seguimiento de proyectos de analítica avanzada (modelos para recomendaciones comerciales, segmentaciones, optimizaciones y pronósticos estadísticos) en marketing, ventas, fijación de precios y logística, y creación de algoritmos relevantes que pueden mejorar la forma en que opera el negocio. Empleando para ello diferentes metodologías de machine learning (supervisado y no supervisado) y diferentes algoritmos de extracción de la información en la web utilizando entornos de lenguajes de programación en python.

· Desarrollo y puesta en marcha de los diferentes servicios que se ofrecen en las plataformas de servicios de computación en la nube, (Azure, AWS) como el deployment de diferentes modelos de ML.

· Automatización del reporting, mediante la conexión del datalake (AWS) de la compañía a las herramientas de visualización de datos.

· Participar en el diseño y desarrollo de los procesos de obtención, preparación y limpieza de datos de los datasets, utilizando herramientas de ETL (Akteryx)

· Proponer ideas innovadoras para avanzar con nuestra arquitectura de datos y desarrollo de entornos que nos permitan trabajar en una analítica escalable.

· Estarás muy cerca del negocio para entender sus necesidades y así poder proponer mejoras en el área comercial y de marketing mediante el uso de herramientas de analítica avanzada.

· Aprender softwares de visualización de datos como Tableau, para la realización de los diferentes dashboards de las áreas de negocio.

· Trabajar con metodología agile y con un equipo multidisciplinar.




Requisitos:

Lenguajes de programación: Python, R
Conocimiento de bases de datos: SQL
Herramientas de ETL: como por ejemplo alteryx
Experiencia en desarrollo de modelos de machine learning
Herramienta de visualización de datos, preferentemente Tableau
Ingles avanzado

Show more Show less

La misión del departamento es liderar la transformación Data-Driven de la compañía en Iberia, es decir influenciar en la toma de decisiones del negocio en base a datos. Para ello, creamos toda la arquitectura de datos, diseñamos y gestionamos toda la estrategia del Bussines Intelligence. Y por último llevamos a cabo los proyectos de analítica avanzada de la compañía, con el fin de tener herramientas analíticas que nos ayuden a tener mejor conocimiento del mercado y nuestros clientes, aumentar las ventas del negocio y generar más eficiencias.


Responsabilidades

· Trabajarás en la definición, desarrollo , implementación y seguimiento de proyectos de analítica avanzada (modelos para recomendaciones comerciales, segmentaciones, optimizaciones y pronósticos estadísticos) en marketing, ventas, fijación de precios y logística, y creación de algoritmos relevantes que pueden mejorar la forma en que opera el negocio. Empleando para ello diferentes metodologías de machine learning (supervisado y no supervisado) y diferentes algoritmos de extracción de la información en la web utilizando entornos de lenguajes de programación en python.

· Desarrollo y puesta en marcha de los diferentes servicios que se ofrecen en las plataformas de servicios de computación en la nube, (Azure, AWS) como el deployment de diferentes modelos de ML.

· Automatización del reporting, mediante la conexión del datalake (AWS) de la compañía a las herramientas de visualización de datos.

· Participar en el diseño y desarrollo de los procesos de obtención, preparación y limpieza de datos de los datasets, utilizando herramientas de ETL (Akteryx)

· Proponer ideas innovadoras para avanzar con nuestra arquitectura de datos y desarrollo de entornos que nos permitan trabajar en una analítica escalable.

· Estarás muy cerca del negocio para entender sus necesidades y así poder proponer mejoras en el área comercial y de marketing mediante el uso de herramientas de analítica avanzada.

· Aprender softwares de visualización de datos como Tableau, para la realización de los diferentes dashboards de las áreas de negocio.

· Trabajar con metodología agile y con un equipo multidisciplinar.


Requisitos:

  • Lenguajes de programación: Python, R
  • Conocimiento de bases de datos: SQL
  • Herramientas de ETL: como por ejemplo alteryx
  • Experiencia en desarrollo de modelos de machine learning
  • Herramienta de visualización de datos, preferentemente Tableau
  • Ingles avanzado

Title: Data Engineer (Enterprise Architecture & Data Analytics Team)
Description:
Hi there!

We are Semrush, a global IT company developing our own product – a platform for digital marketers. New stars are born here, so don’t miss your chance.

And this is our Data Engineer role for those who want to turn ideas into reality using code, algorithms, and maybe a bit of magic.

Tasks in the role

Develop and maintain data pipelines that feed our data warehouse.
Maintain documentation about data pipelines, processes, and schemas.
Oversee data pipeline execution and be the first point of contact for incidents regarding our data warehouse.
Collaborate with EADA Design practice and business stakeholders on definitions and models of data (entities, attributes, etc.) and linking these to metrics (standard and KPI).
Advocate for data literacy and democratization of analytics to create a data-driven culture.
Scout continuous improvements via new technology and methodology enablers—particularly those which allow business users access to more advanced analytics (e.g., data science, in-database analytics, code generation).


Who we are looking for

Proven track record in Data engineering or Data warehouse.
One or more years of experience working in cloud environments. Google Cloud experience is preferred over other clouds but not indispensable.
Knowledge of ETL tools and data profiling tools.
Good knowledge of Python, SQL (Postgres and Big Query).
Our data stack is based on Airflow, Apache Beam (cloud dataflow), SQL (Postgres, Bigquery, and Oracle), DBT, and Python. We would like to hire someone with experience in those technologies. Currently, we don’t use or plan to use Spark or Scala; but knowledge and experience are easily transferable.
Exposure to Data Governance and Data Quality initiatives or processes.
Creative mind and ability to think outside the box both conceptually and pragmatically.
Skilled communicator with ability to explain complex topics in simple terms both verbally and in written form.


They say there are no perfect candidates, but that might well be you, if

You have data and consulting experience.
Related academic research background.
Enjoys working, communicating (in English), and influencing multicultural distributed teams with a solutions-oriented "can-do" attitude, "self-starter" approach, and a good sense of humor to navigate, at times, ambiguous settings.
You share our common values: Trust, as we prefer to speak up and be our true selves; Sense of Ownership, as it’s not worth wasting time on something you don’t believe in; and enthusiasm for Constant Change, as we are always looking to make things better.


A Bit About The Team

You can get to know the team better at one of the interviews, but some brief information about future colleagues will be useful now.

Enterprise Architecture and Data Analytics (EADA) is a department reporting directly to the CIO. We provide guidance regarding the interdependencies of business, applications, data, and infrastructure planes during transformations and incremental changes, and we bring an end-to-end perspective to the table. We also manage internal Data Warehouses and BI, including the governance, quality, ingestion, and integration of Data. We are organized in three practices: Design, Data Delivery & Warehouse, and Analytics, and as a team distributed across various countries, mostly in Europe.

We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably

It’s up to you to decide what work format works best for you. You can #wfo, #wfh, or mix both.
Flexible working day start.
Health insurance coverage.
Working from a modern coworking space (or working from home).
Internet coverage (up to 30 eur/month).
Corporate events.
Unlimited PTO.
Hobby benefit.
Training, courses, conferences.
English and Spanish courses.
Gifts for employees.


Finally, a Little More About Our Company

Semrush is a leading online visibility management SaaS platform that enables businesses globally to run search engine optimization, pay-per-click, content, social media, and competitive research campaigns and get measurable results from online marketing.

We've been developing our product for 14 years and have been awarded G2's Top 100 Software Products, Global and US Search Awards 2021, Great Place to Work Certification, Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and many more. In March 2021 Semrush went public and started trading on the NYSE with the SEMR ticker.

10,000,000+ users in America, Europe, Asia, and Australia have already tried Semrush, and over 1,000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.

Our new colleague, we are waiting for you!

Semrush is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or medical condition including medical characteristics, genetic identity, marital status, military service, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state or federal laws. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.

Title: BI Senior Consultant
Description:
🏢 ¿Buscas un nuevo reto con mejor salario y condiciones?



Si eres una persona con experiencia en BI con habilidades en liderazgo, análisis y planificación estatégica para diseñar y desarrollar soluciones, capaz de liderar proyectos y gestionar equipos en un entorno internacional,



Entonces...



💼 Esta oferta es para ti si...



Eres una persona con experiencia en BI, capaz de liderar proyectos y gestionar equipos.
Tienes habilidades analíticas y de planificación estratégica.
Tienes experiencia en el diseño y desarrollo de soluciones de BI.
Eres capaz de colaborar con otros departamentos con orientación a cliente.


🚫 Esta oferta no es para ti si...



No tienes experiencia en consultoría de BI o liderazgo de proyectos.
No tienes habilidades sólidas de comunicación y presentación.
No tienes capacidad para influir y construir relaciones con personas internas y externas.
No tienes experiencia en el diseño y desarrollo de soluciones de BI.

📈 Principales responsabilidades:



Diseñar, desarrollar y desplegar soluciones de BI con orientación a cliente.
Planificación de recursos y gestión de presupuestos.
Identificar oportunidades de mejora en los procesos existentes de BI y proporcionar recomendaciones para su optimización.
Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con otros departamentos para garantizar la satisfacción del cliente y la retención.
Identificar y proporcionar soluciones de análisis de datos para clientes, utilizando herramientas de automatización ETL de vanguardia.
Proporcionar informes regulares sobre el desempeño y la evolución del proyecto.





¿Nos conocemos y me explicas tu principal motivación al cambio?

Title: Threat Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About Accenture Cyber Threat Intelligence (ACTI)

ACTI is a global team that spans 13 countries and 4 continents and speaks more than 30 languages. We are passionate about delivering intelligence analysis, and providing industry-leading analytic insights, cyber context, and critical services our clients need to achieve their business-line and strategic-growth initiatives. We know success is only possible by developing and supporting our most-critical resources: our talented analysts, developers, and supporting team members. We value creativity and entrepreneurship in our team; where possible, we back staff initiatives with opportunities and investments. We strive to automate and innovate while working with powerful resources and vast data. Above all else, we value an egoless approach to guiding our clients as they navigate their businesses through all aspects of the cyber domain.

Who You Are

You are passionate about cybersecurity and intelligence analysis. You stay abreast of the latest threats, recognize the value of intelligence, and believe it should drive operations. You are a devoted team member who is always willing to lend a hand, mentor a colleague, or increase our global team’s awareness by sharing your knowledge and approaches with others. You are productive, easy to work with, and understand that adherence to a good process is key to excellence.

Role Description

As a Threat Intelligence Analyst, you will report to Europe’s Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) Consulting Leads. You will be responsible for the end-to-end delivery of the existing and prospective CTI consulting portfolio, such as threat assessments, attack surface assessments, industry threat landscape reports, and social media brand monitoring.

The role requires prior basic knowledge of open-source intelligence collection, and processing and analysis of multiple data sources, most of which are open source.

Key Responsibilities


Timely delivery of the CTI consulting portfolio adhering to the highest standard of quality


Collaborative production of threat assessment reports that highlight a company’s risk score based on an assessment of that company’s industry-based threat landscape and company-specific digital footprint


Production of ad-hoc cyber threat intelligence alerts and reports aimed at meeting client requirements


Deep dive analysis of threats faced by specific industry verticals in which Accenture operates


Contribution to the team’s overall delivery effectiveness and efficiency, such as by contributing to analyst workflow automation, trialing new tools, and improving existing delivery methodologies


Basic Qualifications


Degree or equivalent qualifications, preferably relating to politics, intelligence, or information security


Minimum 1 year of work experience involving analysis of information from disparate sources and synthesizing it into concise and actionable reports for a varied audience


Required Skills


Ability to work with geographically dispersed teams


Research skills


English language proficiency (both written and oral)


Strong writing skills


Strong analytical skills


Ability to learn quickly


Basic knowledge of threat intelligence and cyber defense concepts


Ability to work as part of a team and independently with minimal supervision


Experience in a similar role


Desired Skills


Knowledge of how to work on regulatory-driven engagements, such as CBEST and TIBER (Threat Intelligence-Based Ethical Red-teaming) engagements


Ability to conduct open-source intelligence collection and analysis


Ability to produce intelligence products for varied consumption levels (e.g., tactical, operational, strategic)


Basic knowledge of open-source tools, such as Shodan, Maltego, PassiveTotal


Working knowledge of frameworks and methodologies to quantify cyber risk (e.g., FAIR)


Non-English language skills (additional linguistic capabilities are a plus)


Working knowledge of common threat intelligence frameworks and methodologies to quantify cyber risk (e.g., MITRE ATT&CK, Cyber Killchain, FAIR)


Keen interest in cyber security as demonstrated by experience/training/education or extra-curricular pursuits


Understanding of geopolitical landscape and how real-world events and geopolitics influence cyber activity.


Basic technical skills, such as understanding of infrastructure enumeration


If you have any experience of or exposure to any of the following disciplines, please highlight them in your application and explain how these could be applied to the role.


International Relations, Politics, Criminology, English, Sociology


Research, journalism


Cyber security, Incident Response, Threat Intelligence, Penetration testing, Information security


Military intelligence

Title: Big Data Engineer
Description:
Job Description

Job Description

As a Data Engineering Senior Analyst at Avanade, you will use comprehensive modern data engineer techniques and methods with Advanced Analytics to support business decisions for Avanade clients. You can collect, aggregate, and analyze structured/unstructured data from multiple internal and external sources and patterns, insights, and trends to decision-makers. Your goal is to support the use of data-driven insights to help our clients achieve business outcomes and objectives. In this role, you will collect, aggregate, store, and reconcile data in support of Client business decisions. You will help design and build data pipelines, data streams, reporting tools, information dashboards, data service APIs, data generators and other end-user information portals and insight tools. You will be a critical part of the data supply chain, ensuring that stakeholders can access and manipulate data for routine and ad hoc analysis to drive business outcomes using Advanced Analytics.

Day-to-day


Translate business requirements to technical solutions leveraging strong business acumen.
Analyze current business practices, processes and procedures as well as identifying future business opportunities for leveraging Microsoft Azure Data & Analytics PaaS Services.
Support the planning and implementation of data design services, providing sizing and configuration assistance and performing needs assessments.
Delivery of architectures for transformations and modernizations of enterprise data solutions using Azure cloud data technologies
Design and Build Modern Data Pipelines and Data Streams.
Design and Build Data Service APIs.
Develop and maintain data warehouse schematics, layouts, architectures and relational/non-relational databases for data access and Advanced Analytics.
Expose data to end users using Python, Spark, Scala or any other modern visualization platform or experience.
Implement effective metrics and monitoring processes.


Your technical and non-technical skills include :


Demonstrated experience of turning business use cases and requirements to technical solutions.
Experience in business processing mapping of data and analytics solutions.
Ability to conduct data profiling, cataloging, and mapping for technical design and construction of technical data flows.
The ability to apply such methods to solve business problems using one or more Azure Data and Analytics services in combination with building data pipelines, data streams, and system integration.
Experience preparing data for Data Science and Machine Learning.
Knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) and Data Quality tools and processes
Strong team collaboration and experience working with remote teams.


About Avanade

Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.

We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.

We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping young people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.

Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

Title: IT Innovation Engineer
Description:
Do you like to work in a fast and innovative environment?




Are you used to work in the design and development of fast prototypes for new digital products?

If you are creative and enthusiastic of new technologies as IoT, AI or machine learning, don't miss this opportunity!




We are seeking an IT Innovation Engineer who will be assisting the processes for building and delivering prototypes and products, and for implementing new features in the existing innovative Proof of Concepts. The engineer will work closely with open innovation partners' and the company's cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality, innovative solutions that meet needs of business pain points.




Our client is a well known multinational food company based in Barcelona.




Your responsibilities:

Build and deliver prototypes for new IT products and features with the help of open innovation communities, i.e.
Implement new features in existing products
Work with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality, innovative solutions
Utilize technical skills to develop and deliver high-quality solutions,
Collaborate with external partners, such as startups, academics, and SMEs, to achieve project goals
Stay up to date with emerging technologies and identify opportunities to improve products and processes




The requirements:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering or a related field,
Understating of basic coding of programming languages such as Python, HTML5, SQL,
having a notion of RDBMS and No-SQL solutions and cloud technologies,
curiosity for emerging tech trends such as IoT, AI, VR, AR, and Blockchain, Open AI Services,
capable for prototype development lifecycle
Experience in delivering high-quality prototypes and implementing new features in products
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work with cross-functional teams including external partners, startups, academics, SMEs
Self-motivated, with a passion for innovation and emerging technologies




Your benefits:

Permanent contract
Flexible hybrid work model
Career development
Bonus according to performance
Bonus according to the company results
Social benefits (health insurance, Gympass, pension plan, etc.)
Remote working 2 days a week

Show more Show less
HTML:
Do you like to work in a fast and innovative environment?


Are you used to work in the design and development of fast prototypes for new digital products?

If you are creative and enthusiastic of new technologies as IoT, AI or machine learning, don't miss this opportunity!


We are seeking an IT Innovation Engineer who will be assisting the processes for building and delivering prototypes and products, and for implementing new features in the existing innovative Proof of Concepts. The engineer will work closely with open innovation partners' and the company's cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality, innovative solutions that meet needs of business pain points.


Our client is a well known multinational food company based in Barcelona.


Your responsibilities:

  • Build and deliver prototypes for new IT products and features with the help of open innovation communities, i.e.
  • Implement new features in existing products
  • Work with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality, innovative solutions
  • Utilize technical skills to develop and deliver high-quality solutions,
  • Collaborate with external partners, such as startups, academics, and SMEs, to achieve project goals
  • Stay up to date with emerging technologies and identify opportunities to improve products and processes


The requirements:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering or a related field,
  • Understating of basic coding of programming languages such as Python, HTML5, SQL,
  • having a notion of RDBMS and No-SQL solutions and cloud technologies,
  • curiosity for emerging tech trends such as IoT, AI, VR, AR, and Blockchain, Open AI Services,
  • capable for prototype development lifecycle
  • Experience in delivering high-quality prototypes and implementing new features in products
  • Strong collaboration skills and ability to work with cross-functional teams including external partners, startups, academics, SMEs
  • Self-motivated, with a passion for innovation and emerging technologies


Your benefits:

  • Permanent contract
  • Flexible hybrid work model
  • Career development
  • Bonus according to performance
  • Bonus according to the company results
  • Social benefits (health insurance, Gympass, pension plan, etc.)
  • Remote working 2 days a week

Title: Forward-deployed Data Engineer
Description:
Who We Are




Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we work closely with clients to embrace a transformational approach aimed at benefiting all stakeholders—empowering organizations to grow, build sustainable competitive advantage, and drive positive societal impact.




Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives that question the status quo and spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting, technology and design, and corporate and digital ventures. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, fueled by the goal of helping our clients thrive and enabling them to make the world a better place.




Practice Area Profile




BCG GAMMA combines innovative skills in computer science, artificial intelligence (AI), statistics, and machine learning with deep industry and functional expertise. The BCG GAMMA team is comprised of world-class data scientists, software and data engineers, as well as product experts with a consulting mindset.




We specialize in creating competitive advantage for our clients through AI driven transformations. Our teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-build to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.




What You'll Do




As a forward-deployed Data Engineer, you’ll be part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG GAMMA.




Who You Are




We are looking for talented individuals with a passion for data engineering, software development and transforming organizations into AI led innovative companies




Apply data engineering practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable solutions
Actively involved in every part of the software development life cycle
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in best practices for large-scale data engineering
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics




What You'll Bring (Experience & Qualifications)




Master’s Degree in Computer Science or relevant field
Experience in data engineering and working with global and remote agile squads
Proficiency with analytic software programming ideally in python, C++, or SCALA
Fluency with the storage, manipulation, and management of relational, non-relational and streaming data structures, specifically SQL, Spark, and Hadoop
Proficiency with infrastructure as code principles
Experience working on AWS, Azure, or Google cloud infrastructure




NICE TO HAVE




DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, Terraform
Understanding of parallel computing
Full stack development: GraphQL, React, JavaScript, TypeScript
Data Science and machine learning (Pandas, Scikit learn)




WORK ENVIRONMENT




Fluency in English is required as well as fluency in the local language for most locations
Ability to travel based on client and business needs. Expect 30-50%
Show more Show less

Title: Modeller Data Scientist
Description:
kjgkjg

About ASL In Nestlé

We are a diverse, international team of Analytical professionals applying advanced analytics solutions in the world’s biggest health, nutrition and wellness company.

As an internal consultancy, we collaborate with our colleagues in sales & marketing around the world to deliver value in the areas of marketing effectiveness, and price & promo effectiveness.

In order to complete our Analytics Service Line department, we are currently looking for a Data Scientist / Modeller with FMCG experience in Marketing Mix Modelling and Price & Promo Analytics.

Position Snapshot

Location: Nestlé Global Hub in Barcelona, Spain

Permanent Contract

Bachelor’s degree

Fluent English

About You

You are an expert in applying advanced analytics to solve marketing and sales business problems. You are equally comfortable applying your knowledge to optimize marketing spend or working with sales to optimize trade spend.

You are hands on in your ability to build models, but you are also comfortable coaching less experienced team members in how to solve problems, or managing agencies to deliver where needed.

You know that having a great model isn’t enough, you love to derive the “so what” from you models and tell compelling stories which inspire action and drive growth.

A day in the life of...

You’ll be responsible for using advanced analytics to provide robust measurements of marketing & trade investment across different business models, product categories and varied geographies.

You will work closely with your stakeholders to provide guidance on how best to optimize and allocate marketing & trade investments in order to support the delivery of our commercial strategy.

As part of this role you will need to:

Share your experience & knowledge and build Nestlé’s internal modelling capability
Partner with stakeholders to build and deliver a portfolio of advanced analytics initiatives
Work closely with to identify and answer business problems/questions using appropriate modeling techniques on available data
Evangelize and provide advisory services around data science capabilities and knowledge within Nestlé
Work with large, complex data sets and solve non-standard problems


What Will Make You Successful

Be educated to MSc level (or equivalent) in Math, Statistics, Physics, Operations Research, Econometrics or Data Science.
Have proven experience of handling large datasets and reporting automation.
Be able to demonstrate an excellent understanding of marketing mix modelling and price & promotion analytics.
Experience with dynamic linear models/state space models is of particular interest.
Have the ability to network and influence at senior levels both internally and externally.
Be able to interpret data and explain business performance in an easy to understand way that tells a story to key stakeholders.
Have proven experience of working in a matrix environment; achieving results through effective influencing and collaboration.
Have advanced MS Excel, SQL, R, Python (or similar) experience.

kjhgkjjg

Title: BI Engineer - Developer
Description:
The BI Engineer / developer would be entitled to address reporting needs from business stakeholders from finance, logistics, sales, etc.



Getting data from a MS SQL Server Database, the professional should count with experience enough to extract relevant data and prepare it to, with stored procedures an small developments, provide the business with basic report which the stakeholder could manipulate and use at their own.



The ideal professional should count with experience in manipulating data from MS SQL Server Data Bases and also, experience to automate data reports for business usage.



With ideally IT/Engineer Higher education, the perfect professional should be comfortable and experience working with:



Configuring and developing BI, reporting and ETL
Knowledge and Experience with MS SQL Server & MS SQL Stored Procedures; SSIS & SSRS;
Java and/or .NET programming will be appreciated

It will also be appreciated counting with other Data Bases like MySQL, Oracle or DB2, and also with programming with Typescript. Additionally, those professionals with experience in Infor BI - dEPM, or even, at least, experience with Infor M3 ERP will be very much appreciated.



For the case you feel you fit for such challenge, please do not hesitate to apply and let us know about you! We'll contact you soon in order to address further in depth details.




Desired Skills and Experience

MS SQL Server; T-SQL; SSRS; SSIS; Power BI; Data Manipulation; .NET; Java; Stored Procedures;etc

Title: Senior HR Data Analyst - Talent Acquisition & Talent Management
Description:
At UL, we know why we come to work.

Thousands of us around the world wake up every day with a common purpose: to make the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place. Science is in our DNA; we are endlessly curious and passionate about seeking and speaking the truth. We take delight in knowing that our work makes a meaningful contribution to society, and we are proud that our culture is centred on integrity, collaboration, inclusion and excellence. UL stands at the forefront of technological advancement, and we are continually challenged to find new ways to foster innovation and positive change. Satisfying? Yes. Exciting? Absolutely!

As our global footprint and customer base continue to grow, we are looking to hire a Senior HR Data Analyst with a background in Talent Acquisition & Talent Management systems to join our global People Experience and Inclusion team.

Reporting to the Senior Manager of HRIS & Analytics, you will be responsible for managing, maintaining, and updating UL's HRIS System and supporting the migration to Oracle Cloud.

In this position, you will be a key member of the HRIS & Analytics team and will work closely with all members of the People Experience and Inclusion division and have the ability to positively influence decision-making at all levels of the organisation by providing proactive, intuitive, sophisticated analytics and reporting.

What you’ll learn & achieve:

Acting as a functional expert, this role will also support day-to-day system configuration needs, engage external vendors to optimize recruitment processes enabled by technology and ensure key recruitment tools support core processes with the Talent Acquisition function.
Develops strong working relationships with end users to identify, troubleshoot, and resolve problems as well as use seasoned judgment to creatively improve and automate current processes.
Primary point of contact for ticket/issue resolution and liaise with IT on issues that require IT intervention.
Creates training documentation and leads regular training sessions to end users on how to utilize Oracle Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS)
Serves as the technical point of contact for data integrity and analysing data trends.
Designs and develops reports for management, business units, and HR to assess business and organizational priorities.
Along with the HR Manager, Acts as a liaison with IT to continue to build on technological advances associated with HRIS.
Responsible for data entry and updating and maintaining HR set-ups that are used by the end users for data entry
Ability to manage and process data for any data uploads, data trends etc
Support audits (internal and external) as required
Drive consistent process improvements/automation using systems where required
Technically able to understand the system and able to translate business user stakeholders and IT as needed
Ability to produce data dashboards as required to support senior leadership


What makes you a great fit:

University Degree (Equivalent to Bachelor’s degree) in Human Resources, Information Technology, Business, or a related disciplines plus direct working experience
Experience with Oracle is highly preferred. Expertise required in MS Office with advanced knowledge of Excel/v-look-up and pivot tables.
Experience working with HR compliance and regulatory issues.
Strong quantitative knowledge and experience; comfortable with assuming technical ownership of data and applying qualitative assessments of the information.
Strong records maintenance and organizational skills required
Knowledge of recruitment process and major HRIS Cloud systems (Oracle, Workday etc.)
Good data management skills


What you’ll experience working at UL:

A stable employment in an experienced, highly motivated international team with friendly work atmosphere.
Remuneration package including: annual bonus, private medical insurance, life insurance, lunch card and vacation allowance “Wakacje pod gruszą”.
Office location close to a train station WKD Raków with private and secured parking for employees.
Training and Development programs for all employees provided by UL University.
Opportunity to engage in various and global initiatives and taking on new challenges within UL Solutions.


Learn More:

Working at UL is an exciting journey that twists and turns daily. We thrive in the twists and revel in the turns. This is our every day. This is our normal. Curious? To learn more about us and the work we do, visit UL.com


Show more Show less

Title: Register your interest for a Statistician role
Description:
Location: Macclesfield (UK), Gaithersburg (US), Gothenburg (Sweden) Barcelona (Spain) or Warsaw (Poland)

Competitive salary and benefits

Are you a Statistician – experienced or in the beginning of your career? Do you have an appetite to use statistical methods to develop life-changing medicines? If you would like to apply your expertise in a global company pushing the boundaries of science – join us!

AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious disease. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies.

We work on some of the most complex and interesting challenges. A fast-paced and agile team, we are empowered and trusted to innovate and experiment. With access to our extensive capabilities and comprehensive pipeline, you’ll be involved in countless submissions and a wide range of engaging projects along the complete drug development process.

We are offering opportunities for Statisticians and Statistical Leaders at several different career levels, depending on your previous experience. You will join a global, diverse and cross-functional environment where you will get personal and professional development.

In this role, we will give you the chance to utilise your statistical expertise in the design, analysis, and interpretation of clinical trial programs; submission and defence of regulatory filings; and the generation of evidence to support product commercialisation and reimbursement.

Main Duties And Responsibilities

You will use your statistical know-how to contribute to the design and progress of clinical trial programs. You may already be equipped to lead statistical employees, either by technical leadership or line management. We offer a role suited perfectly for your competence.

Your responsibilities will include:


Contribute to or lead the statistical thinking, analysis and reporting to relevant groups in product and study teams
Develop design options and provide high-quality information for the business through partnership with internal and external experts
Representing AstraZeneca to Health Authorities and Reimbursement & Payer Organisations for specific projects
Apply expert skills to investigate and use standard, as well as novel, statistical approaches for relevant statistical issues


Essential Requirements

We are looking for an individual who can focus on solving challenging problems through teamwork and partnerships. You are a specialist, or seek to be a specialist in your field, and you know that the best results are achieved by utilising the strengths of every individual.


You have a Master’s or Doctorate degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, Mathematics or similar area
You possess excellent interpersonal skills, especially when communicating statistical concepts to non-statisticians


Why AstraZeneca?

At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare.

So, what’s next?


Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you.
Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available and we hope it’s yours.


Where can I find out more?


Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/
Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/
Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en
Please visit our dedicated Biometrics webpage https://careers.astrazeneca.com/biometrics
