Estará ubicado/a en el centro de I+D de Vilafranca del Penedés.


¿Qué esperamos de esta posición? Funciones a desarrollar:

  • Preparación de la documentación técnica:
  • Trabajo con el equipo de R&D para recopilar los datos e informaciones.
  • Organización de los datos.
  • Creación y edición de los elementos de la documentación (gráficas, tablas, dibujos, ilustraciones).
  • Maquetación de los documentos.
  • Registro y tratamiento de la documentación creada.


Competencias y actitudes

  • Pensamiento Crítico y flexible.
  • Capacidad trabajo en equipo.


Valorable

  • Experiencia sector climatización.
  • Experiencia en fabricante.


Condiciones

  • Incorporación empresa líder sector climatización.
  • Estabilidad laboral y posibilidades de crecimiento profesional.
  • Posibilidades reales de desarrollar un Plan de Carrera en un entorno internacional, en un Grupo líder en la investigación y el desarrollo de las últimas tecnologías en climatización.



Si eres una persona con capacidad de trabajo tanto individual como en equipo, con ganas de aprender y progresar participando en nuevos proyectos, ¡no lo dudes e inscríbete!


¡Te daremos más información a lo largo del proceso de selección!

Title: Customer Service Knowledge Analyst
Description:
Our client – a luxury automotive brand – is creating their Customer Interaction Center from scratch and they are looking for a Knowledge Analyst to revolutionize their customer service quality. For this, we are looking for someone with previous experience in knowledge/data analytics in the (luxury) customer service industry. By actively joining the organization, you will be a true brand ambassador. Interested to learn more?

Tasks

Your responsibilities and impact as a Customer Service Knowledge Analyst for a Luxury Automotive Brand will be:

Managing the overall information in the interaction center and maintaining an overview of the content available
Ensuring knowledge accuracy and quality of the latest information by stakeholders in the customer interaction center
Independently creating content based on input from multiple stakeholders
Review of created content to ensure fit for customer service representatives and subject experts
Securing integration of new knowledge into operational systems, programs, and training
Preparing and communicating new knowledge to relevant knowledge recipients based on relevance evaluation
Develop and update training content
Creating content, coordinating review/approval process with stakeholders and if necessary, coordinating translations


Requirements

Skills, qualifications and interests you need to succeed in this role:

Senior-level specialist with several years of experience in knowledge management
Experience in a customer service position
Having excellent verbal and written communication skills
Full professional proficiency in English
Technological affinity to handle technical content
Willingness to understand complex automotive products/services
Motivated and empathetic personality, with a self-dependent and accurate working style.


Benefits

What´s in it for you?

Competitive salary
Working in a non-hierarchical, fast-paced and highly changeable environment
Being part of the creation of the Customer Interaction Center of one of the world´s leading luxury automotive brands
Working in an inclusive, diverse, and international team
Possibility to partially work from home after the initial training months


Your future company:

An innovative luxury automotive brand that is currently creating an in-house Customer Interaction Center. They have offices worldwide to cater to the needs of their international clientele. The Customer Service department in Barcelona will focus on the markets of various European countries.

Title: StackIT Cloud Database Engineer
Description:
At the Schwarz Global Services - Barcelona we offer high value IT services for the entire Schwarz Group, which includes Lidl, Kaufland, Schwarz Produktion, PreZero, STACKIT and XMCyber. We are in the worldwide top 5 of Retail companies with 13.000 stores spread in 33 countries, more than 6 billion of costumers, and over 500.000 employees. We strive to develop and implement smart and efficient IT solutions to deliver the best experience to whole users, customers and colleagues. We are looking for open-minded colleagues with passion for technology, who are willing to find diverse and exciting career opportunities in a dynamic work environment that stands for development and progress.




Take advantage of the opportunities to progress your career at the Barcelona location.




StackIT Cloud Database Engineer




Key Responsibilities




You develop new database platform environments in our own cloud platform (STACKIT) together with your colleagues in the team
You operate and develop this environment and add new components to enhance the user experience
You support the development of further database services on our cloud platform (STACKIT)
You support and operate various technical systems for the provision of the cloud environment as well as for the operation of the cloud
You are responsible for the surrounding system landscape (e.g. management systems, monitoring and logging)




Your profile




You are passionate and enthusiastic about new technologies and topics related to Linux and Kubernetes
You already have experience with the database product MSSQL
AlwaysOn is not just a switch for you
Ideally, you have T-SQL knowledge for automation topics in MSSQL Server
Ideally, you have basic knowledge of Python, GoLang and other cloud topics
The willingness to get involved with new cloud technologies (e.g. Kubernetes) and approaches is a prerequisite
English language – advanced level




What We Offer




You will be part of an international team composed by people from different countries and backgrounds, where you’ll be able to share your experience and knowledge to carry-out team work and meet the objectives.




On top of this, you’ll have a personal follow-up with your management team to help you understanding all business-related questions and guide you in your professional career.




We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package: lunch vouchers, health and dental insurance, transport, wellbeing, etc.




Interested?




We look forward to receiving your application.




Schwarz Global Services Barcelona




Sophie Barbara Noelle Nuffer




Reference no. 39262




C/Bergara 13, floor 5, 08002 Barcelona




es.it.schwarz

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Description:
Responsibilities




PepsiCo is using the power of data to transform the way our world famous portfolio of brands are sold every day. Our Data Science & Analytics group influences every aspect of how we sell and move our products. In just a short period of time, they’ve built new capabilities that have defined the data science roadmap across all of our brands. Members of our team solve complex problems facing our rapidly changing business and get to see their work come to life in the real world.




Join PepsiCo’s Enterprise Data Operations team which develops quality data collection processes, maintains the integrity of our data foundations and enables business leaders and data scientists across the company to have rapid access to the data they need for decision-making and innovation.




Role Summary




As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be the key technical expert overseeing PepsiCo's data product build & operations and drive a strong vision for how data engineering can proactively create a positive impact on the business. You'll be empowered to create & lead a strong team of data engineers who build data pipelines into various source systems, rest data on the PepsiCo Data Lake, and enable exploration and access for analytics, visualization, machine learning, and product development efforts across the company.




What will you be doing more specifically:




Active contributor to code development in projects and services.
Manage and scale data pipelines from internal and external data sources to support new product launches and drive data quality across data products.
Build and own the automation and monitoring frameworks that captures metrics and operational KPIs for data pipeline quality and performance.
Responsible for implementing best practices around systems integration, security, performance and data management.
Empower the business by creating value through the increased adoption of data, data science and business intelligence landscape.
Collaborate with internal clients (data science and product teams) to drive solutioning and POC discussions.
Evolve the architectural capabilities and maturity of the data platform by engaging with enterprise architects and strategic internal and external partners.
Develop and optimize procedures to “productionalize” data science models.
Define and manage SLA’s for data products and processes running in production.
Prototype new approaches and build solutions at scale.
Create and audit reusable packages or libraries.




Qualifications




Minimum Qualifications:




4+ years of experience with software development, data engineering, or systems architecture:
4+ years of experience with Data Lake Infrastructure, Data Warehousing, and ETL/ELT pipelines.
4+ years of experience in SQL optimization and performance tuning, and development experience in programming languages like Python, PySpark, Scala etc.).
2+ years in cloud data engineering experience in at least one cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP).
Experience in the following areas:
Data profiling and data quality using tools like Apache Griffin, Deequ, Informatica and Great Expectations.
Extensive experience with object-oriented design and coding and testing patterns, including experience with engineering Azure Data platforms and data infrastructures
Production projects experience in Data Analytics, Data Visualization, Data Security, Data Modelling
Experience in building complex data sets from multiple data sources, both internally and externally
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, along with the strong ability to influence senior level management and stakeholders.
Strong change manager: comfortable with change, especially that which arises through company growth.
Ability to understand and translate business requirements into data and technical requirements.
High degree of organization and ability to manage multiple, competing projects and priorities simultaneously.




What makes us different?




Hybrid work model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Entrepreneurial environment in leading international company
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
Diverse team from over 25 countries
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Free Friday afternoon & during the month of August
Relocation package & sponsorship to work in Spain if applicable




About PepsiCo




We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo D+A. We operate with start-up mindset – agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.




PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization – a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people.




So, if you’re ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we’d love to chat.




We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability




PepsiCo Data & Analytics Overview:




With data deeply embedded in our DNA, PepsiCo Data & Analytics transforms data into consumer delight. We build and organize business-ready data that allows PepsiCo’s leaders to solve their problems with the highest degree of confidence. Our platform of data products and services ensures data is activated at scale. This enables new revenue streams, deeper partner relationships, new consumer experiences, and innovation across the enterprise.




Show more Show less

Title: Associate IT Engineer
Description:
Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As a Public Benefit Corporation , you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.




The Role




We are currently seeking an Associate IT Engineer based in Barcelona capable of spearheading IT technical solutions and providing a variety of IT support for Spanish and EU employees. To succeed in the role, you are resourceful, technological, calm under stress, and love to work in a fast-paced, multinational environment with a sense of autonomy and job ownership.




We are looking for someone with a high level of service focus and a customer-first mentality who wants to grow their career alongside the rest of the business in the region.




What You'll Do




Interact with internal clients to help to resolve all levels of IT-related issues and provide answers promptly
Evaluate and test new technologies (hardware/software)
Build and maintain vendor relationships, manage the purchase of hardware and software products and ensure that company assets are maintained responsibly
Manage and deploy corporate PCs/Macs
New hardware configuration
Machine image maintenance
Diagnosis and repair
Coordinate warranty repairs
Manage VOIP phone system and distribution of equipment
Maintain inventory and IT asset data (serial numbers, software keys, locations, etc.)
Shipping, recycling, and disposal of computers, peripherals
Assist in the management of hosted IT applications (Okta, Google G Suite, Egnyte, Zoom, MS O365, etc.)
IT account management for on-/off-boarding of employees
Diagnosing and repairing end-user IT devices
IT ticket management
Resolve escalated technical IT matters




Requirements




1+ years of professional experience in desktop support, IT infrastructure engineering, or similar IT roles
Based in Spain already, and eligible for employment there
Excellent verbal and interpersonal skills in both English and Spanish
Able to travel cross-region (<10% travel time expected)
Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology or a related discipline

Nice to Have

Professional experience in supporting MS Windows 10 and/or Mac OS
Knowledge of general IT security controls and best practices
Experience documenting IT applications and training users
Previous working experience in a global organization across multiple regions & time zones
Certificate(s) of CCNA / CCNP / CMNO /MCSE
Perks & Benefits

Allocations for continuous learning & development
Health & wellness programs

Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world. Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

Title: System Engineer - Data As A Service
Description:
Platform Engineer - Data As A Service

We are looking for a seasoned Platform Engineer to join our Data As A Service team 🚀

You will be joining a team of experienced DevOps, SRE, Database and Network engineers that follow professional software engineering practices for the full Infrastructure as Code life cycle, including build processes, testing and operations 💪

What do we do in the Data As A Service team? 👩‍💻

Data services catalog is built on top of Cloud platforms like Google Cloud Platform and Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

📝 Data As A Service catalog is formed by:

Kafka
ElasticSearch
Redis
Neo4j
Oracle Databases
MySQL


🌎 Managed services from our Cloud providers are also included in our catalog:

BigTable
BigQuery
Memorystore
Cloud SQL
Composer


☝️ We are also responsible for:

Oracle Cloud Infrastructure architecture, management and integration of new managed services
Datalake Platform for Data Scientists teams
BI Platforms


⚙️ We work following GitOps paradigm and automate as much as possible principles, using tools like:

GitLab-CI and Jenkins for CI/CD
Terraform + Terragrunt for Infrastructure as Code
Docker as the Build-Ship-Run anywhere philosophy
Kubernetes as the preferred orchestrator and Helm as the way to create easy deployable applications for anyone


What will you be doing?

Design, implement and maintain Platform configuration and automation systems
Ensure sustainable availability, performance and scalability of Platform infrastructure
Create and manage efficient and automated product deployment lifecycle
Collaborate with other Platform teams to implement best practices for development lifecycle
Implement continuous integration, delivery and deployment methodologies


What are we looking for?

At least 2 years DEVOPS/SRE Experience
Experience using Git
Experience in Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, Terragrunt
Experience in Docker
Experience in automation tools: Ansible
Experience with Orchestrators: Kubernetes
Experience with CI systems, such as Jenkins and GitLab-CI
Experience with GCP
Hands-on experience with ElasticSearch, Kafka and Oracle Databases


What’s in it for you?

Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.
We support a phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance with our flexible hours policy, short Friday schedule (9am-3pm) and flexible remote working policy.
Choose your equipment and really own it! You can choose the OS, laptop and monitor you want to work with and the equipment is totally yours after 3 years in the company.
Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.
A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels and hotel bookings
Special discounts in other local venues, such as gyms, restaurants, shops.
Flexible remuneration plan that allows you to pay reduced rates and tax free for childcare, transport, restaurants, and health insurance
Continuous growth and learning
Our Learning & Development programs give you access to tech talks, soft and technical skills training, external events, industry conferences etc.
Language classes for English


Come fly with us and apply now!

At eDreams ODIGEO we are committed to being an equal opportunity employer, promoting diversity and inclusion at the workplace in all the countries we are present. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, skin color, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability status or any other feature that can be perceived as discriminatory.

We are more than 1000 people from more than 45 nationalities. All different and diverse, but all united by shared values and focused on achieving success, together as a team. Our people are the key of our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

  • Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.
  • A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels and hotel bookings
  • Special discounts in other local venues, such as gyms, restaurants, shops.
  • Flexible remuneration plan that allows you to pay reduced rates and tax free for childcare, transport, restaurants, and health insurance
  • Continuous growth and learning
  • Our Learning & Development programs give you access to tech talks, soft and technical skills training, external events, industry conferences etc.
  • Language classes for English

Come fly with us and apply now!

At eDreams ODIGEO we are committed to being an equal opportunity employer, promoting diversity and inclusion at the workplace in all the countries we are present. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, skin color, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability status or any other feature that can be perceived as discriminatory.

We are more than 1000 people from more than 45 nationalities. All different and diverse, but all united by shared values and focused on achieving success, together as a team. Our people are the key of our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

Title: AWS DevOps Engineer (Fresh Graduate)
Description:
A Snapshot of Your Day

You will be part of an Enterprise Data and Platform Service team you will be responsible for AWS Platform operations. You needto have a strong technical, analytical, and productbackground. As an AWS Operations Engineer, you will develop, test, and deploy code for the operation of the data platformglobally. You will also engage in developing and operating the DevOps setup aswell as helping the team to maximize the automation.

Passionate about the environment and climate change? Ready to be part ofthe future of the energy transition? The Siemens Energy Data Analytics & AIteam plays a significant role in driving the energy transformation.

Honestly, we don’t have all the answers. Honestly, given the scale of thechallenge we need many types of perspectives to help reimagine the future. Andhonestly, we can’t do it alone.

Our team is looking for innovative, enthusiastic, and versatile data,digital, and AI professionals that will drive us forward on this excitingventure.

How You’ll Make An Impact


Technical knowledge in DevOps and Python development skills.
You need to develop Infrastructure as code by writing Cloud formation scripts.
Fix Machine learning-related bugs and issues.


What You Bring


Master’s degree in one of the following fields: Computer science and engineering.
Must have AWS DevOps Certification AWS Certified DevOps Engineer - Professional Certification | AWS Certification | AWS (amazon.com)
Programming skills in Python and Certification. Good to have certification from PCAP (pythoninstitute.org)
You are result-driven as well as excellent interpersonal, communication, and collaborative skills
You are fluent in both spoken and written English.


About The Team

The Data & Analytics organization has been established and designed tohelp Siemens Energy achieve our mission by becoming a data driven organization.Treating and using data as a strategic asset enables us to support customers intransitioning to a more sustainable world, by using innovative technologies andbringing ideas into reality.

Check out this video to see what we do here!

Who is Siemens Energy?

At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. Wemeet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climateis protected. With more than 92,000 dedicated employees, we not only generateelectricity for over 16% of the global community, but we’re also using ourtechnology to help protect people and the environment.

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, andaffordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. Weuphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for peoplewho will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energytransformation.

Our Commitment to Diversity

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity we generate power.We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnicbackground, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energizesociety, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on ourdifferences.

We value equal opportunities and welcome applications from people withdisabilities.

https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/jobs

Title: Senior Analyst-IT Systems
Description:
Job Title

Senior IT System Analyst, EMEA

Department

Information Technology

Reports to

Senior Director - EMEAI Controllership & IT

Finance

FLSA Status

Exempt

Summary

Under minimum supervision, responsible for providing setup, management and support for Windows infrastructure, including network, cabling, desktop, peripheral, and software installations, changes and troubleshooting. Provides system and software support and assists in the development of procedures and documentation.

Primary Duties And Responsibilities

Provides administration for the Active Directory System and Windows servers including user access, configuration and setup.
Helps administer the corporate backup solution, including creation, modification and validation of backup jobs.
Manage the implementation of business-relevant IT projects and initiatives.
Manages vendor relationship for software and hardware, including price negotiations, lease-buyout decisions, system assignments and software capabilities.
Provides administration for the Pelican email system including user access and setup.
Handles service requests from management and end-users related to new installations, changes, break/fix, and troubleshooting.
Provides support to end users with systems and software problems and questions.
Maintains help desk applications and processes help desk tickets.
Helps manage the corporate infrastructure monitoring system which includes setup and management of notifications for all global systems.
Develops procedures, tutorials, training guides and documentation.
Proactively provides patch management and upgrades to ensure the highest level of support and security.
Follows company policies and practices as outlined in the Employee Handbook and/or applicable employment agreement. Follows safety guidelines and procedures in accordance with the job.
Performs additional duties as assigned.

Job Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience.
Must be proficient in English.
Must have understanding of GDPR rules.
Minimum of 5+ years’ experience with Windows operating systems and relevant software packages, including MS Office applications.
The ability to manage multiple projects from beginning to completion.
Proficient working with end users in a networked mixed OS client/server environment.
Highly motivated team player with strong communication skills able to perform assigned tasks with minimal supervision.
Experienced with Network/Systems Monitoring Solutions.
Ability to troubleshoot network, desktops, printers, peripherals, and wireless both OS and hardware.
Must have the ability to complete assignments within time frame specified by IT Management.
Must be able to operate in a fast-paced organization and handle multiple projects simultaneously.
Must be able to interact effectively and cooperatively with employees at all levels.
Must be flexible with work schedules and be available to work overtime on evenings and weekends, with or without advanced notice.

Additional Information

Actively supports and complies with Pelican’s objectives, guidelines and commitment to Quality and Safety, with an emphasis on continual improvement.
Must be able to interact effectively and cooperatively with employees at all levels.
Must have the ability to complete assignments within the timeframe specified by the Manager.
Must be flexible regarding working hours. Must be able to work evenings and weekends, with or without advanced notice.
Must be able to operate in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously.
Must maintain working knowledge of current IT trends and technologies and provide insights to team as appropriate.
Must maintain working knowledge of cybersecurity best practices, enforce security standards, and escalate as necessary.
Must be able to travel, nationally and internationally, as necessary.

Physical Requirements And Working Conditions

While performing the duties of this job, the employee will be frequently required to execute standard physical activities within the facility areas (i.e. stand, walk, sit, use hands/fingers).
While performing the duties of this job, the employee will be frequently required to execute non-standard physical activities within the facility areas (i.e. climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch).
Ability to lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 40 pounds.
This position requires repetitive hand/wrist activities.

#PELI

Pelican Products, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Title: Graph Database developer for innovation projects
Description:
Job Summary

We are looking for an experienced developer to join our team. If you have great programming skills and a passion for databases, we would like to meet you! As a developer in our company you will be working on the design, development, and implementation of graph algorithms to solve complex data problems.

The ideal candidate will be a dynamic person with an engineering or technical background with good team working skills yet able to work individually, motivated and with a high level of commitment, as well as being eager to learn new technologies.

To be successful in this role, you will need a good knowledge of Graph Databases. A bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related degree is needed.

The team where you will be integrated is an international remote-working group of young developers with experience in different aspects of software development. The company is based in Barcelona.

 

 

Tasks to be done

Design, development, and implementation of Graph algorithms to solve complex data problems.
 Design test and validation processes for Graph algorithms.
Implementation of libraries with high level functionalities that integrate graph algorithms.

 

What is required for the position?

Essential:

Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent degree.
+3 years of relevant graph database experience.
Experience with the design, development, and implementation of graph algorithms to solve complex data problems.
Experience with Graph databases Sparksee, Neo4j, ...
Experience using a graph query language like Cypher.
Experience in designing test and validation processes for Graph algorithms.
Understanding of the use and implementation of Graph Based Knowledge Bases.
Strong knowledge of UNIX/Linux environments.
Experience working with Docker containers.
Proficient with code versioning tools (git).
Good leadership and good communication skills, both verbal and written.
Proficiency in English language.

 

Plus (not mandatory):

Familiarity with distributed streaming platforms such as Apache Kafka.
Experience with Smart Contracts / Blockchain technologies.
Experience programming in C++.
Knowledge of cloud orchestration with Kubernetes.
MSc or PhD in Computer Science.

 

What are my benefits

Working in a company with significant innovation potential.
Being part of a friendly working environment that is very flexible.
Work in a multicultural environment and a multidisciplinary team.
Growth in a highly technological environment.
Agreement to work remotely open to discussion and create your own schedule.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Partner Development – (Statistics/ML/BI) (Bangkok-based, relocation provided)
Description:
About Agoda




Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.




Get to know our team:




Partner Development is a team of creative entrepreneurs that develop solutions for Agoda’s accommodation partners and promote Agoda’s top and bottom line growth. We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda’s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we roll out new product to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.




In this role you’ll get to




This role is designed to mainly growth opportunity identification among mid to long tail hotels, experiment execution and data tracking within Partner Development team for the global teams. You will get to work directly with the regional team to design and put in place global experimentation and initiatives to drive tangible impact in each market.




Key activities involved include but not limit to:




Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to identify opportunities for business improvements and support your recommendations
Own end-to-end project or roll out new experiments to validate in-market impact of an initiative within Partner Development
Build dashboards, identify new and track key metrics to closely monitor team’s performance and identify quick and long term opportunities for improvements
Work closely with cross-functional teams of analysts, regional team leads, product managers and business owners to drive changes based on opportunities identified
Support global Partner Development related initiatives, including experimentation infrastructure-building and methodology standardization




What You’ll Need To Succeed




Bachelor’s degree in science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
4-8 years experience working in a business analysis, data analysis, reporting or business strategy role
Excellent problem-solving skills including the ability to analyze and resolve complex problems using data
Team player with strong interpersonal, relationship-building, and stakeholder management skills
Coding skills for analytics and data manipulation (SQL, R, Python, Pandas, Scala)
Data visualization tool experience such as with Tableau or your weapon of choice
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English), with proven ability to convey complex messages clearly and with conviction

Equal Opportunity Employer




At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.




We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .




To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

  • Own end-to-end project or roll out new experiments to validate in-market impact of an initiative within Partner Development
  • Build dashboards, identify new and track key metrics to closely monitor team’s performance and identify quick and long term opportunities for improvements
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams of analysts, regional team leads, product managers and business owners to drive changes based on opportunities identified
  • Support global Partner Development related initiatives, including experimentation infrastructure-building and methodology standardization


What You’ll Need To Succeed


  • Bachelor’s degree in science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
  • 4-8 years experience working in a business analysis, data analysis, reporting or business strategy role
  • Excellent problem-solving skills including the ability to analyze and resolve complex problems using data
  • Team player with strong interpersonal, relationship-building, and stakeholder management skills
  • Coding skills for analytics and data manipulation (SQL, R, Python, Pandas, Scala)
  • Data visualization tool experience such as with Tableau or your weapon of choice
  • Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment
  • Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English), with proven ability to convey complex messages clearly and with conviction

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Place: Sant Quirze del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
¿Quiénes somos?




En ZITRO somos referentes en la industria del juego a nivel mundial. Desde su creación en 2007 no hemos parado de crecer y expandirnos por todo el mundo. ¿Nuestro secreto? Una apuesta constante en investigación, desarrollo, innovación tecnológica y en el mejor equipo humano con el que trabajar codo con codo. ¿Te animas?

Si te pica la curiosidad y quieres conocernos mejor, echa un vistazo: https://zitrogames.com/es/




¿Qué buscamos?




Ampliar nuestro equipo de Matemáticas con un profesional a que quiera trabajar en el mundo del análisis de datos matemáticos con procesos de ETL, interesando en la programación y en el mundo del juego.

Te unirás a un equipo proactivo y muy unido, que trabajan en un entrono dinámico e innovador.

Si te sientes identificado y compartes esta filosofía, ¡SOMOS TU EMPRESA!




¿Qué harás?




Carga de datos en motor de búsqueda ElasticSearch.
Diseño y creación de indicadores matemáticos utilizando Python.
Creación de dashboards para visualización de datos en Kibana.
Extracción de conclusiones y predicciones mediante machine learning.




¿Qué necesitas?




Estudios superiores que envuelvan análisis de datos (Estadística, Grado en Matemática Computacional y Analítica de Datos,...).
Experiencia mínima de un año o similar en posiciones de análisis de datos
Conocimientos en Git.
Conocimientos en Python
Conocimientos del stack ELK: concretamente ElasticSearch y Kibana
Capacidad de aportar de forma proactiva posibles soluciones a problemas del día, trabajando de forma autónoma.




¿Cuál es nuestro Stack?




Linux/Unix
ElasticSearch
Kibana
Git

¿Qué suma puntos?




Conocimientos de Unix, Multiprocesing y/o Machine Learning.
Interés y/o experiencia previa en el sector de los juegos.
Nivel de Inglés B2 o superior.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Oportunidad de desarrollo profesional
Horario flexible y jornada continuada los viernes
Posibilidad de teletrabajo
Seguro de salud y de vida
Retribución flexible (Tickets guardería)

Title: Data Solutions Delivery Engineer
Description:
Our opportunity

The Data Management team is responsible for defining the data management strategy as well as setting up and expanding the strategic BI & Analytics landscape of Zurich Switzerland as part of numerous projects. We are a young and motivated team and are looking for active support in the further development of the existing data platform.

In this role, as a member of the Platform Team inside Data Management, you will be part of an agile team and provide services to other development/service teams, as well as ensure ongoing services. Specifically, you will support the release process, support the development and application of development standards and support the correct operation of existing processes, among others.

Your role

As a Solution Engineer DWH/BI you are mainly responsible for:


Support the release and deployment processes.
Development, validation and documentation of design concepts and target solution architecture.
Support the f urther development of architecture and development standards.
Execution of database queries and analyses in the context of support or ad-hoc inquiries.
Maintenance and support of the developed solutions and documentation (DevOps, 3rd level).
Help diagnosing incidents and contribute to the solution.
Support the general, technical improvement of the platform.
Within a project take direction from more senior architects, e.g., other solution architectures or functional area architects. Perform or execute given assignments under supervision.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of IT enterprise architecture, standards and practices by maintaining understanding of current and future technology developments.
Design, document and implement solutions to automate business processes/activities.


Additional duties:


Support the analysis of technical requirements and user acceptance tests, as well as ensuring the clean handover to operations.
Support of test management (planning, design and testing).
Prepare solution design documents, presentations and other materials, using established formats and standard software and templates.
Provide consultation for specific area of technology to project efforts within various IT areas and/or external service providers.
Identify, in collaboration with the functional area architect, existing IT software assets for new opportunities (e.g., re-use) through project and program involvement.


Your Qualifications And Experience

As a Solution Engineer DWH/BI, you have the following skills and qualifications:


Practical experience as a developer or in a similar function in the field of data warehousing and data integration, ideally in larger DWH/BI projects.
Knowledge of solution architectures for DWH/BI applications and the use of BI & Analytics tools, ideally Microsoft BI stack and Azure pipelines.
Practical experience in database and DWH development, ideally with DWH automation tools such as WhereScape RED.
Experience in agile frameworks such as Scrum or SAFe.
Very good knowledge of English (German would be a plus).
Open, communicative and assertive personality.
Experience in data quality management and knowledge of data modeling (3NF, Star Schema) would be a plus.


Additional Information

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:


Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 100% - you choose
Flexible working hours
Wide range of internal and external trainings
Free English and Spanish classes depending on the needs
Ticket restaurant
Life Insurance
Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company
Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you
Special banking and insurance conditions
Exclusive Employees discounts


Primary work location is Barcelona, Poblenou. Option to telework from any location within Spain territory is also feasible.

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

Please apply with your CV in English.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

Why Zurich

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that’s what makes our team so great!

Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet .


Location(s): ES - Barcelona
Remote working: Yes
Schedule: Full Time
Recruiter name: Santamaría Rodríguez Laura
Closing date:

Title: Ads Analyst l Candy Crush Soda (Monetisation)
Description:
Craft:

Data, Analytics & Strategy

Job Description:

We are looking for a talented Analyst with a passion for data driven platforms, digital advertising, and the gaming industry to help us scale our player-first advertising business. You will work embedded in a game studio, collaboratively with an array of demand / ad operations, data science and support functions to sustainably grow our advertising revenue. You will play a pivotal role in the decision-making that will directly impact the top-line revenue generation for one of our world-class titles.

Responsibilities

Perform regular analysis of revenue trends and KPIs to optimise performance across our existing ads demand channels and generate insights that drive our strategic roadmap
Create and own analytics dashboards that will inform and update stakeholders on ongoing ad monetization on our mobile titles and experiments to improve monetization
Distil key insights from A/B tests and conduct deep-dives that will inform demand strategy and directly fuel ads revenue growth via pricing adjustments and ongoing waterfall management
Be part of a team of 20+ talents working on building the best monetisation (in-game purchases + ads) & economy experiences for our players!


Skills To Create Thrills

There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in the areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger.

Specific factors that are helpful to excel in this role include:

Work experience: 3+ years experience working in an analytical role within advertising, gaming, tech, or management consulting
Business Insight: Demonstrated business judgement in generating insights and actionable next steps from complex data
Statistics: Understanding the AB-testing methodology, ability to make judgement calls on these or the others methods’ applicability
SQL: The ability to write complex SQL queries and navigate a data warehouse to analyse the behaviour of our 300+ million players (BigQuery is the dialect we use)
Communication: Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting your results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguous
Analytical coding: Using tools such as R, Python or Excel for analytical purposes
Skills with standard reporting tools such as Looker/QlikView/Tableau/etc


Bonus Points

Familiarity with mobile ad technology / operations, including waterfall management, yield optimisation and working with demand providers (e.g. ad networks, exchanges, etc.)
Experience with BI-tools as Looker or similar analytics platforms
Knowledge of ad / game industry best practices for app monetisation, including advertising optimisation and balance vs. in-app game purchase revenue streams


About King

King is a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, with people all around the world playing one or more of our games, including franchises such as Candy Crush, Farm Heroes, Pet Rescue and Bubble Witch.

We have 249 million monthly active users as of fourth quarter 2019 across web, social and mobile platforms. King was acquired by Activision Blizzard Inc. (Nasdaq ATVI) in February 2016 and operates as an independent unit of the

company.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players – and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!

About King

King is the game developer behind the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top-grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King’s games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid-core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!

Applications need to be in English.

Discover King at careers.king.com

Title: Business Analyst Laboratory Informatics
Place: Sant Boi de Llobregat, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Job profile




As business analyst laboratory informatics you will work within the Corporate Application Services team (CAS). The CAS department is responsible for the proper functioning and continuous improvement of all corporate business applications within Synthon. The laboratory Informatics domain covers both R&D and QC processes and consists currently of multiple applications such as LIMS and ELN. As the Synthon organization continually develops and new processes are being introduced, we expect further growth in this Lab domain in the coming years.







Key responsibilities




As business analyst laboratory informatics, you proactively identify, assess and document business requirements, recommend business priorities and advise on options, potential risks and costs. You explore possible solutions, check whether any are already being used within the company, and if not, whether new solutions are feasible. Subsequently you analyze the impact of proposed solution across the business and develop use cases to explain/demonstrate business requirements/specifications to the various stakeholders. Furthermore, your tasks will include organizing workshops, providing test scenarios, training and supporting business process experts.

You will serve as liaison between the internal customer, the external supplier and the Information Services department to manage changes according to the applicable guidelines set for the pharmaceutical industry. The position requires occasional trips to our affiliates in Europe and Latin America. The QC department has developed a paperless lab strategy and as business analyst laboratory informatics you will play a crucial role in the realization of this strategy with the introduction of LES.




You will report tot the vice president Information Services.







Our offer




We offer our employees a working environment in which trust, pride and joy play an important role and as such, we have been acknowledged as a Top Employer® in 2020, 2021 and 2022. We understand our economic, social and environmental impact on the wider world. We care - for each other, for partners, for patients and for society at large. We support various educational initiatives and actively contribute to charitable causes and to the development of the communities worldwide to which we belong.




More specifically, we offer our employees:

A professional, yet pleasant and informal working environment with short communication lines, focus on cooperation and appreciation of initiatives
Competitive remuneration
Good working conditions with attention to ergonomic support
A keen eye on work/life balance, with the option to work partly from home.




Your profile




Your letter of motivation and CV should show that you have:

At least a bachelor’s degree in (Applied) Computer Science or Business Management
A minimum of 7 years of relevant work experience in business process reengineering and business modelling concepts, business systems development and analysis (experience in the pharmaceutical or related industry is strongly desired)
Proven in-depth knowledge of laboratory informatics systems like LIMS and ELN
Thorough knowledge of managing complex projects
Experience with computer system validation is a strong advantage
An excellent command of the English language (both speaking and writing)




Requirements




In interviews, you will be able to demonstrate that:

You can easily translate customer requirements into tangible results and have proven experience as a project manager.
You are able to quickly build and maintain relationships with your colleagues, our internal customers and external suppliers.
You have strong analytical, communication and problem-solving skills.
You are able to look at things from a process perspective.
You are also results-oriented, proactive and able to coordinate groups of stakeholders and activities independently.
Finally, you are flexible and still eager to learn.

Title: Machine Learning Operations Analyst
Description:
Country

Spain

Job Family

Technology

At GfK, we are on a mission to drive sustainable growth for our people, our clients, and the world around us. We combine prescriptive insights and consulting expertise to analyze, explain and predict what is happening in today’s fast-changing world.

Our employees, the shapers of tomorrow, are empowered to bring new bold ideas to life by connecting unique datasets, science, and digital research. We encourage innovation and offer global career and fast development opportunities. This is why the world’s largest companies and leading brands know GfK as their trusted partner.

Job Description

Job Description

As a Machine Learning Operations Analyst you will deliver innovative analytics on top of unique data sets using a state-of-the-art tech stack. A perfect playground for creative minds who have fun shaping things. You will get the chance to consult internal as well as external clients in the field of Media Measurement, helping them to understand our data integration products. You will shape the way how we run Data Science and Machine learning in production for various clients in several countries. Your colleagues are experienced Data Scientists and Engineers who will happily share their knowledge but are also keen to learn from your experience. Moreover, you will be part of the Global Data Science community, 80+ professionals in 4 countries, all ready to challenge and be challenged by your skill set.

As Machine Learning Operations Analyst you will have following key accountabilities:

Serve as the second-layer support for machine-learning solutions within GfK's Media Measurement products
Understand and improve the existing system monitoring on model performance
Deep-dive into the existing machine-learning solutions to understand issues, build quick fixes, suggest sustainable fixes
Explain the system behavior to users (commercial, operations) and developers (software engineers, data scientists)

Now you know what a Machine Learning Operations Analyst does. What skills, qualifications & experience do you need for this job?

Your English is fluent in a business environment, fluent Spanish is a plus
You are experienced with deep-dives into processes, data and their properties
You are experienced in communication with tech and non tech audiences
You have experience with an analytical programming language (Python, R)
You have the ability to think creatively in addressing analytical objectives
You have basic statistical / machine learning modeling skills (e.g. statistical tests, classification, predictive modelling, handling of missing data, sampling, weighting)
You typically have a bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics or some related field and 2+ years of experience.

Besides The Things We Really Expect You To Have, There Are Some Things Which Would Be Amazing If You Have Experience With Them As Well

You have basic knowledge of cloud computing environments and tooling (especially AWS)
You are experiences with orchestration, monitoring and altering tools (e.g. Airflow, Grafana)
You are experienced in operations

Admittedly, this is a long list and we do not expect you to be able to tick off every single point on it. Learning on the job and formal trainings will help you to close potential knowledge gaps and quickly bring you up to speed.

We Offer You

A challenging project, where you can learn new things every day and show the team what you’ve got.
The possibility to be part of a talented team, working with highly skilled individuals.
A nice place to work, where we foster training, as well as professional and personal development.
Flex Office: a mix of remote and in-office work to boost our productivity and promote a healthy work-life balance
Flexible retribution: meal and transport tickets, kindergarten cheques and/or private health insurance

We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.

Can there be a better place to take center stage in the digital revolution? We are excited to getting to know you!

Don't meet every single requirement? Some people are less likely to apply unless they meet all the requirements listed in a job specification. GfK is looking for self-starters to join our innovative team keen to take on a new challenge. So, if you're excited about this role but your skills and experience don't align perfectly with every requirement we've listed, we still encourage you to apply. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

We are an ethical and honest company that is wholly committed to its clients and employees. We are proud to be an inclusive workplace for all and are committed to equal opportunity in employment which focuses on all of our employees reaching their full potential. We are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Systems Engineer w/ full professional level of English
Description:
Are you looking to join a dynamic team of professionals who provide a high level of technical support?




Do you love facing complex technical problems to find the best solution? If you move like a fish in water between servers and virtual machines, then please keep reading, as it could be a job opportunity for you!




For our client, the world’s leading provider of digital printing solutions, we are currently looking for a System Administrator, a passionate, curious, and driven team player who is ready to ignite ideas, push boundaries, and drive innovation.




Key Languages




Full professional level of English




Main Responsibilities




Support Desk: maintenance-developer and operational support for tickets: ticketing tool, reports, knowledgebase, training material, process documentation, ticket quality monitoring
POC for high, critical & medium tickets
Manage MS Azure Cloud environment, also the infrastructure related on a System Admin level,
Configurate all rack-room implementations including switches, SD-WAN implementations, firewalls,etc.. aligned with CIO
Align across IS department and manage Servers: Windows and Linux based servers, ESX hosts, ERP servers, SQL servers, Web servers, Domain Controllers, DNS servers, etc
Align across IS department networks: DHCP, DNS, TCP/IP, firewalls and routers configuration, general network issues troubleshooting, IP addressing, etc.
Maintain the License Management and Network assets




Core Skills/experience




Hands-on and knowledge on Windows and Mac Operating Systems
Knowledge of Active Directory, Office 365, Azure cloud
Knowledge of DHCP, DNS and IP protocols
User account management for Active Directory, Exchange Mailboxes, Distribution lists
Remote desktop connectivity
MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Project and Visio)
Internet browsers (Explorer, Chrome, Firefox)
VPN and remote dial-in applications
Support for Lan-& Wan-network, laptop, desktops, and printers
Microsoft SQL knowledge




What's On Offer




Competitive salary and benefits
Hybrid work model




What will you learn?:




null




Our recruitment process?:




Step 1: Interview with one of our Recruiters to get to know you better
Step 2: Screening Interview with HR
Step 3: Interview with Hiring Manager
Step 4: Interview with IS Manager

Title: Graduate/Early Career Developer
HTML:
Who We Are


We are Adaptive, a successful and growing software consultancy with a great reputation among staff and clients alike. We work closely with our financial clients to build bespoke software solutions to help them to achieve their business goals. As a consultancy, our client's success relies on us making sound technical decisions, collaborating with stakeholders, and being up to date with the latest technology and practices in the fintech industry.


We're looking for candidates to join us in early September 2023 to build on their training and experience so far, learn about finance, and have a great time doing so!


Who You Are


Does crafting elegant and performant software solutions excite you?


Are you keen to work in the finance industry?


Would you like the opportunity to learn from industry-leading consultants in a collaborative, professional and friendly environment?


Whilst we are going to support your professional development, you will currently be able to clearly model, articulate and solve complex problems. You will have a strong passion for software engineering and technology and not be afraid to be out of your comfort zone. We are looking for team players who are proactive and use their initiative.


THE EARLY CAREERS PROGRAM


We have honed our Early Careers Program over the years to ensure that it provides a great learning experience and prepares our trainees for an exciting, fast-paced career in software development. You should expect a mix of hands-on development (you won’t believe the things you’ll be able to do after just a few weeks!) and training in capital markets, alongside brown-bag sessions with colleagues from all different areas of our company to ensure that you fully understand your role in the bigger picture.


The program includes:


  • Training in software development;
  • Training in financial markets, project management and consultancy skills;
  • Gaining practical project work experience and working in an agile team;
  • Hands-on training from some of the leading consultants in the industry;
  • Working with high-profile clients using the latest technology stacks;
  • Experienced, supportive, smart and friendly colleagues;
  • Working alongside trainees from our other offices.


Experience


Required skills and experience:


  • A strong interest in working with front-end technologies like JavaScript, HTML5 and CSS3 and/or back-end technologies like Java;
  • Interest in working with distributed systems;
  • Understand basic networking such as HTTP and TCP/IP;
  • Practical coding experience in Java, JavaScript, Python, C# or similar. This could have been gained through university, attending a bootcamp, on-the-job, or being self-taught;
  • Curiosity and desire to gain deep technical knowledge, lift up and peek under the carpet, figure out how and why things work;
  • Armed with a strong desire to progress and learn;
  • A quick learner with excellent communication skills to efficiently leverage the knowledge of more experienced members of the team;


THE INTERVIEW PROCESS


Don't worry, we won't put you through tens of interviews! We'll review your application and if it's aligned with what we're looking for, we'll arrange a phone call with you. If after that phone call, we're both happy to proceed, we'll invite you to a zoom interview for technical aspects, followed by an interview with our local director!


Benefits


  • 23 Days holiday
  • Private health insurance
  • Pension plan scheme
  • Ticket Restaurant added to your salary
  • Well-being budget
  • Language classes (English and Spanish)


DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION


We strongly believe that diversity and inclusion are key to a great workplace and that Adaptive is better when it’s more representative of the world around us. We want everyone to feel comfortable bringing their whole selves to work without any fear of judgment or negativity. All we ask is that our colleagues are passionate about what they do, have the skills needed to be successful in the role and are adaptable and collaborative.


US-based candidates should be aware that Adaptive uses E-Verify to validate right to work.

Title: Adobe Campaign Developer
Description:
Company Description




At Cognizant Netcentric, we come to work every day with the mission of leveraging cutting-edge technology to create memorable digital experiences for the world’s leading brands. And we do it as a diverse, global community of over 1500+ Adobe experts collaborating across countries, cultures, languages and technologies.




We’re energized by an inclusive and responsive organizational culture that brings together the entrepreneurial spirit of a startup with the resources, growth opportunities and stability of a larger global organization.




Holacracy is the cornerstone of how we work, empowering every individual with the power to make an impact within our organization. All this encourages us to learn and grow as individuals, and unite as a team to build innovative digital experiences that touch people’s lives.




Job Description




We are looking for a software engineer who's ready to welcome the next challenge in his/her career. At Netcentric you will learn how to use your technical skills in implementing 1:1 marketing solutions into an enterprise systems landscape. as well as implementing the required integrations and tuning the necessary infrastructure for maximum performance, scalability, and resilience.




You will be responsible for the implementation of new requirements based on client's needs;
Will work on the development of products and solutions in the area of marketing automation;
Will be part of an Agile team, sharing experiences and working with them;
Will develop and be responsible for creating and maintaining technical documentation;
Will identify, analyze and fix reported issues on the platform;
Will do code reviews taking into consideration industry's standards and best practices.
Qualifications




What do we require from you?




At least 4 years of experience with Adobe Campaign and certification(s) or any marketing automation platform equivalent (such as SAS MA, Teradata CIS, Selligent, Exacttarget etc.)
Experience in development of requirements in Javascript server side programming language or the equivalent in other back-end programming languages
Experience in working with SQL and Database models and having SQL programming skills in any relational database (ideally Oracle/Postgresql)
Experience in implementing and integrating with Web Services (SOAP, REST)
Experience in applying software engineering / web development principals: iterative cycles, source control, unit testing and producing quality, very well commented code
Knowledge of or experience in working with XML and JSON structures
Knowledge of and ability to understand HTML and CSS
Ability to investigate, debug and implement fixes for any given requirement
Ability to implement business requirements with technical solutions - asking clarification questions, reviewing specifications from business requirements in order to make sure that it's aligned with the deliverables on the project




What makes us smile when looking at your profile:




Ability to understand and apply marketing solutions in an enterprise context
Strong verbal and written English skills. German/Spanish would be a plus-plus
A proactive mind-set, ability to share your ideas and bring them to life
Maintain an enthusiastic attitude and strong intrinsic motivation
Having an open mind and constantly looking for continuous improvement
You are not afraid of giving and receiving feedback




Nice to have:




Experience in international projects and working with remote teams
Experience in Wiki and Ticketing management tools (ideally Confluence and JIRA)
Experience in CICD pipeline management




Additional Information




At Cognizant Netcentric you get:




Permanent contract
30 working days of vacation
Flexible working hours
Recognition bonus system
Private health insurance
Apple work equipment
WFH equipment + welcome package
WFH monthly expenses compensation
Access to Udemy courses
Adobe certification
Sponsored gym membership
Tax-free benefits (ticket restaurant, kindergarten and transport)
A dynamic and international team
Everyone has a voice; we are a Holacracy organization
Show more Show less

  • Experience in Wiki and Ticketing management tools (ideally Confluence and JIRA)
  • Experience in CICD pipeline management


Additional Information


At Cognizant Netcentric you get:


  • Permanent contract
  • 30 working days of vacation
  • Flexible working hours
  • Recognition bonus system
  • Private health insurance
  • Apple work equipment
  • WFH equipment + welcome package
  • WFH monthly expenses compensation
  • Access to Udemy courses
  • Adobe certification
  • Sponsored gym membership
  • Tax-free benefits (ticket restaurant, kindergarten and transport)
  • A dynamic and international team
  • Everyone has a voice; we are a Holacracy organization

Title: Customer Insights Analyst (Bangkok Based, Relocation Provided)
Description:
About Agoda




Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.




Get to Know our Team:




The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.




Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:




Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap
Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders




What you’ll Need to Succeed:




Bachelor’s degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study
0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company
Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g. SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence
Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently




It’s Great if you Have:




Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce
Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
Strong presentation and negotiation skills

Title: Sr. Digital Analyst A/B Testing (f/m/d) (Remote)
Description:
Fossil is on a mission to create great watches, jewelry, handbags, small leather goods and wearables by investing in technology and long-term value creation. We do this by living into our core values - Authenticity, Grit, Curiosity, Humor, and Impact - each and every day, continually powered by purpose and our people. We thrive on diversity, innovation, uniqueness, and inclusion. Will you join us?




As the Sr. Digital Analyst A/B Testing, you will be responsible for bringing insights to optimize our global direct to consumer websites, across multiple brands by working closely with cross-functional teams to engineer tests in various A/B testing environments.




Your impact




Serve as the primary point of contact for global A/B testing
Provide A/B testing technology expertise for test design and technical implementation
Design, test, and code review tests including audience definition, hypothesis testing and tracking of results on GA4
Convert our data into meaningful and actionable business analysis and insights
Improve and maintain testing guidelines
Stay current with digital commerce technology & upgrades in testing approach / methodology
Translate business and marketing challenges into well-designed tests
Maintain and document processes/procedures and provide seamless hand-off to business users to utilize




Who you are




2 years experience of Google Optimize (or another A/B testing tool), Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics (GA/GA4)
Excellent program management, written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work effectively with non-technical personnel (e.g., eCommerce merchants, brand partners, marketers)
Strong leadership, proven ability to drive results, positively influence change, and motivate others within a non-direct reporting structure to take action/execute.




Preferred




Experience with collaboration tools such as JIRA, Slack
Experience agile development methodology
Experience with web frameworks, interactive web development, responsive web design
Bachelor's Degree in computer science, digital marketing or similar degrees
Hands-on experience in web technologies including: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, XML, JQuery




We are looking for people who embody our core values; Authenticity, we are all in with our unique selves. Everyone is different at Fossil and we love it! Grit, we push through, we bounce back, and we set our sights on the prize & go after it. Curiosity, we ask what if? What's next? Sense of humor, we don't take ourselves too seriously. Yeah, seriously. Making an Impact we go big. We perform. We make a difference.




At Fossil, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our community. We are an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in all employment practices without regard to age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion, sex and sexual orientation.




What does our recruitment process look like?




Once you have applied, we will have a look at your CV.
If your experience matches what we are looking for, you will be invited to complete a first automated video interview using Cammio. Cammio is a video interviewing platform, you can complete your interview on your own, anytime that works for you.
If you ace your video interview, you will be invited to a personal interview, virtually or face-to-face.




Life is Short, Work Somewhere Awesome!
