Title: Salesforce Developer (H/M)
Description:
Desde Volkswagen Group Services estamos buscando incorporar al equipo un Salesforce Developer. El objetivo del proyecto será realizar la migración del CRM actual, mantenimiento y mejora continua de las soluciones Salesforce.




Las tareas a realizar son las siguientes:

Desarrollar soluciones en cualquiera de los clouds de Salesforce (Sales, Service, Marketing, Experience...) y con los distintos componentes de programación de Salesforce (Apex, Visualforce, componentes lightning...)
Conocer en detalle la solución Salesforce de VWG así como los procesos de negocio, metodología, etc. específicos del sector Automoción.




Requisitos de la posición:

Grado en Ingeniería técnica.
Idiomas: inglés (B2+)
Experiencia de entre 1-2 años mínimo en las funciones descritas.
Experiencia de trabajo en proyectos en entorno Agile.







Requisitos valorables:

Certificación en Salesforce.
Valorable experiencia en el sector de automoción.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Subvención diaria para la cantina.
Acceso gratuito a transporte de empresa.
Formación subvencionada en idiomas.
Acceso a plataforma de Formación (Udemy)
Descuentos en automóviles del grupo.

Title: Desarrollador/a Salesforce
Place: Sant Boi de Llobregat, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Desde Epos Spain precisamos incorporar a un/a Desarrollador/a Salesforce para importante empresa del sector fotovoltaico, ubicado en Sant Boi de Llobregat.




Responsabilidades:

Ser una fuente de conocimiento de Salesforce para la empresa
Dirigir la entrega técnica de soluciones de aplicación a medida para la empresa dentro del presupuesto y los plazos acordados
Diseñar y crear soluciones personalizadas para satisfacer los requisitos de apoyo a la empresa.
Mantenimiento de la aplicación y asistencia a los usuarios
Garantizar que la documentación está actualizada y se mantiene para todos los desarrollos




Experiencia requerida:

Más de 2 años de experiencia como desarrollador de Salesforce
Gran atención a los detalles y excelente capacidad para resolver problemas
Capacidad para realizar múltiples tareas y gestionar las prioridades en consecuencia
Ser capaz de diseñar soluciones personalizadas y evaluar el impacto en los procesos empresariales y las aplicaciones externas
Ser capaz de realizar pruebas unitarias y de control de calidad para garantizar que la plataforma siga funcionando como siempre
Conocimiento de la configuración de de Salesforce (por ejemplo, objetos personalizados, creadores de procesos, alertas por correo electrónico, etc.)
Conocimiento de los mecanismos de integración con aplicaciones externas mediante las API de Salesforce (REST o SOAP)
Experiencia en la realización de despliegues y en el uso de herramientas de control de versiones (GIT/Bitbucket/Salesforce CLI)
Diseño y desarrollo personalizado de Salesforce utilizando herramientas programáticas (Apex, Visualforce y Lightning Web Components, CSS, etc.) y declarativas (Flow, Process Builder, etc.).

 

Requisitos mínimos:




Experiencia en el diseño y desarrollo de componentes de software de Salesforce utilizando herramientas declarativas y programáticas.
Experiencia con tecnologías de desarrollo de Salesforce como Apex/VF y el framework SFDX.
Dominio de JavaScript y experiencia trabajando con Lightning Aura Components y Lightning Web Components.
Experiencia demostrable de implementación de extremo a extremo con la plataforma SFDC.
Experiencia con otras tecnologías de desarrollo como Java, Node.js o Angular JS.




Se ofrece:

Salario a negociar según valía.
Trabajo presencial en nuestras oficinas en Sant Boi de Llobregat.
Horario de L a V de 9:00 a 18:00 y V de 8:00 a 15:00.
Contrato directamente con la empresa
Estabilidad

Title: Salesforce Developer (Remote)
Description:
What about us?

Sunhero is a residential solar energy company on a mission to make access to clean, PV solar energy easy and affordable. We leverage technology and innovation to accelerate the transition to clean energy.

Sunhero was founded in 2021 by Christopher Cederskog and Stefan Braun. Two entrepreneurs with over 25 years of experience launching companies in the international markets, including Airbnb, Rover, and Course Hero. Sunhero is Berlin-funded and Barcelona-headquartered.

We raised our series A investment round of 10M€ in March 2023. This round was led by climate tech VC Planet A and Vorwerk Ventures as well as Redstone, All Iron Ventures, and Speedinvest.

We started in Spain, but climate change knows no borders. And neither will we. Want to know more? Please visit Sunhero.com .

What would you do working with us?

We are seeking an experienced Salesforce Developer with at least 18 months of experience working with Salesforce, APEX, and APIs. The successful candidate will have a proven track record of developing scalable software on Salesforce, and preferably have some experience in building efficient pipelines to work with Salesforce and code hosting platforms such as GitHub. Additionally, they will have experience integrating Salesforce with third-party apps and APIs.

To succeed in this role, you need to be an entrepreneur at heart. You are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done and openness for iterations and changes of course. You know that building a company means doing whatever works best for customers and partners and you are willing to roll up your sleeves to make this happen.

Key Responsibilities:

Cooperate with the Salesforce Product Manager to validate business requirements and any considerations (security, scalability, limits).
Develop custom User Interfaces, including Visualforce pages/Lightning pages, Aura Components, and Lightning Web Components.
Design and develop custom Salesforce solutions using Apex, Visualforce, and Lightning components.
Develop Flow solutions that can be maintained by business superusers.
Build efficient pipelines to work with Salesforce and code hosting platforms such as GitHub.
Integrate Salesforce with third-party apps and APIs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Troubleshoot and debug issues with Salesforce solutions.
Participate in code reviews and ensure adherence to best practices.
Collaborate with our development team to efficiently develop new features and fix ongoing issues.
Write clean and maintainable code that is easy to understand and reuse.
Help refactor existing APEX code base to optimize performance and scalability.
Test software to ensure responsiveness and efficiency.
Be able to autonomously work on all stages of software development; model, implementation, and delivery.


What would we need from you to be successful in this role?

At least 18 months of experience working with Salesforce, Apex, and REST APIs.
Experience building efficient pipelines to work with Salesforce and code hosting platforms such as GitHub (without using any external tool like Copado and similar) is a plus.
Experience with Salesforce Flow development.
Proficient with the Salesforce development lifecycle.
Ensure proper test coverage for all APEX code base.
Strong understanding of Salesforce architecture and data model.
Strong knowledge of git and git workflows.
Hands-on experience with DevOps practices.
Deep understanding of APIs and how they integrate with websites and applications.
Hands-on experience with TDD is a strong plus.
Used to work with Scrum agile principles and methodologies.
Experience integrating Salesforce with third-party apps and APIs.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Salesforce Developer certification is a plus.
Strong knowledge of computer theory, design, and architectural patterns and algorithms.
Previous experience in a tech startup is highly desirable.
A strong motivation to positively impact the planet and change the way people think about energy production.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.


This is a remote/hybrid position. You can work completely remotely if you prefer. We have a beautiful office in downtown Barcelona, where you are welcome to work if that suits you. We are hiring either a full-time employee (FTE) or a contractor for this role. If you are based in Germany or Spain, we can offer an FTE role. In case you are based outside these jurisdictions, we can offer a contractor position through Deel.

What perks you will find in Sunhero:

A meaningful job - we are driven by the desire to make a positive impact on our planet.
You will get the chance to deliver impact and shape the path of one of Southern Europe’s solar panel most promising startups.
A chance to work with and learn from an experience, diverse, inclusive, and international team. We are 19+ nationalities at Sunhero.
You will have a flexible working schedule that is based on ownership and autonomy of your role.
We are a working parent-friendly environment. 80% of our leadership are parents themselves.
If you are based in Barcelona and like to come to the office, we have a beautiful coworking space in the city center.
We are remote-first and our working hours are CET +/- 2.


Diversity & Inclusion

Diversity and inclusion are important to us, and we’re constantly working to improve these aspects. At Sunhero, we don’t just accept our differences, we fully support and celebrate them. We’re committed to equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, or gender identity or expression. We strive to be an equal-opportunity workplace.
Show more Show less
HTML:
What about us?

Sunhero is a residential solar energy company on a mission to make access to clean, PV solar energy easy and affordable. We leverage technology and innovation to accelerate the transition to clean energy.

Sunhero was founded in 2021 by Christopher Cederskog and Stefan Braun. Two entrepreneurs with over 25 years of experience launching companies in the international markets, including Airbnb, Rover, and Course Hero. Sunhero is Berlin-funded and Barcelona-headquartered.

We raised our series A investment round of 10M€ in March 2023. This round was led by climate tech VC Planet A and Vorwerk Ventures as well as Redstone, All Iron Ventures, and Speedinvest.

We started in Spain, but climate change knows no borders. And neither will we. Want to know more? Please visit Sunhero.com .

What would you do working with us?

We are seeking an experienced Salesforce Developer with at least 18 months of experience working with Salesforce, APEX, and APIs. The successful candidate will have a proven track record of developing scalable software on Salesforce, and preferably have some experience in building efficient pipelines to work with Salesforce and code hosting platforms such as GitHub. Additionally, they will have experience integrating Salesforce with third-party apps and APIs.

To succeed in this role, you need to be an entrepreneur at heart. You are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done and openness for iterations and changes of course. You know that building a company means doing whatever works best for customers and partners and you are willing to roll up your sleeves to make this happen.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Cooperate with the Salesforce Product Manager to validate business requirements and any considerations (security, scalability, limits).
  • Develop custom User Interfaces, including Visualforce pages/Lightning pages, Aura Components, and Lightning Web Components.
  • Design and develop custom Salesforce solutions using Apex, Visualforce, and Lightning components.
  • Develop Flow solutions that can be maintained by business superusers.
  • Build efficient pipelines to work with Salesforce and code hosting platforms such as GitHub.
  • Integrate Salesforce with third-party apps and APIs.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
  • Troubleshoot and debug issues with Salesforce solutions.
  • Participate in code reviews and ensure adherence to best practices.
  • Collaborate with our development team to efficiently develop new features and fix ongoing issues.
  • Write clean and maintainable code that is easy to understand and reuse.
  • Help refactor existing APEX code base to optimize performance and scalability.
  • Test software to ensure responsiveness and efficiency.
  • Be able to autonomously work on all stages of software development; model, implementation, and delivery.

What would we need from you to be successful in this role?
  • At least 18 months of experience working with Salesforce, Apex, and REST APIs.
  • Experience building efficient pipelines to work with Salesforce and code hosting platforms such as GitHub (without using any external tool like Copado and similar) is a plus.
  • Experience with Salesforce Flow development.
  • Proficient with the Salesforce development lifecycle.
  • Ensure proper test coverage for all APEX code base.
  • Strong understanding of Salesforce architecture and data model.
  • Strong knowledge of git and git workflows.
  • Hands-on experience with DevOps practices.
  • Deep understanding of APIs and how they integrate with websites and applications.
  • Hands-on experience with TDD is a strong plus.
  • Used to work with Scrum agile principles and methodologies.
  • Experience integrating Salesforce with third-party apps and APIs.
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills.
  • Salesforce Developer certification is a plus.
  • Strong knowledge of computer theory, design, and architectural patterns and algorithms.
  • Previous experience in a tech startup is highly desirable.
  • A strong motivation to positively impact the planet and change the way people think about energy production.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.

This is a remote/hybrid position. You can work completely remotely if you prefer. We have a beautiful office in downtown Barcelona, where you are welcome to work if that suits you. We are hiring either a full-time employee (FTE) or a contractor for this role. If you are based in Germany or Spain, we can offer an FTE role. In case you are based outside these jurisdictions, we can offer a contractor position through Deel.

What perks you will find in Sunhero:
  • A meaningful job - we are driven by the desire to make a positive impact on our planet.
  • You will get the chance to deliver impact and shape the path of one of Southern Europe’s solar panel most promising startups.
  • A chance to work with and learn from an experience, diverse, inclusive, and international team. We are 19+ nationalities at Sunhero.
  • You will have a flexible working schedule that is based on ownership and autonomy of your role.
  • We are a working parent-friendly environment. 80% of our leadership are parents themselves.
  • If you are based in Barcelona and like to come to the office, we have a beautiful coworking space in the city center.
  • We are remote-first and our working hours are CET +/- 2.

Diversity & Inclusion

Diversity and inclusion are important to us, and we’re constantly working to improve these aspects. At Sunhero, we don’t just accept our differences, we fully support and celebrate them. We’re committed to equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, or gender identity or expression. We strive to be an equal-opportunity workplace.

Title: Statistical Analyst (Bangkok Based, Relocation Provided)
Description:
About Agoda




Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.




Get To Know The Team:




The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.




Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:




Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap
Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders




What you’ll Need to Succeed:




Bachelor’s degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study
0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company
Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g. SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence
Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently




It’s Great if you Have:




Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce
Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
Strong presentation and negotiation skills

Equal Opportunity Employer




At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.




We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .




To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
